content:
Posted: April 13
												I've recently got really into the NBA during the NFL off-season so thought I'd give this game a try. I got it for £9.50 (about $12) and I'm loving it so far. I've mainly played the MyCareer part of the game along with the MyGM. I also managed to get the NBA2K16 Companion App which works very well with this game, the extra VC from using it is very useful. I first started playing through the MyCareer using mouse and keyboard and really didn't like it so the next day I went and bought an Xbox360 wired controller (The afterglow one) and it made the game so much better. Special moves and tricks are much easier to perform with it and it just generally makes navigating menus so much easier. The graphics are nice. The players look great and gameplay is mostly smooth (only lags sometimes during the loading of the game during the pre-game show that plays before every match to keep you entertained while the game loads). The customisation of the player and the MyCourt is good. My only gripe is that during the MyCareer, you get to connect with NBA stars who give you rewards when you spend off days with them. Some of these rewards state you get a special jersey/shoe, which I (and many others by the looks of it) presumed you could wear, this is not the case. Some of them you can wear, but most are put on display in your MyCourt which, although looks nice, I think I would have liked the option to wear them. The actual story of MyCareer is... meh. It's very generic and some of it dosen't make for an authentic experience (yes, I'm talking about the fact that even if you are paper white, your parents and sister are still black) which feels odd. Also, I'm not too keen on the voice of your MyPlayer. I would have much preffered them to have a customisable voice which better represents you or what you want your MyPlayer to sound like. I heard quite bad things about the soundtrack for this game and, when I listened to it myself, it's not too bad, but, the thing that lets it down is that, as quite a large amount of the songs are censored, you often end up with lots of 'breaks' during each track as it is just muted out. Some songs have tonnes of censored words in which makes it even more annoying. The soundtrack is redeemed for me as it has some good songs on it such as 'Cult of Personality' which I was quite surprised by.    In conclusion, you would definatly benifit from having a controller with this game. The customisation of assests within the game is great, and once you get past the cutscene parts of MyCareer and start playing full seasons, it's really good (the 'story' part should only take about a few hours to complete so it's not bad). The NBA 2K16 Companion app is very much reccomended and it's fun to play when you're not at your PC. I would reccomend this game to anyone :)

The other characters say that the choice for certain things is all yours but in the end, Spike Lee makes the choices for you and you are just along for the long drawn out CGI movie of a story mode. I got it for half off so I can't complain about that too much but for $60, I don't think enough innovation has been made to justify that.

content:
Posted: September 26, 2015
												What do you get when you buy this game? The same exact game as last year. MyGM, MyLeague, and the rest of the modes are exactly the same right on down to the graphics in the data screens. The only difference is the MyCareer mode they did all the advertisement on with Spike Lee, but it's really really REALLY bad. Literally the worst♥♥♥♥♥♥ever. I had a feeling the Spike Lee thing would fail hard and it did. No choices at all for you to make in a mode that is supposed to be "MyCareer." Spike Lee wrote a script and they force your player down the road of his ill-written gibberish. They don't even allow you to choose the NBA team you begin your career on, taking away some of the freedom you had in the previous game. And the first 7 games you play in High School and College go 100% unrewarded. You don't get any gold to improve your player and drafted out of college you are the worst player in the NBA alongside being the worst rookie out of your draft class. The first NBA season of your career? Lasts 8 games. And you are rewarded with very little gold, forcing you towards microtransactions even harder in order to make your NBA player be able to compete with the rest of the League.This is the first game I'll request a refund from in my life on Steam. I'm disgusted and ashamed. 2k has really dropped the ball here.

content:
Posted: September 28, 2015
												This game is such a disappointment in terms of the MyCareer mode, I was so hyped leading up to release - I think people have vented that thoroughly, and I agree with them - so I'm not going to bash that aspect anymore.The other part of the problem for me are the bugs, crashes and overall tardiness of the game. For PC via steam, expect the game to crash.. a lot! My commentary regularly drops out, The scouting and assignment screen sometime just lingers without any actual report coming up, the halftime locker room is sooooo slow to progress, and you can't skip to the evaluation - it skips the whole lot. Trying to skip through timeouts, or substitutions is a nightmare, it takes FOREVER -  and a lot of the time you just have to suck it up and wait through the whole process before getting back to playing.I do however like the physics of the game, and even enjoy the new controls.. I generally play a big man and use a lot of post moves - so the post up trigger is really working for me. The controls do seem sluggish compared to 2k15, but it may just be the limits they have now put on responsiveness and speed for bigger players. Dunks seem to be easier to perform, my player even with a 55 rating was posterizing everyone. I also have fallen victim to purchasing the MJ special edition - and played my entire rookie season without any boosts or help with VC... still no indication on when my VC will come through - it's the 29th, I waited till release day.. still waiting. The game seems to rely, HEAVILY, and I mean HEAVILY on you PURCHASING VC.. the my NBA 2k16 phone app hasn't come out, opportunities to earn VC in other ways are limited... It just really sucks. especially after shelling out for the special edition.I would recommend everyone stay away from this game until they fix all the bugs. Most ppl are going to hate the MyCareer story I feel - If they fix all the gameplay bugs then the game may be worth purchasing on discount so you can play with your online friends. REFUND REQUESTED!

content:
Posted: August 29, 2016
												Seeing as how I have 850 hrs in 2k16, I feel I have played the game to warrant a full opinion and review on this product. This review will cover multiple aspects of the game, and will hopeufully serve as a guideline so that others can refer to it when necessary. With that being said, i'd like to stress that this review will focus heavily of the woes of the game, particularly for the PC audience. This review will cover 3 main topics: Gameplay, Gamemodes, and Community, as well as final comments and extra's. Each topic will then be scored out of 10, and at the bottom will be my conclusion as well as a TL;DR statement. Lets begin.Gameplay: While the game's movement system is flawed at times, for the most part your controlled character is able to move fluidly and resembles the real thing. In game controls differ slightly from previous 2k games, but its nothing you can't learn relatively quickly. In regards to animations, the game claimed that "you would never be locked into an animation again" but that is simply not the case. there are countless times when you go up for a dunk, but your character will just throw the ball across the backboard, resulting usually in the other team grabbing aan easy 2 points. Animations can somethimes go a bit wonky, but for the most part it looks good. the same options that are available in previous games are available, and the game can be customized to fit how you want to play. There have also been multiple patches to the game, most of which are needed to fix game breaking bugs (See reviews below regarding Win10 bug) the gameplay is solid, but it leaves a bit to be desired. my score for the gameplay would be a mediocre 6.5/10.Gamemodes and Online Functionality: NBA 2k16 features a plethora of gamemodes, each providing a different and fun experience... to console players. PC contains the same features that are present on console, however, with such a small player base, it is near impossible to find an online game in any mode other than MyPark. Modes like MyLeague (Previously Association), MyTeam, and Play Now Online all contain an online aspect, but it is barely played as there are not many players that aare participating ONLINE in those gamemodes. (These gamemodes are still fun in a local setting, but you are not playing 100% of the game) It is because of this lack of online functionality that I didnt fully enjoy my purchase. The gamemodes in 2k16 are great fun, earning an 8.5/10, but the online sections of the modes failed miserably, earning only a 2.5/10.Community: Many players within the community are extremely helpful, and some can offer great advice and have a strong opinion regarding the state of the game. The PC community is paricularly special as we don't condone ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t from devs.  if your game sucks, we will tell you.however ther is a section of the community that spols it for the majority, and that would be hackers and cheaters, of which there is a significant margin of players that do so. Hackers ruin the game for so many, an its a shame that they exist, but the main cause that they do is that the devs have a terrible anti-cheat system, sometimes even banning those that did not commit any sort of unjust act. in addition to hackers and cheaters, there are also scammers that will attempt to trade with another member of the community, just so they can cheat them out of a card. iit is because of these types of people that the community is not where it should be just yet, and why i have to give the community a 6.5/10.TL;DR: All in all, I would not recommend this game to anyone wanting to pickup a basketball sim. Rather, I would suggest you acquire this game by other means. If, at that point, you decide that you want to play modes such as MyTeam, and MyPark, even though they have a dwindling player base, then purchase. As of right now, this game is not for PC players, because it lacks suport in that area. I hope this review was able to inform potential buyers. Peace out ganstas.

content:

												NBA 2K16, on the PC.Well, its a amazing game.  I played NBA 2K since Iverson was on the cover.The graphics are amazing on this game.There's MyCareer, people are giving this alot of hate because if you make your Player white he still is sounding as an African American. I dont have any problems with this and I dont know why people are making a really big problem of this Just get over this. Are you playing 2K16 for the sound of your player? Or do you want to play some basketball. MyPark is good actually. I thougt that if you're playing on the PC, you will not find any players on the park. But there are some people. But I recommend you playing with friends. Ofcourse you can play with randoms, but I can guarentee you that you will rage. Since people dont pass and have no teamwork. And think that they are Stephen/Lebron or ma boi Paul George.Dont even think that you can hoop in my park alone and dont even pass to your teammate. Be a nice teammate and help each other and dont do things solo. If you want your Rep dropped. There are some annoying things in MyPark... 1. Its really hard to find a game if your a Rookie, since everyone just leaves if you join the 'next spot'. They think a rookie cant hoop.2. There is lag/glitches.3. This is my opinion but the taunting is really annoying, If you take a L ( Loss) on my park all your opponents are going to be in front of you and just taunting you. And you just have to accept it :(.MyTeam:What else can I say? its actually good really fun has a nice FIFA Ultimate Team feeling.Pro-Am: I never had a chance to play it on PC. But I played it on XBOX. The problem with Pro-Am is that its actually really hard to find some people when I join Pro-Am I just see 2 people. Or is that me? I'll update this when I get a chance to play it.You can customise everything.You can change your player from head to toe, you can even change your Court.PlayNow: What can I say?Performance: No problems,  some lag on MyPark and the other Online modes.Should you get it?:NBA 2K17 is coming out soon, and If I was you, just get this game cause if you really want a good basketball games just get this and play MyPark till 2K17 comes out. Dont even try Live 16. Just get this. At full price: No :(.Finisher:I give this game a 8/10, fix the glitches/lag 2K.

												MyCareer 2k15>2k16Ok, so I bought the game on the release. It didn't work. I couldn't play the game for atleast a month. I had to be in touch with the customer service with 3-4 diffenrent people which got annoying during time because I had to explain what I had done etc. to each person. The fault was 2Ks. They fixed the bugs after awhile so I could play and I was disapointed.I am playing MyCareer only and loved the nba 2k15 MyC, it was visually good, gameplay was fun and you could be the hero who made the shots that were ment to actually go in. This year I desided to make a Shooting Guard, who was just focused on shooting. My SG is now 81 overall, 85 shooting, 50layup, passing 40 or something.1. Shooting (85). I can't make any shots that are open. This shooter shouldn't be in the nba, fact. I haven't even tried to do contact shots since I can't even make open shots. (tried different animations Kobe, Klay and some free ones. Didn't have any impact. Simulation, default, casual doesn't matter. I tried if the sliders worked, nothing. And I'm playing on Superstar, im no rookie, HoF in 2k15)2. Layups. This guy should definetly not be in the nba. This guy misses every layup even on a fast break alone and he manages to miss a layup. 50 layup shouldn't be that critical on that point.3. Passing. Man I can make every pass. Don't boost your passing skill since it is useless. (Unless you want to make traffic lobs)4. Dripple. It's so sluggish. Dripple is extremely hard because the guy doesn't follow your controls at all. (Can be fixed with dirrenent animations, maybe? But if this is true, 2K, delete the rest of the animations because they are useless so stop making more of them)Spike Lee start off was kinda boring since it didn't have any inpact on the gameplay, just some random cutscenes.2K, You really don't have to make the game more "realistic" with the scoring % because it makes the game extremely unrealistic when you can't make buckets that even I would do under preassure and exhaustion. I don't even play basketball. 2k15 to 2k16 was just a cheese fix patch.If you are considering buying this game, don't do it. Online is fun but if you want to play MyCareer it will♥♥♥♥♥♥you the f off. 2k15 was great and I'm going to start playing that instead of this. Maybe 2k17 will be better, who knows? Listen to the community before you buy it though. I wasted my 50e and I actually regret it.NBA fan from Finland

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 1, 2016
												Ya know, after NBA 2k15 (which was IMO the best basketball game made in a long time) I was very excited for this game.  I read the reviews, which a lot of them were negative.  Well, I have major regrets that I didn't listen to the reviews.  THIS GAME IS FLAT OUT HORRIBLE!!!  It seems like the devolopers spent all their time on the story portition & no time at all on the actual game play of the game.  The game play is just awful!  The players move very slow, which means you will lose your guy on defense very easliy (even in turbo mode).  The controller settings are a little different from 2k15, so you'll have to get used to them.  When you pick your player on the court, it feels like you're a robot & not a player.  NBA 2k15 was much different.  You felt like an actual player on the court and were a part of the game, not just some robot running around (slowly) not doing much.  I was going to return it, but I thought maybe I was being to critical, so I gave it more and more chances.  Now I can't return it, and I will most likely go back to NBA 2k15.  This pisses me off, because I want the roster to be up to date, but I guess I gotta sacrafice a new roster for better (a lot better) gameplay.  I don't know what the developers were thinking releasing this crap.  Next time I'm going to listen to the reviews...  ;(

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 4, 2016
												Overall, I enjoyed NBA 2K16.I played NBA 2K13 on my WII and I was amazed, but 2K did much more in NBA 2K16.My Player-The story is okay, which is different from most reviewers that hated the story. I liked the aspect of having a family and all, but, I'm not a racist or anything, you don't choose the color of your family. My character's color is different from his family. Also, you can only play 8 games in your rookie season. However, you do get to play in high school and college.My Team-I never played My Team on NBA 2K13 on my WII because it wasn't a feature. I did like My Team, but it encourages people to spend more money to get better players. It challenged me because I don't have a controller so no perfect releases for me. It was good, though. I do have a terrible team, but it is a money grabber.My GM/My League-I don't know how many of you watch CSB YT, but I do. I really have wanted to "rebuild" teams in NBA 2K16. I'm an avid basketball fan, so I was really excited. It's easy to do but it is very fun and creative to give you a simulation of what it is like to be an owner of a team. Who should you sign? Who should you trade? Who should you draft? Etc. I really enjoyed My GM/My League.Play Now-I liked Play Now. I enjoyed playing as my favorite teams online against other people and their favorite teams. I notice that most people choose the Cavaliers or the Warriors, but I like playing as low seeded playoff teams or non-playoff teams like the Bulls and the Jazz.Online-Heck yeah! Online is great! I was able to download new rosters, new draft classes, and was able to play online cleanly! You could do a lot online!Overall Score-This game was very good. It's not a 10/10 game, but I would rate it 9/10! Very enjoyable and fun!

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 30, 2015
												This game is huge. There are lots of different things to do, different playmodes, everything from single player to multiplayer, to fantasy draft teams and realistic seasons.EDIT: I am changing this review into a negative one, because a recent patch to fix an exploit broke the player icons, where they stopped showing. It is now impossible to do icon passing, pick and rolls and other passing as there are no icons indicating which player you are emphasizing on. Actually game-breaking.Why I like it the most is that it seems as a realistic simulation of a basketball game. It's hard, but in a rewarding way. You can learn and get better: there are tactics to take care of, learn how various players play best, practice complex offense and defence strategies, learn how to do combos to score. There are seemingly endless possibilities, and the customization of every single match-up seems endless, if that is what you want. The story part of the game is a little weird though: you can customize your character, but no matter what, you will have a twin sister who is black. If you chose a different race, it can take away some of the immersion..The game crashes a few times in the menus, and a few of the cut-scenes were a bit laggy. But the game plays smoothly and fine, and I haven't experienced anything game-breaking. Note that it is absolutely essential to play with controller. It also works really well to do local coop with two controllers. I suggest it to every basketball fan, without any doubts.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 12, 2016
												Honestly here's my advice... wait for 2K17 and hope for the best...Or buy 2K15 for dirt cheap. At this point 2K16 isn't worth it.Here's why:-It's buggy... to put it simply, it has more performance problems than the previous year-Commentators cut out randomly in games, music sometimes plays and sometimes doesn't, and honsetly... while I'm talking about music... the playlist is pretty weak at points-The players respond to your actions and commands soooo slowly... you flick the stick right and ♥♥♥♥ing curry responds like hes stuck in the mud or he's as quick as my 92 year old great grandmother. -Btw I love the spin move. This game will make you dislike it, loathe it, hateeeee it because of how slowly it responds. -Shot timing is considerably slower and harder to get used to then on a console-2K added cool features for this year's game, but then cut tons of corners in places like arena design and other things -The Spike Lee career mode story was cool, interesting to follow, sure, but I have two major problems. One: (nobody go and cry about this now it's a fact) the story mode is designed and intended only for a black audience. Typical Spike Lee ladies and gents. I understand exactly why he was chosen to do this, but cmon. There's a huge audience that gets the story mode ruined for them because it makes no sense at all. I've got a pastey white, blonde-haired girly boy point guard who has a ghetto twin sister and speaks like DMX taught him the language. Second major problem with the career mode: IT SKIPS THE ♥♥♥♥ING ROOKIE SEASON. Any player development, records, acheivements, personal accomplishments, forget it, all of it gets condensed into 8 unfulfilling games. The game lets you play 8 games of your rookie season while bouncing back and fourth between the games and the Spike Lee story. The Career mode is amazing after the stupid Spike Lee distraction is over. I ould have a much less sour opinion if it didn't bite a chunk out of the actual game...

content:
Posted: August 16, 2016
												First of all, gameplay-wise this game is excellent. Control over the gameplay feels smooth and especially playing with friends is great fun. The problems are mostly with the online experience and support for PC..I'm not going to go into the problems the game has had during launch and all, but will focus on the current issue - This game does not work with Windows 10 Anniversary Update. I have over 300 hours played with Windows 10 x64, but after the Anniversary Update NBA 2K16 stopped working (every other game remains unaffected by the update). The support from 2K to PC players remains awful (you can see that if you browse any discussion related to this issue), so I assume I will not get to play this game ever again since 2K17 is going to be released soon. And I'm afraid to buy that game because of how badly 2K supports PC players :(e. THE ISSUE WITH WINDOWS 10 HAS BEEN FIXED! A positive surprise from 2K that they actually did fix it. This is not enough for me to recommend this game on PC though, because this has not been the only problem with the game. Move your gaze to 2K17, hoping it will have better functionality on PC.

content:
Posted: September 26, 2015
												Having been a huge NBA 2K fan (I have put in more than 100 hours into each iteration for the past 6 years), this years is a HUGE disappointment.  The new soap opera that is My Player is beyond corny and unrelatable.  The one thing that this games is supposed to be about is basketball, however in the first season I was only allowed to play 8 games and had what felt like 3 hours of unwatchable cutscenes.  The lack of playing has left my player still in the 50's as I am unable to improve the player if I can't play with him.  I've only played this game for a handful of hours but I am ready to uninstall and spend my time on something that I will actually enjoy.  I kept coming back to this series due to the MyPlayer mode, however this year you have the least control over your player and they made it a joke.  Unless this changes goodbye NBA 2K.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 26, 2015
												A really fun game to play with friends or solo. However, this is probably the 3rd or 4th year in a row that 2k has had release issues with the VC purchases not working at all as well as the pre-order extra VC not being added. The graphics are amazing on the PC and the modes are fun. BUT, it is sad to see 2k fall short and not be 100% ready on launch day. We pre-ordered for a reason and paid for services that have not yet been provided by the mfg... some might call that fraud. I am hoping that 2k will resolve this issue quickly, if not it might be time to go back to NBA live or stock to playing a college title. My recommend is yes/no. 												Wellcome to the bad ports of 2015 "the home stretch". -bad optimization-Cheats/hackers-Buggy buggy buggy beta.-my career controversy.-TL;DR; Bad port, buggy, bad servers, dont buy until patch or serious saleIts not new for nba2k to value PC gamers the least. We get almost no support, no online control to stop the 99cheats. Dodgy servers and from nba2k15 they started to Optimize the game for pc pretty awefull. I am running a pretty deasent geforce gtx 970 4gigs, i5 cpu, 8gigs ram gaming rig. This game tanks with standard settings, you have to go in turn of vsync super sample, and buffering to get something playable (still hard to maintain that 60fps). That combined alot of people are reporting crashed and freezing games with loss of progression. I myself are having a lovely bug that a reinstall wont fix, where i have no commentators after 1min of play every quater, and sometimes the crowd goes away also, it gets a bit... silent on them 12min quaters. Lastly alot of people is complaining about mycareer being diffrent, the big issue here is that the story is designed for this 1 specifik guy, and not you. They could have easely made it so that you family changed race depending on you, made you choose your own nickname.. all that said and done, the player progression and ranking on winning highschool games, to get diffrent scholarships, and playing well in colledge to get draftet higher is one of the best way the game has handled the preseasen i think. and after your rookie season you get the nba2k16 mycareer with alot more features, so concluding that mycareer is the best it has ever been, but 2k needs to know that a movie directer, havent got a clue what makes a story good for a video game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 29, 2016
												NBA 2K16 is definitely one of my favorite basketball games of all time. I'm a big NBA game fan, but I stuck to mostly NBA Live up until NBA Live 15 on Xbox One (extremely disappointing) so I never touched 2K until 2K14. However, this is basketball simulation at it's finest, with high quality animations, textures, lighting, sound, and more. It makes NBA Live look like chump change. Graphics:Best I've ever seen in any SPORTS game, and I'm big into sports titles. The aforementioned NBA Live, NHL, Madden, MLB The Show, etc. don't stack up to what Visual Concepts was able to accomplish. I'm playing the game with everything maxxed out with 4xMSAA and it runs fantastic at 1080p/60fps on an i5-2320/R9 390 gaming rig. I especially love the sweat effects and jerseys realistically bouncing off the player.Sound:I love the sounds in this game. The way the ball bounces is just oddly satisfying every time, and you have the crowd, music, and announcer ambience that go with a realistic NBA presentation (more on this later). This soundtrack is arguably one of the best you'll ever hear. You have a blend of select tracks by DJ Khaled, DJ Mustard, and DJ Premier and I love the tracks, especially "We Takin Over", "Bugatti", and "All I Do Is Win". Makes modes like MyGM and MyTeam feel more "baller".Gameplay:As I said, it's the finest basketball simulation that you'll ever play. You can't just drive to the basket every time and make it 100% of the time, you have to work for it. Strategy is actually decently implemented into this game, and like in real life even if you get a "perfect shot", you still have the potential to miss it. Defense is strange though, I can have Steph Curry block someone like Roy Hibbert, so minus points on that.Presentation:NBA 2K16 is very true to life like when you watch a broadcast on TNT. You have Ernie Johnson, Shaq, and Kenny Smith on the pre, half-time, and post game shows and their chemistry is fantastic, as in real life. Arenas look the way they should, and the cheerleaders are a nice addition. Additional Game Modes:MyGM is still really fun as always, plus the new soundtrack on top makes it even better than last years. You need to take your team to the NBA Finals and win, while staying under budget and keeping fans, staff, and players happy at the same time.MyCareer is great, yet the name is really misleading this year. It's not "MyCareer", it's "FrequencyVibrationsCareer". Spike Lee tells an excellent story through this, and all the actors have great chem with each other (especially Freq, his twin sister, and best friend). However, it would have been nice if they included even a stripped down version of last year's "MyCareer" so you can write your own story.MyTeam is just your standard card based game where you need to build the best team possible and be the best in the world. Nothing too much to write home about, just like Ultimate Team.I didn't really touch MyPark or MyProAm, so I can't tell you much on that. Closing Thoughts:When the game first came out, I was afraid to purchase the game because I heard tons of negative things about it (optimization, realism inaccuracies, weird defensive balancing, etc.) However, it was in a Humble Bundle so I spent a couple extra dollars to get it. NBA 2K16 is definitely a game worth getting, especially if you're into simulation or sports kinds of games. I give NBA 2K16 a 9/10.

												You know what I’m not even gonna be nice to this game. The story line makes no sense, the characters are dull and annoying, people keep calling your character Freq which makes you feel like you’re not playing as yourself but some dumb ♥♥♥♥ guy with a dumb ♥♥♥♥ nickname. Your whole rookie season is practically wasted, Vic and his crazy idiocy just makes me want to punch my monitor. Your character’s sister is ♥♥♥♥ing annoying, she wants to control everything, she even called Freq’s girlfriend a GOLD DIGGER when she herself is making money off her brother. Speaking of Freq’s family, they are all ♥♥♥♥ing black and so if your character is white you’ll have a ♥♥♥♥ing twin sister who’s black, what were they thinking? When you go from college to pro you’re agent kept talking like you had a choice to stay in college if you want to. The cut scene ends with Freq saying I’ll think about it but next, BAM you’re in the ♥♥♥♥ing NBA draft. This year’s draft was horrible they just went through it with pictures of the drafted players. Then everybody around you keep talking about how Vic is a bad influence but they don’t give us a choice to continue to be friends with Vic, they ♥♥♥♥ing killed him off for Christ sake, what’s the point of those cut scenes then? There was one scene where Freq had a long talk with Vic in the car and NOTHING ♥♥♥♥ing happened! They talked a lot of♥♥♥♥♥♥which ended so awkwardly and makes you feel like what the ♥♥♥♥ have I just watched for 10 minutes??? WHAT THE HELL HAPPENED? Everything about this story sucks! Most importantly how are some people ok with that ♥♥♥♥ing Frequency Vibration ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t? I thought this is supposed to me MyCareer, all we got was a ♥♥♥♥ing Freq Career or some horse♥♥♥♥♥♥ I had absolutely no ♥♥♥♥ing say for my character. I’ll be honest this is the WORST MyCareer I have ever seen! To sum up, the entire story was nothing but lama♥♥♥♥♥♥talk, the characters were boring and ♥♥♥♥ing annoying, the cut scenes were so long and pointless, the ending was that your ♥♥♥♥ing friend died from a car crash. What is Spike Lee trying to say? 	Aside from the story, the gameplay in MyCAREER sucks as well, you start off as pretty good player in high school, then in college you might start experiencing some difficulties to play as good, then in the NBA you’re a complete ♥♥♥♥-tard who has a 55 overall rating. I had to redo the game, buy a lot of VC and boost up my player to about an 80 overall. I play as a 6’8 small forward and holy♥♥♥♥♥♥I can only max out my speed to a 70. Like really bruh 70, Kevin Durant’s way taller than 6’8 and he don’t run that slow. ♥♥♥♥ing 70 man how am I suppose to chase down a fast break or something. One ♥♥♥♥ing thing, I had this 80 rating before my first high school game. And in high school and college I was fast, but after I got into the NBA I suddenly became slow as ♥♥♥♥, what the ♥♥♥♥ is wrong with the people who made this game. How can a player suddenly decrease so much speed when they transit to pro, where’s the logic. And ♥♥♥♥ if you’re teammate is wearing then number you want to wear you can’t ♥♥♥♥ing wear it like previous installments. 	2K, I have never been so let down and♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥playing your game. I am writing this review because I’ve been playing since 2K7 and I really have NEVER EVER EVER been so disappointed. content:
Posted: February 16, 2016
												I've played it in the free weekend, and I have to say it's a lot more fun than I had expected.Yes there are some bugs. For example I got stuck in the sub bench when there was a goal scored and my player ran of field. I glitched myself out and luckily my team was attacking, else we would've been a man short defending which is a big problem with basketball. Gameplay is really good, although I really don't get the hang of the defending and good dribbles. But that is probably my own mistake by being not experienced with these NBA games for a long time. Also I didn't play with actual teams a lot, and started out with a self made player. So that's probably a big factor as well.The story line in my career is pretty fun, but I got really tired over the pre game shows and after shows. First few times it's not that bothering, unless you play a few hours after each other. Yes it is nice when they talk about you, but I just want to play. All in all I think people who like basketball will like this game as well. I think the biggest bugs are solved(?), since the sub bench thing only happened at the start of the play and then never again. Didn't really experience any major bugs further or crashes. So yeah, I'd reccommend this game if you're a basketball fan, if not you should wait for the next sale.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 16, 2016
												I've played it in the free weekend, and I have to say it's a lot more fun than I had expected.Yes there are some bugs. For example I got stuck in the sub bench when there was a goal scored and my player ran of field. I glitched myself out and luckily my team was attacking, else we would've been a man short defending which is a big problem with basketball. Gameplay is really good, although I really don't get the hang of the defending and good dribbles. But that is probably my own mistake by being not experienced with these NBA games for a long time. Also I didn't play with actual teams a lot, and started out with a self made player. So that's probably a big factor as well.The story line in my career is pretty fun, but I got really tired over the pre game shows and after shows. First few times it's not that bothering, unless you play a few hours after each other. Yes it is nice when they talk about you, but I just want to play. All in all I think people who like basketball will like this game as well. I think the biggest bugs are solved(?), since the sub bench thing only happened at the start of the play and then never again. Didn't really experience any major bugs further or crashes. So yeah, I'd reccommend this game if you're a basketball fan, if not you should wait for the next sale.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 2, 2016
												Just like every other 2K they make strides in some areas and then make dumb decisions in other areas. They felt the need to redo the passing and changed the input for the controller and made most of the buttons passes. After a couple hrs you get used to this one. The one that most people hate is the pick and rolls in this game. Man did they mess up. 80% of the time of getting a teammate to set a pick messes up. Half the time the ballhander will get free but fumble and pick up his dribble. The other half of the time the player coming to set the screen completely misses the defender and then just blocks the driving lane. The amount of changes that made the game better are completely overshadowed by the mistakes they made. It still is fun like every year, but i have almost broke my controller a dozen times by wanting to throw it against a wall after stuff happens in the game. Lastly the thing that i hate the most at the moment is how broken the paint play is at the moment. The amount of time your front court lets passes get past them for an easy layup is ridiculous. I give up more than half my points because of this even though i tell them to protect the paint and make them sit down in the post. Verdict: only buy if it is under $20 otherwise you will hate yourself for paying full price for this.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 2, 2016
												EDIT: i just wanna add that the reason the game is designed the way it is is so that users get frustrated and end up spending real money on in-game credits called Virtual Currency to help upgrade their in-game teams and players. today this is a very common method in the gaming industry. it facilitates the siphoning of extra money out of consumers. they prey on the young and on those with disposable income who are not too proud to pay to win. sadly, improving your players' skills with VC does not necessarily imrpove your winning record or the game's fun. sincere advice: if you are unfortunate enough to have purchased this, then whatever you do, do NOT EVER purchase VC. it would be giving in to 2k's predatory business tactics and you can earn VC by playing the game (trust me, don't play the game). as gamers, we have to come together if we want to stop these actions by boycotting microtransactions and games that seek to make microtransactions necessary to fully enjoy the game. successful microtransaction sales result in innovation-free, content-free half-games like this because developers start to think that they really don't have to put as much effort into their products in order to yield satisfactory profits.would you go to a movie thater which had coin slots at the seats and asked you to put in a dollar for better sound, and another dollar to continue watching beyond the 60 minute mark, etc?terrible game. my friend and i have been playing it for a few weeks and it is extremely dissatisfyng mostly because it uses bad AI to cheat you out of certain(most) games. it has many problems that can make you want to break your computer. for example, when the CPU possesses the ball, it can handle it anywhere and the ball will noclip through any object necessary for it to complete the scripted play and score points. yet, when the player has the ball, he will lose it any time it collides with any part of an opponent's body. the cpu has a good chance (FEELS like 60% and in certain games more like 70%) to make any shot from anywhere, but in order for you to make a shot you must have no opponent within 6 feet of you AND make a perfect/near-perfect shot release, or be very lucky. i can(could, before i uninstalled) make about 1 in 20 shots that dont meet those criteria. the cpu constantly pulls off magic johnson/rondo-style acrobatic passes from everyday point guards like trey burke. but if the player tries to make a good, normal chest or bounce pass then there is a chance your target will quickly move into the way of a defender, forcing a turnover (this is a self-proclaimed "sim game" PUNISHING players for making a good real-life basketball decision). on the other side of the same token, the AI is just so bad overall that your best option on offence is often to pass it straight into a bigman in the middle of the paint despite traffic. the CPU defence can anticipate every dribble move and lead pass you make, but chuck it into the key where all the defenders are and you'll probably get an assist. you have very little control over your successes/failures especially in the higher difficulties. mycareer is unplayable because any team mate of yours that is controlled by the cpu suddenly has a very low IQ, will run out of bounds, leave assignments(very prominent and game-breaking), take stupid shots or refuse to take/fail to make great shots, however the opposing AI is usually psychic and is able to react to your actions immediately (it simply reads the button inputs, it feels like when you control your player you are controlling the opposition at the same time). yeah the game doesnt look that bad, but thats where the praises stop; theres a bunch of gimmicky BS in the game like a shoe creator, a bunch of corporate endorsement-inspired activities, (by the way 2k youre not fooling anyone, this adds nothing to the game gameplay-wise so its a cheap, blatant wat to start stuffing advertisements into our  games, like seriously how much more money does 2k need) and that stupid new mycareer thing they call a "movie" which basically only forces you to watch/skip through annoying cutscenes and to be this stupid personality, giving you minimal life choices, completely destroying the immersion aspect of mycareer mode(the only thing that made it more fun than a reguar exhibition match) and is an eyesore of a stain on spike lee's legacy. the voice acting is awful, cutscenes look like an xbox/ps2 gen game(i thought cutscenes were supposed to look better than the gameplay, wtf??), and the script overall is just meaningless and painfully cliche.its really clear that 2k is just trying to sell $60+++ updated rosters every year and the quality of their releases doesnt mean much to them as long as theyre raking in the bucks. year after year 2k has failed to produce an impressive simulation game. 2k10 had me intrigued with its innovative myplayer mode at the time, but 6 years later this is a monumental disappointment. seriously, in terms of realism and AI this is on par with previous 2ks and the maddens of the early 2000s, only more frustrating because even if you anticipate every action of the cpu it doesnt matter because, if it has to, the game will basically make your player move like each of his feet are submerged in 3 gallons of wet cement. (yes thats another thing i forgot to add, if you manage to outsmart the cpu it'll just heavily slow you down and delay your control inputs)i could rant about this maddeningly pathetic excuse for a sim game forever but ill just stop here by saying i really regret this purchase, but i am relieved that  got it during the summerr sale for only $12.

content:
Posted: July 5, 2016
												By far the best basketball (for me even sports game) there is. The controls are easy to learn but hard to master, the animations are realistic (sometimes buggy but that's no big deal) and the graphics are really good. Skilling your player and playing with your favourite team in the MyCareer mode can be big fun, even though sometimes the rating system can sometimes enrage you if that is something important to you. You can change the looks and style of your player and you can even design your own court. MyPark and playing with friends in general is extreme fun, either online and offline. Pro:-good sounds, graphics, animations      -multiplayer is much fun      -progressing in the career mode is encouraging af      -you can change almost everything cosmetics wise      -good and long soundtrack with famous songs such as "0 to 100" from DrakeCon:-keyboard controls are quite bad (as they are in every sportsgame)       (-short career mode (not that important))       -the rating system in the top right corner is sometimes pretty unfair All in all a 8/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 26, 2015
												I was thinking whether to give the game a positive or a negative vote.  I've played a lot of basketball simulations and in this case, NBA 2k16 is certainly one of the, if not THE best game ever to be released. Why the hesitation, then, u might ask. Well, 3 months have passed since the release of the game and it's the first time when it's fully playable (in my terms).  What's happenned? Looks like 2K Sports decided to give us an incomplete product and made us pay for the beta-testing of it. I'm pretty mad about this fact, and I'm not sure if I wanna' do it again. Probably not. Not to be baseless, I'll give you some examples of my negative experience with the game:-invisible players, not allowing me to do almost anything against them since their actions are unpredictable(on- and offline)-fps drops-sound stopping in the middle of the game, not returning at all, or after a few quarters-lots of connection problems with the servers-black, instead of colourful floors of the arenas, 3pt line not visible-gameplay things like still being defended hardly after passing the rival in animation.And I haven't even played the MyCareer and other modes than Exhibition, as I'm not that much interested in them, so I've got no clue how many errors are awaiting me in there. After all, the gameplay is really, really nice (but that's what we got used to when playing 2k sport games). Nonetheless, this is the first time when those errors have occurred, and I suppose I can't give the game a positive vote. Maybe next year. Maybe...

content:
Posted: August 2, 2016
												EDIT: i just wanna add that the reason the game is designed the way it is is so that users get frustrated and end up spending real money on in-game credits called Virtual Currency to help upgrade their in-game teams and players. today this is a very common method in the gaming industry. it facilitates the siphoning of extra money out of consumers. they prey on the young and on those with disposable income who are not too proud to pay to win. sadly, improving your players' skills with VC does not necessarily imrpove your winning record or the game's fun. sincere advice: if you are unfortunate enough to have purchased this, then whatever you do, do NOT EVER purchase VC. it would be giving in to 2k's predatory business tactics and you can earn VC by playing the game (trust me, don't play the game). as gamers, we have to come together if we want to stop these actions by boycotting microtransactions and games that seek to make microtransactions necessary to fully enjoy the game. successful microtransaction sales result in innovation-free, content-free half-games like this because developers start to think that they really don't have to put as much effort into their products in order to yield satisfactory profits.would you go to a movie thater which had coin slots at the seats and asked you to put in a dollar for better sound, and another dollar to continue watching beyond the 60 minute mark, etc?terrible game. my friend and i have been playing it for a few weeks and it is extremely dissatisfyng mostly because it uses bad AI to cheat you out of certain(most) games. it has many problems that can make you want to break your computer. for example, when the CPU possesses the ball, it can handle it anywhere and the ball will noclip through any object necessary for it to complete the scripted play and score points. yet, when the player has the ball, he will lose it any time it collides with any part of an opponent's body. the cpu has a good chance (FEELS like 60% and in certain games more like 70%) to make any shot from anywhere, but in order for you to make a shot you must have no opponent within 6 feet of you AND make a perfect/near-perfect shot release, or be very lucky. i can(could, before i uninstalled) make about 1 in 20 shots that dont meet those criteria. the cpu constantly pulls off magic johnson/rondo-style acrobatic passes from everyday point guards like trey burke. but if the player tries to make a good, normal chest or bounce pass then there is a chance your target will quickly move into the way of a defender, forcing a turnover (this is a self-proclaimed "sim game" PUNISHING players for making a good real-life basketball decision). on the other side of the same token, the AI is just so bad overall that your best option on offence is often to pass it straight into a bigman in the middle of the paint despite traffic. the CPU defence can anticipate every dribble move and lead pass you make, but chuck it into the key where all the defenders are and you'll probably get an assist. you have very little control over your successes/failures especially in the higher difficulties. mycareer is unplayable because any team mate of yours that is controlled by the cpu suddenly has a very low IQ, will run out of bounds, leave assignments(very prominent and game-breaking), take stupid shots or refuse to take/fail to make great shots, however the opposing AI is usually psychic and is able to react to your actions immediately (it simply reads the button inputs, it feels like when you control your player you are controlling the opposition at the same time). yeah the game doesnt look that bad, but thats where the praises stop; theres a bunch of gimmicky BS in the game like a shoe creator, a bunch of corporate endorsement-inspired activities, (by the way 2k youre not fooling anyone, this adds nothing to the game gameplay-wise so its a cheap, blatant wat to start stuffing advertisements into our  games, like seriously how much more money does 2k need) and that stupid new mycareer thing they call a "movie" which basically only forces you to watch/skip through annoying cutscenes and to be this stupid personality, giving you minimal life choices, completely destroying the immersion aspect of mycareer mode(the only thing that made it more fun than a reguar exhibition match) and is an eyesore of a stain on spike lee's legacy. the voice acting is awful, cutscenes look like an xbox/ps2 gen game(i thought cutscenes were supposed to look better than the gameplay, wtf??), and the script overall is just meaningless and painfully cliche.its really clear that 2k is just trying to sell $60+++ updated rosters every year and the quality of their releases doesnt mean much to them as long as theyre raking in the bucks. year after year 2k has failed to produce an impressive simulation game. 2k10 had me intrigued with its innovative myplayer mode at the time, but 6 years later this is a monumental disappointment. seriously, in terms of realism and AI this is on par with previous 2ks and the maddens of the early 2000s, only more frustrating because even if you anticipate every action of the cpu it doesnt matter because, if it has to, the game will basically make your player move like each of his feet are submerged in 3 gallons of wet cement. (yes thats another thing i forgot to add, if you manage to outsmart the cpu it'll just heavily slow you down and delay your control inputs)i could rant about this maddeningly pathetic excuse for a sim game forever but ill just stop here by saying i really regret this purchase, but i am relieved that  got it during the summerr sale for only $12.

												Positives of NBA 2K16...ummmm...some of the music is okay...Negatives of NBA 2k16. The story is mundane at best, it's meant to be gripping and draw you in, personally found it boring and more of an inconvience since I could of been playing a match(Thankfully you can skip them).Not much of a graphically update from 2K15 slighty better but not by much, gameplay is pretty much the same from 2K15 not many major tweaks but now you can miss wide open lay ups (hurray), Myteam is literally a carbon copy from... you guessed it 2K15 (seeing a pattern yet?) Mypark is Mypark you have to have a certain build and badges and stats to do anything, oh yea and if you're a rookie no one will play on your team (in some cases no one gets on till the rookie, gets off) extremely grindy for badges the game really doesn't like new player's since the higher rank you are the more benefits you get on court like higher steal rate, shooting and such, no one for new player's to really enjoy MyparkOverall I believe this game to be hardly worth the £40 or £60 price tag but if you really want it get it when it's on sale.

content:
Posted: October 4, 2015
												Coming from someone who put around 600 hours into 2k15, NBA2k16 is the best and most complete sports game I have ever played. It has it's bugs and issues, but it is the most real to life version of NBA 2k ever.PROS-2k did a great job this year of reducing the "cheese" in every way (It is VERY hard to draw charges, run baseline for an easy 2, or pull up for a contested 3 and knock it down for example)-You feel like you are in complete control of your players much more than last year, mainly because you rarely are ever stuck in animations-It isn't easy to score. This might sound bad, but this makes the game so much better. As I'm sure some people remember in 2k15, RT+X to the basket or shooting a 3 with any half decent 3pt shooter gave you a free basket.-Excellent graphics, the best looking sports game I have ever seen.-Fluid and varied gameplay, overall fun to play with many different modes, difficulties, and playstyles-Much better connection to servers/lag issues than previous years-Music/overall atmosphere- pregame/postgame show with Shaq, Ernie, and Kenny is great. The music is a wide variety of genres and cultures, mainly hip-hop and rap however so if you arent into that kind of music you can turn it off-Lots of settings/options, very customizeable and in some gamemodes you can even adjust gameplay sliders (percentage of 3's going in for example)-VERY ACCURATE RATINGS. This is so important, because many cards last year had extremely over-boosted ratings, which contributed a lot to the "cheese"CONS-Some framerate issues, especially in cutscenes, but I have a 750 ti and I'm doing fine framerate wise with some medium, some high settings-"BE THE STORY" except all you do in mycareer is follow the exact storyline Spike Lee has laid out for you, rarely being able to ever make your own decisions-Sometimes the game can be frusturating, players missing wide open shots when it seems like you should make it or things like that-Lots of bugs unrelated to gameplay, cards having the wrong ratings (Rookie vince carter has the same ratings as the 15+years later vince carter) and other things like that, but im sure these will be fixedOverall- 9/10, I really recommend this game to anyone who remotely enjoys basketball, I don't watch the NBA all that much but I love me some 2k.

content:
Posted: June 11, 2016
												Let me start off by saying the reviews for this game are really unfair. Yes MyCareer has flaws but not enough to cause all these negative reviews. (I just started playing on PC, I've played console mostly) Here are the pros and cons imo.Pros1. Graphics look amazing. I have a 400$ laptop and if not for my screen resolution the game would look really nice. I have to run it on fairly low settings though.2. Gameplay out of this world.3. Presentation is just so good. Feels like a real NBA game when playing.4. So many customizable options. MyGm allows relocation and customizable stadiums with tons of options. You can even create your own shoe. The amount of options are almost over the top.5. Gamemodes are fantastic. MyCareer lets you play as an actual college team and play in the 2015 NCAA Championship against Wisconsin (and they have Kaminsky and Dekker lol)Cons1. You are basically forced to be black in MyCareer. Your Family and biological twin sister are black. And if you do choose a white character it looks kinda wierd.2. You are called Freq all the time and on game commentary. It would be nice if we could choose between a few nicknames at least. (I get that if you were called by your players name, it would be hard technologically speaking.3. 8 Games your Rookie season in MyCareer. Worst part of the entire game. Forget about impressing as a rookie. 2k forces you to sim most of the games. Pathetic thought process by 2k. 4. Your stats are terrible to start out with. During high school and college you are hyped to be the next NBA allstar. However, you enter the league as an 57 overall. Makes no sense.5. MyCareer in general. I still find it as a fun gamemode just because I like sports but I can see why people hate it. (Plus I have a low attention span to stick out through full games.In conclusion, as long as MyCareer isn't the only reason you play the game, there are still so many more options and gamemodes. My personal favorite is MyGm.

content:
Posted: June 11, 2016
												Let me start off by saying the reviews for this game are really unfair. Yes MyCareer has flaws but not enough to cause all these negative reviews. (I just started playing on PC, I've played console mostly) Here are the pros and cons imo.Pros1. Graphics look amazing. I have a 400$ laptop and if not for my screen resolution the game would look really nice. I have to run it on fairly low settings though.2. Gameplay out of this world.3. Presentation is just so good. Feels like a real NBA game when playing.4. So many customizable options. MyGm allows relocation and customizable stadiums with tons of options. You can even create your own shoe. The amount of options are almost over the top.5. Gamemodes are fantastic. MyCareer lets you play as an actual college team and play in the 2015 NCAA Championship against Wisconsin (and they have Kaminsky and Dekker lol)Cons1. You are basically forced to be black in MyCareer. Your Family and biological twin sister are black. And if you do choose a white character it looks kinda wierd.2. You are called Freq all the time and on game commentary. It would be nice if we could choose between a few nicknames at least. (I get that if you were called by your players name, it would be hard technologically speaking.3. 8 Games your Rookie season in MyCareer. Worst part of the entire game. Forget about impressing as a rookie. 2k forces you to sim most of the games. Pathetic thought process by 2k. 4. Your stats are terrible to start out with. During high school and college you are hyped to be the next NBA allstar. However, you enter the league as an 57 overall. Makes no sense.5. MyCareer in general. I still find it as a fun gamemode just because I like sports but I can see why people hate it. (Plus I have a low attention span to stick out through full games.In conclusion, as long as MyCareer isn't the only reason you play the game, there are still so many more options and gamemodes. My personal favorite is MyGm.

content:
Posted: June 30, 2016
												Graphics 10/10Sound 10/10Thats about it, if you actually want to play a game, this is not it.  This game is worse than most basketball games i played back in the early 2000's.  They players move like a giant cube with an animation stuck into it.  Its like the first time someone tries to use a game make for the first time and makes a circle collide with a square.  In this game you cannot make your player walk next to another, its just not possible, you will be stuck against an invisible object.But all that is dwarfed by the impressively large input lag.  I'm not talking about the time it takes for the instruction to go from my controller and be recognised by the game, nope, i'm talking about the animation almost a second long that must happen before your character actually does seomthing.you want to shoot, wait a second.you want to move forward, wait a second.you want to steal the ball, wait a few seconds.you want to change direction, wait a secondetc, you get the point.Its annoyingly hard to get your character to stand near the 3 point line because you can't slightly move, you either run, walk, or stand still.. no variable movement at all, its just isn't in the game.There are camera issues and glitches that i could not be bothered explaining.Also, there are far too many unskippable cutscenes, for series that used to excel at being a wonderful couch potatoe game where you sit infront of your tv and play with your friends, the annoying amount of unskippable scenes and transition scenes take away from the game.Oh, and the my career cutscenes.. .. ..  they suffer from poor writing.  Its like watching an interview with donald trump about americas neuclear triad.  I should give 2k props for trying to imitate the culture of harlem, but when a white surburtan office worker in australia thinks a heap of crap, imagine how the people who actually live there think about it.  I'd imagine they would be quite insulted.This game is an unsult to the past titles which i absolutle loved with over 140 hours played on nba 14 alone, with 13 being the best.If the older titles were released into todays market, they would have done far better.

content:
Posted: November 3, 2016
Player models are upgraded with new, more detailed body scans, and that has a profound effect on the overall experience.You can relocate and completely rebrand your team with a mind-boggling amount of options.Even if a heated conversation was all about a choice I needed to make, I was never allowed to make it myself.For the first time in several years, I’ve only experienced a few online hiccups.Defense wins championships, and the improvements to AI defenses in NBA 2K16 bring this year’s iteration of the long-running basketball sim another title. Due to some big AI upgrades, the offensive tactics that I had been accustomed to using simply no longer work, so I was forced to think like a coach and constantly adapt. Running pick and rolls and calling plays finally felt like it was necessary, as opposed to a tougher option I had to enforce on myself. NBA 2K16 is a great representation of the sport of basketball, and it plays like a dream – both online and off.Upping Its GameThe big reason to show up this year, though, is that NBA 2K’s gameplay has been completely upgraded in nearly every way, resulting in a more true-to-life simulation experience. In previous years, I always found it easy to score by cheezing my way past AI defenders, running in circles and forcing them to make unrealistic mistakes. All of that is gone this year. Zig-zagging will result in steals and frustration, and attempts to drive the baseline will end up in terrible or blocked shots. The only reliable way to score is to use real basketball concepts, so if you’re a student of the sport you'll find yourself being rewarded for your knowledge.You have to improvise, because opposing AI coaches will start to learn your tendencies and try new ways to stop you. For example, defenders had been going underneath screens, allowing me to step back and take open jumpers; after a few successful attempts they started going around screens, forcing me to drive the lane instead. This constant game of cat and mouse kept me on my toes, searching for new ways to make plays.Whose Career Is It, Anyway?There are a staggering amount of ways you can play NBA 2K16. All the game modes I expect of the series make their triumphant return, some with interesting new wrinkles. The new Play Now Online mode makes head-to-head matches matter a bit more, since it features a promotion and relegation system. MyGM and MyLeague modes are now both fully featured management sims, allowing you to go so far as to relocate and completely rebrand your team with a mind-boggling amount of options. That same team editor can also be used in MyTeam, the card-collecting game, which has new challenges and ways to earn virtual currency.Racking Up WsLivin’ Da Dream reaches its conclusion after your rookie season, which only has eight playable games. After that, it opens up and plays more like the mode I was expecting, with 82-game seasons and new and exciting ways to improve your player on off days. That’s why I can enthusiastically recommend NBA 2K16 even with MyCareer’s failure to properly contextualize my player’s rise to stardom: at the end of the day, it’s all window dressing for the gameplay underneath – and in this case, that gameplay is spectacular.ConcludeNBA 2K16 is one of the most complete packages I’ve ever seen. Developer Visual Concepts continues to raise the sports simulation bar by completely retooling its silky-smooth gameplay, adding brand-new physics systems, and refining its traditional game modes. Not all of the changes work as well as others, most notably the Spike Lee-themed MyCareer mode, but it doesn’t take away from the impressive overall package.

content:
Posted: January 2, 2016
												Updated Review:I should have changed to thumbs up for awhile because the updates fixed a lot of the original issues.  I liked this game for about 2 monthes until 2K decided to step in and mess stuff up again.  The MyCareer gameplay seems really awkward with people speeding up and slowing down the game at odd times in order to try and keep the game difficult.  Things like balls magically floating through my player when I jump a lane to steal.  It seems like the game restricts you from being unstoppable, throwing in weird glitches which I have taken pictures to prove.  Players on your team will start moving one way, glitch and move towards his defender, causing turnovers that leave me like, "what just happen?".  This gets quite annoying but as you can see, I am still a pretty avid user of this game.  It is addictive but honestly I just turn it off in the middle of the game when those weird momentum changes seem to be forced into the gameplay, forcing odd-looking turnovers, taller cpu teammates getting blocked and characters seemingly molding together, the player missing steals, cpu teammates missing wide open lay-ups.  The list goes on; and it only seems to have gotten worse lately with these updates.Also, with the new updates I have noticed random crashing.  Once in the playoff's, I have crashed at the end of a game and then had to restart from the beginning when I reloaded myCareer.  I also tried to use the "Save and Quit" option in the menu; only for the game to crash, forcing the game to open a file from a previous save.  If it crashes and no previous save, quess what?  You're restarting the game.  I just recently lost an entire 3rd Quarter from this crash and it is not the first time.  The crashes seem to have become more frequent as the game has grown older; which is rather odd. Original Review:I seriously think 2K Sports are tipping off companies to boost sales and hype up this game.  I don't even know why I paid money for this game.  Mycareer is broken; missing wide open shots all the time with an 85 overall jump shot rating.  Not to mention missing uncontested lay-ups half the the time with 80+ overall rating for inside shooting; those are always great.  I respect Spike Lee but the story is completely wack and nobody cares about behind-the-scene stuff about how you produced this POS game.  Not to mention you can't skip cut scenes in between quarters, forcing you to watch pre-game and post-game videos which takes A LONG TIME TO DO ANYTHING.  After 2K's huge update, my replays stopped working, only showing scenes of the follow-up reactions after the play where your character is talking or whatever.  Who wants to watch that, seriously?  Vsync causes a lot of visual tearing and was the only fix I could come up with for the replay problems.  So now my replays work, but the crowd stutters and everything looks choppy and poorly animated.  I played this game and gave it plenty of times and opportunities to impress me but it's terrible.  Mycareer would be awesome if the gameplay wasn't completely messed up; the calender system and customization aspects are much better than last year.  Yet, I haven't even tried any other aspect of the game besides mycareer because this game frustrated me to the point of no return.  Like I said it's a waste of money.  All the missed shots, choppy framerate, and bugs are a constant reminder. 3570k @ 4.1 GhzAsus GTX960X-Box One Controller

They players move like a giant cube with an animation stuck into it.  Its like the first time someone tries to use a game make for the first time and makes a circle collide with a square.  In this game you cannot make your player walk next to another, its just not possible, you will be stuck against an invisible object.But all that is dwarfed by the impressively large input lag.  I'm not talking about the time it takes for the instruction to go from my controller and be recognised by the game, nope, i'm talking about the animation almost a second long that must happen before your character actually does seomthing.you want to shoot, wait a second.you want to move forward, wait a second.you want to steal the ball, wait a few seconds.you want to change direction, wait a secondetc, you get the point.Its annoyingly hard to get your character to stand near the 3 point line because you can't slightly move, you either run, walk, or stand still.. no variable movement at all, its just isn't in the game.There are camera issues and glitches that i could not be bothered explaining.Also, there are far too many unskippable cutscenes, for series that used to excel at being a wonderful couch potatoe game where you sit infront of your tv and play with your friends, the annoying amount of unskippable scenes and transition scenes take away from the game.Oh, and the my career cutscenes.. .. ..  they suffer from poor writing.  Its like watching an interview with donald trump about americas neuclear triad.  I should give 2k props for trying to imitate the culture of harlem, but when a white surburtan office worker in australia thinks a heap of crap, imagine how the people who actually live there think about it.  I'd imagine they would be quite insulted.This game is an unsult to the past titles which i absolutle loved with over 140 hours played on nba 14 alone, with 13 being the best.If the older titles were released into todays market, they would have done far better.

content:
Posted: February 14, 2016
												Has some legitimate improvements over 2k15. Would recommend based on my initial reactions.MyGM/Franchise has re-introduced 3-way trades and made some minor changes to add to the realism (promises to the GM now have consequences, trades destroy chemistry, staff contracts are negotiated, etc.). Gameplay feels tighter than in the past. Shooting is far more difficult, but that seems fair. The timing of button presses and appropriate spacing is now an aquired skill rather than automatic. Players respond better to inputs and the sense of control seems more legit.Ernie and Shaq are back, but now Kenny joins them on the desk. Add in Barkley next year, and it'll be worth it just for the pre-game/haltime/post-game shows.MyCareer is actually a lot of fun. There's a lot more interaction than in 2k15 in terms of what to do on off-days and how to earn Virtual Currency (VC). The "Spike Lee Joint" is completely unnecessary, but starting in year 2 the game takes a huge leap foward and it becomes a real improvement over last year's encarnation of the mode. I'd recommend skipping every cutscene and just flying through year 1 ASAP. If you want to see the movie later, it's made available in your second year. It's not awful if you're a fan of Spike Lee, it's just way too much if you want to actually play a game. The entire cutscene film is nearly 2 full hours in length. That's ridiculous for a sports game.All in all, a legitimate improvement over 2k15. I've heard online play is a mess, but I stick to single player. If you're like me in that respect, give this a try.

Posted: September 26, 2015
												Game is very choppy and laggy. Frame rate issues cause for very frustrating gameplay. Just doesnt seem meant for pc i can run ARK: Survival Evolved on High with less lag than a game of 2k with medium settings and no crowd. I'd request a refund for the game but i put well over 2 hours into just trying to get the game playable by adjusting with the video settings, testing out the game play for a min or two than going back to re adjust.  I put so much time into trying to get this game to work because i actually really enjoy the nba 2k games and have purchased every one since 2k5. Then there are just the issues of getting the pre-order through steam i did not recieve any bonuses even though i bought the Michael Jordan edition and that seems to be a problem that occurs only through steam. Those that bought a physical copy or through amazon have all recieved their pre-order bonuses. I figured id get this game on on my laptop because of  better graphics and frame rates but it doesn't even look or perform as well as 2k14 for my xbox 360. With 12gb of ram and AMD 8700 processor and an AMD radeon r6 8700 graphics card you'd think that wouldnt be the case. If steam and 2k can fix the gameplay issues and the pre-order bonuses missing than game is good but as it stands right now the game is almost unplayable and extremely frustrating and absolutley not worth $99.99, should of just got it for my xbox one id actually be able to shoot the ball without lagging into a travelling violation every so often

												Okay.. I already played NBA 2K since 2K9 for the first time ever I disappointed with 2K SportDon't get me wrong, there's some improvement this year. And this is a review based on the pre release date. Pros :+ The gameplay animation and physics is good. I like it, feels more real now.+ More animation for players. More varieties of movements.+ Dunk feels more powerful+ Good concept idea on MyCareer (From High School to NBA Draft)+ AI is harder than last year. AI's Defense is more intense and quite hard to breakCons :- Always crashing after half game of the 1st NBA Game of MyCareer. Now I can't continue MyCareer- Quite lagging compare to NBA2K15 with the same game spec- MyCareer storyline. You just played as Freq, it doesn't matter what's your name is, you always become Freq. What I enjoy about MyCareer from all the other 2K is I can be myself. Now it doesn't matter, it's Frequency Vibrations who will become the all star. And yes. that's your nickname Frequency Vibrations.- Some bug where suddenly pass icon just appeared out of nowhere, very annoying especially when I tried to shot and that pass icon suddenly appeared and I end up of passing.- Stuttering especially on commentator's talk. So lag and they are late to comments any action in courtOf course I will recommended this game if 2K Games is already optimized this game, waiting for some patch and a new GPU driver that support this game. Let's see until the release date, if there's some optimizations and get better, this game is 100% recommended. it's funBut for this pre release review it's a naaahhSorry 2K.. content:
Posted: August 8, 2016
												My experience in basketball games ranges from the NBA Street games (you know, the best ones) to 2K15, and now 2K16. There have been stellar reviews for 2K16, praising it for the most quality basketball game thus far. Well I have to say, all in all in comparison to its previous installment, I'm not impressed.Yes, 2K16 has an actual story to its game (a Spike Lee Joint apparently), but the story is streamlined in various ways. This is not necessarily a good thing. Regardless of your nationality or ethnicity you get the same family, the same hometown, and the same story. It feels lazy and borderline offensive even. Kind of feels as though 2K Games thinks only black people are playing basketball, which is just kind of stupid. Not to mention that the story takes too much out of your hands. Want to pursue your education first and hone your skill with your college basketball team? Too bad! Spike Lee says you're off to the NBA! Unprepared I might add, because you simply aren't of the appropriate skill to handle these kinds of games yet. Almost like you should have stayed and honed that skill first. Oh well, too bad that option wasn't available eh? Kind of makes the time you took deciding on which college to go to pointless.Aside from some random cut scenes with the cringeworthy cast of characters (Jesus your in-game girlfriend [another decision you weren't allowed to make by the way] is downright nightmarish), the game basically falls back into the same game NBA2K15 was, with minor tweaks.That's the best way to explain the game as a whole, minor tweaks. Nothing special, but I suppose if you missed out on 2K15, then this game will be a newer experience to you. It's not a bad game, just not good enough to warrant calling it a brand new game.

content:
Posted: April 9, 2016
												Id love nothing more than to recommend this game to you guys but even after the patches and updates this game is nowhere close to being worth the 60 dollar price tag. First off I know what your thinking" the my player mode cant be all that bad" trust me it is, its honestly as if your playing as a character that you made but that's going through someone else's stereotypical life, and to be honest I hate the guy I made if found myself rooting against him most of the time. Not to mention your first season is literally 75 percent cut scenes that are terrible and predictable and if you skip any of the them you will be lost as hell as to what's going on. But seeing how awful the plot is I guess that could be a good thing. 2k16 does improve on the terrible AI of the past making help defense run a little smoother, not to mention ally oops and dunks aren't unstoppable anymore, improvements like these make exhibition matches pretty fun to play. The different online modes are fun to play.... that is if you can find anyone to play with in the first place, as finding a match can prove to be quite difficult it often seems like the only people on are me and "cool daddy421". Overall there have been some improvements but not enough to justify paying 60 dollars for it, don't buy it for more than 25 dollars or just go back to playing 2k15 you aren't missing out on much here.
