content:
Posted: July 4, 2016
												Firstly, just look at my hours for this game and the previous 4 iterations. Obviously, I'm a fan of the NBA 2K series. HOWEVER...One of the more recent updates they did broke MyCareer for a lot of people. When you try to save and quit, you crash to desktop with no error 50% of the time. If you finish a game and try to advance to the next loading screen, it crashes 50% of the time. I've even heard of people crashing while just trying to simulate through games. Imagine the frustration of playing a masterful game, netting a triple-double, and then having that progress erased with no chance to save it. I paid full price for this game when it first came out, and have since then probably bought $50 in VC, but now my characters are all unplayable. If I could, I'd get my money back for the game and the VC I bought.In short, do not buy this game. EA broke it, and they have no intention of fixing it because they'd rather you just buy 2K17. I don't know why I would expect anything else from a publisher with as much garbage history as EA.

content:
Posted: April 20, 2016
												Jacko Rating9/10Well another year and another NBA2K - This review assumes you are familiar with the series.This year the team has given us something a little different and have included a story driven My Career mode, while some will hate it I thought it gave some fresh blood to the franchise and it can be mostly skipped anyway for those who aren't interested.  The game itself has been improved in several areas but to sum up it has become more realistic with the AI playing better and not so many easy dunks or silly looking alley oops in My Park for example.Graphics and Audio are both top notch and the commentary is an absolute treat with a surprising amount of variation, gameplay has become in my view slightly harder which I luv and My Park has had a few tweaks for the better also, mainly toning  down the massive advantage that taller players had previously and dampened down the 3 point shot success rate in Sunset Park which was very annoying previously and turned the games into rubbish ball for 5 year olds rather than resembeling the real game.Amazingly the game worked right out of the box - unlike the last 3 years releases which were full of bugs and issues that prevented many gamers from playing the game they bought for several days.  All in all NBA2K is still miles in front of any other BBall sim out there today and this year's release in my view has improved the franchise, given My Park a much needed face lift and brought back the highschool and university ranks to play through in My Career.A big Thumbs Up on this one :)

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: October 7, 2016
												I've never left a bad review for a game before.  I've always felt like if a bunch of developers spent a huge amount of time on a crappy game then it'd be messed up to leave a bad review.  Well in this case I figure it's ok.  Because they take a pretty good game and absolutely ruined it.  For insance.  This game has a shot based around a cage taht fills and a timed release.  Well you'd think they'd make sure that guage is always visible.  WELL THEY DON'T.  Occasionally the guage will go off screen, behind other players or behind annoying popups that tell you things like who the announcer is that's talking or how big the last run was.  It's so infuriating to go to take a shot and suddenly have the guage covered.  It's even more annoying because the guage fill time seems to vary based on which player is shooting and how far they are from the goal.  And sometimes it doesn't even fill up.  It just shoots.  And there's no real good tutorial in the game.  Like you're just suppose to already know how to play.  So then you get to the passing on offence.  You tell it to pass and maybe it'll pass somewhere good, maybe it won't.  WHO KNOWS.  Then on defence you switch players by pressing A.  So press A repeatedly until you get the player you want.  But it transfewrs you to the player closest to the ball.  Not the player who should be covering the shooter.  And there's no alternate button as far as I can tell to choose.  So when you're cycling players sometimes you periodically interupt another player running to position, disrupting him, then you get the player you want, but the person that other guy was suppose to be covering is wide open.  This kills the game.So... given all of that, how do you make it worse?  Well, let's throw in a crap load of ads!  For instance, every time you try to shoot a free throw, on the second shot, the gatorade logo will always block you from seeing the guage.  This kills the game.What else?  Well the game calls timeouts every friggen 2 minutes.  This is an unskippable 20 second loading screen essentially every 2 minutes.  There is no way to turn this off in options or alter the volume of timeouts that are called.  This more than anything... kills. the. game.Now if this was a crappy game, I wouldn't care.  I wouldn't even want to play it.  But this game is actually fun when you can actually play it to spite the crappy passing and defense controls.  It just needs a good tutorial, a fixed position for the shooting guage that's always on top, and the ability to turn off timeouts.  If I could do that, I'd probably play the crap out of this game and LOVE it.  But... unfortunately I want to play this game all the time and it does nothing but infuriate me because it's so close to being good and just seems to be intentionally destroyed by ads, and timeouts.  Also as a side note... the story line is garbage.  It says it's a Spike Lee joint, but if I was Spike Lee I wouldn't want my name on some garbage like that.  It's horrible.  I haven't tried online play yet.  So maybe that'll be what saves the game.  But I know better than to play a game online before practicing offline for a long time.  I guess we'll see.

content:
Posted: November 1, 2015
												NBA 2K16 is a great game, like its previous titles, but I'm giving it a negative review simply for the fact that the developers don't seem to fix the bugs that persisted through their previous titles. As well as some few good things that they don't seem to keep from their previous titles.1. Commentators cut off during the game sometimes. Commentary starts again at the next quarter.2. Referees sometimes just sit there with the ball for half a minute before giving it to you.3. There also seems to be problems with the VC sometimes not reaching the server properly.4. (Personal) I want the option to make a fantasy team with just the playoffs, whether it be MyGM or MyLeague. This was done in a previous 2K title. I don't know why they got rid of the option.Overall, almost nothing has changed from 2k15. I mean, there were a few changes that has inevitably made the game better (ie. speed mechanics, blocking fouls are now shooting fouls), and I understand that graphically theres only so much more they can do. It feels like there's way too much emphasis on MyCareer, if ONLY for the fact they earn more money from it. I would love to give you more money for your titles, if you released a title worthy of it. This to me tells me that the developers don't care much for the fans except for their money, and how to exploit that fact. But honestly this game is just 2k15 with different controls. Please at least fix the bugs before releasing your next game.

number of helpful: 4 of 7 people (57%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 23, 2016
												The actual gameplay for this game is alright, almost great. So if you just want to shoot some hoops with a friend this is a nice sports game. However, if you care at all about the game delivering on its promises in any actual game mode besides quick matches, you'll be disappointed.Street - Sure, as long as you don't mind just walking around watching other people playing. You won't actually get to play any games, since as soon as you queue up, everyone else will leave, because they don't want to play with your low ranked scrub. If someone actually takes pity on you, get ready for the bashing of your life, seeing as your skills are probably mid stat and everyone else is maxed out. So time to open your wallet, pay good money and max out your character, wait another 20 minutes to even get into a game, lose anyway since everyone else also bought game potions.ProAm - I still haven't figured out how this works. As far as I can see it has the same tedious problems as Street - this is just a 5 man version.You character will still suck. And you'll have to wait 30 minutes or so to fill up all slots to get the game going. 2K advertises this as a game mode where you can create your own team where there is an actual ranking, but to my knowledge you won't get anywhere near actually playing as your custom team unless you bring 4 friends.Career - The "Spike Lee joint" part is ridiculous. 2K tries to feed you a storyline and crams in all kinds of characters that are supposed to add immersion. It does just the opposite. I have no idea why my white 5'8 geek was raised in an african-american family in Brooklyn. Nor why he speaks with the deep voice of a 7' giant. I mean, I get cut scenes where my stepmom (well, you explain it!) explains how she met my stepdad... and this is supposed to immerse me how exactly? How you perform in high school makes no difference. What college you choose makes no difference. How you perform during your rookie season makes no difference. Then onto your first real season playthrough. And chances are big you'll finish dead last in your conference. Make a trade, the sooner the better. For me, I still thought my team had a fighting chance of making the playoffs, so I stayed on until it was too late. Then came the last season game and after that - Boom! Next season. I didn't get to see how the playoffs went, no awards, no summary, nothing. Oh well, atleast I can request a trade now? Nope! You need to play 10 games the next season first. Oh, so is that like an NBA rule? I'll just sim through the first ten matches. No, no. You actually have to play 10 matches. The fu....? So I'm stuck on this roster for ten more games? I'll just sim through the rest of the season, maybe some other team will take an interest in me. Not going to happen, silly... Now you're back at the start of a new season on the same crappy roster. Only now, your popularity on the trade boards have gone from 100% to 10-15%.MyTeam - *Uninstalls game...*

content:
Posted: October 24, 2015
												If you're interested in simulation basketball, this game runs a mean fast break on all previous iterations -- I'm talking New Jersy Nets Gerald Green head above the rim alley oop windmill dunk. Gone are the days of the ubiquitous jack-of-all-trades superstars. More than ever, the basketball IQ of the person behind the controller matters, and I welcome that. Sure, some cheaters still exist, but, if you learn at least part of the art of basketball, it's not a forgone conclusion that you'll lose.Despite the backlash against MyCareer mode this year, it's an enjoyable mode with a storyline that can be forgotten entirely after your rookie season. In fact, from the second season forward, this mode is probably the most in-depth and satisfying career mode in any sports game. If you're considering buying this game, don't listen to those who wished for the moon and were delivered a game rooted in great basketball mechanics.There are so many modes in this game (I'll let you read about them elsewhere) that any basketball fan should be able to find something they like.

number of helpful: 8 of 15 people (53%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: October 6, 2015
												Great game, very different from the past releases. They have completely remodeled the defense making it a lot harder to just zig zag through the cpu's defense which means you have to really work hard for those shots. Also passing is different with new controls and animations and with the new defense some passes are you may have used to do are a lot harder leading in several turnovers They have added a lot more gameplay animations blocks are more realistic, player movements are alot better with faster reaction times. Each player also has their own way of playing. Also body animations are added such as flexing playing with their mouth guard, dunk face animations, gum chewing, etc.The rating system makes more sense this year even though some of you may disagree they are doing it by comparing the players ability to the greatest in that area like for example the best avg rebounder is Dennis Rodman so he has a 99 OFF and 95 DEF in rebounding compared to a current dominating rebounder with DeAndre Jordan who is given a 92 OFF and 94 DEF and same goes for other attributes so if you dont like it, no one cares.MyCareer also has the Spike Lee storyline which has lots of mixed feelings. I just want to mention in my opinions stop b*tching just cause yoour family is black, there are countless games that I've played where I'm given a family that looks nothing like me as a created player and like many others we dont complain we just play and enjoy what they give us. Also they'd need more voice actors which would be too expensive for something they're just trying out.Any way in MyCareer you now have offdays where you get to do either connections (haging out with someone in the leauge such as player, teamowner, celeb) where you get rewards like VC or my favourite you get to pick your game day jersey. Also there's training on off-days for attribute boosts and Endorsments that also give VC. So those are all your choice. Only problem I have with it is you play 3 HS games and 4 College no VC games but are fun and only 8 rookie season games while I would prefer having the whole rookie season to play.MyGm has been redesigned and is more realistic with team relocation added.My Team added several new things like player cards that attributes change as the season goes by with their performance. I may missed some stuff but if this hasn't made you want the game, I don't know what will.So if you want the best NBA... No, a sports game of all time. Here it is.Well till 2K releases something better anyway.

content:
Posted: September 28, 2015
												The basketball so far has been excellent.  The story in My Career has not.  Anyone familiar with Spike Lee's previous work can guess what it is: Preachy ghetto story that has been told 1000 times.  The whole thing is just very very cheesy.  All credit to the actors for trying to salvage the script, but they really had their work cut off for them.I've just realised the first 3 lines of my review sound like a review on iMDB.  So..... basketball.It's a lot more fluid, the players have a better sense of weight, and it just feels right.  Controls have been changed quite a bit with more passing options, and after a while I really like the change.Presentation is very good, and I love the post game show (whenever I quit early Shaq seems to give me a filthy look).Sound is a bit wonky though, and I have had a few odd bugs where the sound goes a bit mental.  Otherwise, it's technically fine turned up to the max.If you love basketball you'll enjoy this.  If you can suffer through the god awful story the My Career is actually quite engaging.  Thankfully you can skip the cutscenes.Oh, and get used to being called Freak (Freq? whatever).I mean seriously Spike. Frequency Vibrations?  Really?  I swear you ran a competition in local primary schools and a local 8 year old kid thought that up.  At least I hope that's the reason.Signing off as I'm ranting.

												Only played 33 hours so far but gameplay and my career mode have been improved nicely so far! Even more realistic than last years game, get ready for some authentic basketball! Nice improvement to My Career no doubt! 2k just keeps improving!I will edit this review after 50 hours or so again. So far so good though, only issue I have had so far is that the preorder bonuses are not working yet (I think they might not unlock until the game fully comes out on tuesday). Everyone seems to be writing bad reviews because they don't like Spike Lee, pretty pathetic if you ask me. This game has the best gameplay every in a 2k game and people are angry a black director helped on My Career mode.The game is also running very well (75-80 fps for me atm) and I am not having many issues, just hoping to get my preorder bonus on tuesday and I will be set. Sports gaem of the year so far! Better than Fifa and madden so far.

Posted: June 28, 2016
												Is Spike Lee a terrible person? Probably not. Did he make a terrible thing happen to a good game? Absolutely. So much cringe, and it takes forever to skip, some are unskippable, the MyCareer should be one of the best things about the game, yet its the worst. Luckily the game is redeemed by MyLeague and the depth of the actual gameplay. You literally have to understand the game and the players, or you will not win. Don't know the weaknesses of a teams star players? Get Rekt. Don't know how to play off your teams strengths? Get Rekt. Watch some games, study some stats, and git gud at this amazing game to pwn your friends.Now if only I could stop Cheif Curry from making these threes....

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 7, 2016
												I just want to say. First off, people are giving this game a REALLY bad wrap. Mycareer might not be your cup of tea. But seriously, come on, the game itself without Mycareer mode, is friggin the best basketball game on the market today, period. I have a i74770K, amd R9280 and 8 GB ram, runs almost flawlessly on max graphics. NEVER had a crash , ever. PLaying in any of the modes. So this review will be about the GAMEPLAY itself and NOT mycareer mode. The gameplay is difficult, its tough, you need to know some moves, some plays and you need to mix it up to get by defenders. Its true, this game, DOESA have a learning curve, but then the BEST games have a learniing curve. If it was to easy, id be bored shtless in 5 seconds. Yes it IS hard to get by Ai, but still possible, if you learn some plays and mix it up. Everything gameplay wise has been smoothed out, compared to all the other NBA 2K games. Franchise is better, blacktop is better, the game IS better.Now as far as mycareer mode goes, I havent tried it, because of all the negative feedback on it.Graphics 8/10 for a basketball game, easily. Id give it a 10/10 if they fixed a few bugs(which theres barely any that ive experienced)Sound 10/10, the commentary is incredible for a sports game. Just play Rugby challenge 3 and compare it or WWE 2K16.gameplay 8/10 Its about as close as we are going to get without playing basketball.Presentation 9/10 It feels and looks like the real NBA presentation, right down to the halftime report.So overall a 35/40 for me and if they improve a few bugs and make it a bit smoother, this game coudl easily get a 10/10.

content:
Posted: September 26, 2015
												Really disappointed by 2k, again.PRO:-Even better graphics than 2k15 (that makes me run the game with low settings)-One new voice for the reporter ( The other one is still annoying, saying the same old♥♥♥♥♥♥for 2 years and counting)-At least this year Pharrel didn't ♥♥♥♥ed up even the music, thank god.-Menus are better, but I still don't like it, especially all the useless animation between them-Better Defense-You can create your arena and jerseys on MyTeam, very cool feature. -Only NBA pc gameCONS:-Ratings are quite wrong to me, maybe they are not updated yet, we'll see-Laggy, game has FPS drops quite often-Glitch, player walking inside other player or referee desk etc-I really hate that momentum mechanis gameplay. As soon as you make a mistake, you're screwed because cpu will start blocking your shots, stealing your ball and most of your shots won't fall either way.-What the heck is that myPlayer? I'm a white guy with a black sister and family and I can't decide anything, it's just a long and annoying movie-MyTeam is quite difficult to me,especially with bronze player. Also 6 minutes per quarter are just too many. After 20 minutes of playing point by point, the cpu will start destroying you with big runs. -If you like passing a lot, you will end up yelling and swearing at the game. cpu will just raise his hand and intercept something like 30% of your pass, which is very frustrating. -Voice randomly muting for the entire quarterOverall: I just really am not able to enjoy my time with this game, just feel so frustrating. I think they should focus on 2 gameplay mode: MyPlayer which is the most played and MyTeam which can be profitable for them. I would cut all the mypark player♥♥♥♥♥♥ Game mechanics sucks, and the player felt to me more fluid in 2k14. I see that there are a lot of negative reviews and the positive one are just because there isn't just anything else to play on pc. After 250+ Hours on 2k15, 250+hours on 2k14 I doubt i will play 2k16 for such a long time, pity.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 7, 2016
												I just want to say. First off, people are giving this game a REALLY bad wrap. Mycareer might not be your cup of tea. But seriously, come on, the game itself without Mycareer mode, is friggin the best basketball game on the market today, period. I have a i74770K, amd R9280 and 8 GB ram, runs almost flawlessly on max graphics. NEVER had a crash , ever. PLaying in any of the modes. So this review will be about the GAMEPLAY itself and NOT mycareer mode. The gameplay is difficult, its tough, you need to know some moves, some plays and you need to mix it up to get by defenders. Its true, this game, DOESA have a learning curve, but then the BEST games have a learniing curve. If it was to easy, id be bored shtless in 5 seconds. Yes it IS hard to get by Ai, but still possible, if you learn some plays and mix it up. Everything gameplay wise has been smoothed out, compared to all the other NBA 2K games. Franchise is better, blacktop is better, the game IS better.Now as far as mycareer mode goes, I havent tried it, because of all the negative feedback on it.Graphics 8/10 for a basketball game, easily. Id give it a 10/10 if they fixed a few bugs(which theres barely any that ive experienced)Sound 10/10, the commentary is incredible for a sports game. Just play Rugby challenge 3 and compare it or WWE 2K16.gameplay 8/10 Its about as close as we are going to get without playing basketball.Presentation 9/10 It feels and looks like the real NBA presentation, right down to the halftime report.So overall a 35/40 for me and if they improve a few bugs and make it a bit smoother, this game coudl easily get a 10/10.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 14, 2016
												I'm a long time player of the NBA 2K series.For the record. Yes I like the game. Yes I think it's better in every way than it's predecessor. Yes there's loads of new content. Yes the graphics are better. Yes the game-physics are better. Yes the MyPlayer story is interesting, if a bit short. Yes all the game modes are better. Finally, the biggest pro of the game 2K actually seems to give a rats ### about us PC gamers for once! Big Ups 2k! However... The same problems persist across the board, in each and every game mode.I'm a big fan of MyPlayer, but just in case your wondering, YES the problems I'll mention WILL persist in every game mode.The famous GOLDEN BULLET principle is still in effect. Durant, Bryant, Curry amd other crunch-time shooters are still frustrating to guard; NOT because of their skill, though - that would be something I could live with - but the GOLDEN BULLET principle allows them to make three point shots through defenders hands, armpits and even their body.Great Defensive Players have their own GOLDEN BULLET problem. Simply standing within 6 feet or so of a defensive "ace" will more or less remove whatever shooting skill you have, whether he's standing between you and the basket or not. Notorius Shot Blockers like Ibaka, Gibson and the like are able to block the shot without even touching the ball. Tony Allen, CP3 and other Top-Thieves are able to steal the ball without being able to reach it. - YES I checked the replay...Finally, there is the Makes You Look Bad Effect - Or in plain terms, the player's gotta be the one responsible for coughing the ball up: On offense, in key situations I'll push the pass button to make a pass - gee... - and in most other situations the pass will go off without a hitch. However in said situations the player in question won't make the pass at all, and I raise my eyebrow and think "WTF... Well whatever, let me just make another play." but then, in something like a few seconds I'm left thinking and even bigger "WTF!!!!" when the player THEN makes the pass to the player I indicated seconds before, who, of course,  is no longer open at this point - Instant Turnover.Also in a Defensive Rebound situation you quickly advance the ball to avoid turning it over to a CP3 or D-Wade or whoever who's crowding you and Hallelujah, you make the pass to an open teammate who takes it across the line as you sprint up the court, only to gawk in terror as your teammate passes the ball BACK to you before you've even crossed the line, AND YET SOMEHOW you still get the Turnover... Illegal screens, while they certainly do occur, is a little hard to swallow when the "screen" button is the only button you're pressing and yet the player STILL moves into the screen at random moments.... Same deal with a great entry pass into the low post, where the post player, for whatever reason loses the ball or gets it stolen; STILL YOUR TURNOVER. Funny, if you're the player in the post, and the same thing happens, it's ALSO your turnover. Finally there's the weird timing of passing system which I've yet to figure out how works. It's obviously very. VERY advanced, seing as directional passing is lot like playing russian roulette. One time in six the ball will be passed to a VERY covered player instead of the wide-open one you thought you were passing it to, and the reason? Well, I'm assuming there's a very strict timing as to when and where the directional passing indicates who exactly it is your passing to, and that it changes dynamically. That's fine, but it does have me swearing by Direct Pass more times than not, just to avoid brainfreezing directional passes which would land you on Shaqting A Fool in a heartbeat.The AI controlling the rest of your teams, at times, is a little thick as well.... - I've never seen so many Defensive-and/or-Offensive 3-second Violations in real life Basketball, but defensively, you get the feeling you're either not being told you're supposed to be double-teaming someone, becasuse a big man is suddenly called for the 3 seconds. Several times in a row... (If it was a rookie from Europe, I might even think it was realistic. But lets be honest, when it's the Gasols, Noah, or even Tyson Chandler?!!! Oh hell no...) Offensively, it's usually a dude in the paint, having just passed outside and waiting for a wide open shot from a team mate, that never happens...(A singular piece of advice here. Unless you're utterly desperate, forget the hold button down to Lead-To-The-Basket-Pass exists! I'm not saying this because of the fact that it's a dumb system, cause that should be obvious. The fact that you can't cancel the pass easily and the player will usually make the pass anyway even if the Cutter is standing neck deep in three defenders, IS, JUST, STUPID. No The problem is choosing the recipient. Leftstick should do that, except it doesn't. I mean it REALLY DOESN'T. I was being double teamed and i was right next to my teams primary penetrator so I thought, wtf go for it. So I pressed down and held that Lead-To-Basket-Pass button down... And I went "huh?" when the icon did NOT in fact appear and the guy didn't move... Uh, what? I then caught on as I saw a cutter coming the opposite wing, weaving through defenders, whom, of course caught whiff, and started defending the passing lanes. So there I was, double teamed, leadpass button pressed, and couldn't pass it to nobody but the, by now, most defended player on my team besides me. Turnover... Obviously...)The same sort of thing applies to when your defending Superstars. The CPU seems to decide when and where your player "freezes" or does something S-A-F worthy. Usually it's when Lebron has the ball or Westbrook or whoever, usually a good penetrator. I don't begrudge them being good enough to get past me on the perimeter or being able to manufacture a shot against two or even three defenders, but seeing the player you're in control of suddenly stand still for a split second even though you've been running for 4 seconds already, jump straight up, AT THE FREETHROW LINE, behind an opposing player on the break even though you're still moving and right on his heels, NOT jump to contest the shot even when told to, or NOT get the rebound that's basically in his hands, or whatever... It's frustrating to say the least... It's things like this that make me SO tired of playing that I usually shut it down and stop playing for a good long while until I remember how much I like the game.In all honesty if it weren't for the drawbacks I would probably be playing this game every day.Room for improvement 2K. You've gotten better and better and I like that, but keep at it! Perfection is an impossibillity, I know, but you should strive for it just the same; or else what are you even doing it for?Update: Dear 2K... I know the new game is out and all, but PLEASE, show a little attention to detail for the next patch on this one? - The only thing "getting old" about it, presently, is this: My LEAST favorite bug in the game. The "Gremlin" in the game, usually during, but not exclusive to, the playoffs, where you finally, FINALLY, have a MONSTER GAME. You know the type - either a 5 by 5, a Triple-Double, 50 points +, perfect shooting 22-for-22, yadda-yadda-yadda... Or, heck, all of the above. And then the end of the game rolls along. (Doris Burke does a disappearing act and I start to grimace... I know what's coming already, but there's nothing I can do about it now.) We go through to the Player Of The Game segment and then it's the menu to advance. At this point the screen prompts it is "Saving." WTF is it saving? When done, I press advance. The game cuts out and when I start the game again, and reenter the game mode in question, the game NEVER HAPPENED!!! And it's ALWAYS that ONE PERFECT GAME!!!! Pretty please, with sugar, whipped cream and a cherry and chocolate sprinkles and whatever-else-youj-want-on-top, 2K, could you KINDLY do something about that? It's SOOOOO frustrating....

Posted: June 24, 2016
												I bought this game for mycareer since it was on sale and afte 6 hours of playing I gave up.  I never even made it to the NBA.   Your team AI is complete trash, they will pass  up open looks, or not pass as you cut unhindered to the basket, they don't play defense and miss wide open shots.  The opposing AI however is very good, will fight through screens, run plays and actually look like a team.  Your team just stands around and wont even pass you the ball.  I dont understand what the computer thinks a good game in college is.  My draft stock was plummeting even though I lead every game in scoring, and had a fg% over 50% at least 5 rebounds and 2 assists a game, along with a steal and block and all the headlines would say I was a "house of horrors" and may slip into the second round.  The story is TERRIBLE.  I made my player white (because Im white) and i had a black family and black twin sister and grew up in Harlem?  wtf...

												Well... for those people who are hesitating to buy this game, I have something to tell you. I am a big fan of 2K and yesterday I eventually bought this game. I was so excited when it finished the download. I tried to launch the game, a launching window popped up and then disappeared. Nothing happened... The game couldn't even start... I thought maybe my pc was missing something else so I searched online and did everything following the guides. I redownloaded the game as well and tried EVERY possible solution, but unfortunately they all didn't work. My pc runs win10 with an i7 core and gtx950m. I find out that a few people actually meet this cannot-start problem, perhaps it is related to the compatibility with win10? I have no idea. Anyway, I am very disappointed. I heard a lot of negative reviews on this game but I was still willing to give it a try. The reality is that I cannot even start the game...and not only me... The good thing is Steam gives me the refund immediately (actually the next day, kind of ironic for 2K or Steam is efficient?), and that surprises me a lot. To sum up, give a thumb to Steam! As to 2K, well... dunno what to say anymore...

Even while I have read older reviews crushing the MyCareer-Mode and the controls, Mostly this game is interesting for me because of the MyCareer-Mode, cause i suck at controlling a whole team in NBA games, so I thought give it a go for 10€. You can't make anything wrong.I may have made a mistake. positive: - presentation is as awesome as ever- gives you something to do on your offdays- graphics are okay in gamenegative:- god dammit the controls feel so cluncky, everything seems to react on a delay. I let the player sprint and want to stop in front of the enemy, but no the player runs outside the field 50% of the time - don't expect your character to be a good shooter, had so many open looks and made him an outside shooter, never hit green or even got close to scoring in the NBA- PG's in this game love to hold the ball, even when the whole team is screaming at them- pick and rolls don't seem to exist- and starting the season as a 57-60 overall always sucked, give us something to be on a level with the other rookies and change the progession system, is it that hard?- randomly crashesThe story: For the most part I have to admit, that I liked the story under some circumstances. It was to short for my taste, just a few highschool, collage and rookie games and thats it? Didn't took me 4 hours to play through that. I thought of my swedish looking 6'8" guy as an adoptive child and tried to ignore the twinstoryline. Even while the dialogs were kinda cheesy the story was on a good way, but poorly transfered into a game. Some aspects could have been easily randomized. AND PLEASE GETTING CALLED "Freq" (FREAK) THE WHOLE GAME, WHO WANTS THIS?WHAT I WISH FOR IN THE FUTURE: SMOOTH controls were the player reacts as I want and not 2 seconds later as I pressed buttons, as well as actually doing what I pressed and not what the pc wants me to do, so I can lose possession. I dream of a game were the player passes in the direction I hold the stick.

content:
Posted: August 29, 2016
												If you're thinking of buying NBA 2K16, you might as well purchase its predecessor NBA 2K15. 2K16 has slightly better graphics than 2K15 and the animations look slightly better but everything remains the same. If you’re solely interested in buying 2K16 in order to see the new players, you might as well download the 2015-2016 roster available on 2K15.If you’ve begun to play MyTeam late, you’ll realize that most of your opponents tend to utilize Steph Curry or LeBron James as their picks in the Gauntlet, which damper your picks as you’ll still be stuck with your bronze starters and a possible gold or sapphire that comes your way. Multiplayer is extremely laggy, with constant drops and opponents disconnecting. Your AI teammates still behave strange and actually allow for weak defense being played against the AI opponents allowing for easy buckets and unfair gameplay, making switching between teammates creating a lag and opportunity for the AI to sprint past you. I didn’t desire to even try MyCareer after having heard the great comments about Spike Lee’s direction (sarcasm).The game also contains a lot of issues regarding FPS and video settings. As a person with a decent computer to play games, I constantly seem to get FPS drops.Overall, I was severely displeased. Someone who has never played 2K15 will find that 2K16 is quite amazing but the fact that 2K continually releases the same issues and errors is frustrating. Every 2K game since 2K14 has felt exactly the same. I probably won’t be purchasing 2K17 until it goes on sale just as I bought 2K15 and 2K16. None of the 2K games is worth their +$60 value. The game is in general a bad port from console to PC. The developers should listen to the steam complaints.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 3, 2016
												One of the worst sports games I have ever played. Graphics and sound 4/5Controls 1/5Ai 1/5Gameplay 2/5I bought this game on sale because Madden will never come to PC and I thought I would give this series a try. That was a mistake. This game is garbage. The ai is terrible regardless of which team you play as. They foul constantly even if I don't touch the game pad or disable late game fouling. The opponent Ai pulls some incredible bs such as with 0.3 seconds left in a game where I was up by 2, the opponent ai over hand throws beyond half court a game winning 3 point shot. Once...ok..but 3 times!? I felt like the cavs over the last 52 years. I can handle getting beat by a computer. Just not 3 times in a row by some robot super human throwing half court field goals with less than a half a second left. The controls are like that of a fighting game. There are so many combos and schemes , I felt it was too complicated for a sports game. I stuck the simple buttons for shooting , blocking and jumping. Beyond that would require a cheat sheet in front of me to remember the 6 button combo to alley-oop.The career or season mode or whatever is kind of a joke too. There is a dialog tree and it treats it like some kind of terrible RPG instead of like the older franchise modes in Madden. I lulzed when I was presented with 3 options ranging from happy to angry to respond to the owners questions with. I guess this is more for the kids. Not sure what I expected. I was looking forward to front office tasks while playing the games. It is not that : \I tried to get a refund but because steams refund system would require me to relinquish every title I purchased when I got this, I felt it was not worth it. I'll suck it up and just count my losses. If you have never played the nba2k games before, don't bother. I see a lot of the positive reviews are people who enjoy this franchise of games . Just was not for me.Overall 2/5 . It does look and sound good. That is all it has going for it IMO.

content:
Posted: January 24, 2016
												This game is terrible. I can't describe it any other way.Granted, I am a very casual gamer so maybe I don't have the patience required for this game but there are so many things wrong with it.Cons-Career mode is a joke. Your player is so bad it's not even fun. Misses 75% of his shots, can't shoot freethrows, it's just aweful. -Constant UI lag. I don't know what's wrong with this game, but it seems like everything you do is horribly slow. Press the X button for a jump shot and your player will travel for almost no reason (like a player can't do a jump shot on the move or something?). Release the shooting button on time and you'll actually be late (falling down or away once you release) for again no reason. This is not a Specs Issue either, I'm running a machine with specs much higher than recommended. -Game is just horrible with Steam Controller, I couldn't recommend playing in this manner to anyone. The dunk stick just dosn't work right because Steam had to be different and go with some sort of scroll pad.-Learning Curve is too high for casual players. I'll do a simple pick and role and the player will just pass to someone else. How stupid is that? I call for a pick and roll and go to pass, and the player kicks it out to someone on the wing who's being guarded...game is so poorly designed in this regard. -Driving to the basket is unneccesarily difficult. The game actuallly punishes you for not running designed plays and maintaining a certain tempo about your play. In real life (I have NBA league Pass) these players would not miss the chances I create in the game when driving to the basket. Yet I almost nearly always miss when driving to the hoop. I also cannot shoot 3's because the shooting command on Steam Controller is delayed or something. I tap X to shoot and the player releases the ball a milisecond before coming back down to the floor. Like the type of real-life shot a player would make as he's getting fouled near the basket. Complete garbage.-Passing is also not right. I can't tell you how many times I move out to the wing and try to pass directly to the center who's got some space and the ball gets picked off in a manner that isn't consisten with the physics of basketball. Again, the game is designed to force you to play a certain way and you cannot simply work around that. -The substitute menu freezes often and interferes with what would be the bounce pass or B button on my controller (configurations vary). It causes me to have to restart, in which case I generally just turn off the game.Overall I don't have the patience to learn to be good at this game and I think it's a horrible waste of time and money.

number of helpful: 8 of 16 people (50%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: September 27, 2015
												This review is based on 12 hours of gameplay, mostly My Career, and a tiny bit of My Park and Pro AM. I wrote this review between the pre-release and the release of the game, so some of the problems might have already been solved when you'll read these lines.Quite a lot of things improved this year, but the game is riddled with bugs, crashes and exploits at the moment.PROS:- Graphics (more details, better skins, shoes, etc.)- Animations don't lock you so much any more. It's easier to place yourself accurately on the court for these previously hard-to-reach play positions.- The My Career mode has more things to do, such as drills on off days. You have access to a real court filled with your team mates, where you can take part in different drills or just shoot around with your mates.- You can also manage how you want to spend the rest of your off-time to gain VC or fans with endorsements and connections with influential people in the NBA.- You have a customizable court where you can play or just chill out with friends- The game is a bit harder than last year, at least in My Career, which is a good thing- The reworked controls are easier to grasp and work better for me- a bunch of bugs from last year have been fixed- less lag in My Park- Maybe the Pro AM mode, when it works? (see below)CONTROVERSIAL:- The Spike Lee story takes you from High School (3x8 minute games) to college (4x10 minute games) to your rookie year (8 normal-length games). It ends at the end of your rookie year, so it's not very long. After that, you get your usual but improved My Career experience- Some people don't like it, but I think that the story is pretty good. It immerses you in the life of (your) an NBA player and serves as a big tutorial, starting with easy games. I put brackets around "your", because you answer by the stupid nickname of Frequency Vibrations (Freq in-game, sounding like Freak). You can change it when the story ends, but they still continue calling you Freq sometimes when they refer to what happened in the story. - It's a non-interactive story, apart from the choice of high-school and college, which has no incidence on the story.- Even though you create a white character, you'll still have the same black parents and sister. It doesn't bother me though, because it's only apparent during the (not so long) story. Also, their skin is more mixed than really black, so it didn't really break immersion with my white character.CONS- new year = new bugs (nothing game breaking so far, apart from the lines below)- frequent crashes to desktop when navigating through specific menus- less frequent CTDs when loading a game- Some players could exploit the VC store and now have rating 88+ characters in My Park. So no point in going there until they are banned, reset, or you can catch up with their characters.- The Pro AM mode just doesn't work at the moment, you can see your player entering and leaving the court endlesslyCONCLUSION:It's a much improved version this year, adding plenty of major and minor things which improve the gameplay and immersion. You might want to wait for a few patches though, especially if you plan on playing online.

number of helpful: 6 of 12 people (50%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: September 28, 2015
												Let me make this clear. I love the changes to MyGM and MyLeague, which is the only reason I'm recommending this game. However, if you are intending to make MyCareer the majority of your playing experience...DO NOT BUY THIS GAME. The game is advertised as 'My Story' yet puts you on a linear preplanned story. If it was my story my guy would not have been born in Harlem, he would have attended a different college program, and he would have stayed for more than one year. Spike Lee directing the story ruins whatever immersion I had with the character. I feel MyCareer has some good moments and ideas. I love the idea of playing high school ball and choosing a college. Yeah there are only 9 choices and I wish there were more, but I understand why with the cost of getting more on board so I don't let that bother me. What MyCareer did wrong. Only able to spend one year in college; I get it you are supposed to be a superstar but let us decide if we want to stay one more year. Heck make the games challenging enough that we don't win the NCAA tournament giving us the option to stay and try again out of pride. Your skill rating when you join the NBA is a puny 55. This forces you to either play with a crappy player, buy VC with your money, or farm in other modes first. On top of that they kept the grouped together stat increases that NBA 2k15 started, which reduces the variation of play styles I could develop MY player into.I haven't finished up to the FA period yet, so I can't comment on length of seasons fairly. I do like shorter seasons compared to the older games when you had to play every game, but I don't like them moving away from 2k15's decision to let you pick which games you play.Overall, if you are looking at this game for the MyPlayer mode...just stick to 2k15 or 2k14 and just watch the cutscenes on YouTube. If you are looking at the MyGM/MyLeague then I say buy it, the improvements are worth it.

												This game looks amazing and plays like garbage. The career mode is AWFUL. The story is so boring, you have the illusion of choice but really you have very little, and the game itself is fun while in high school and college and dull as anything in the NBA. It doesn't. It doesn't make sense.

content:
Posted: June 24, 2016
												I own 2K14 and for the most part enjoy playing it.  I only ever play the career mode because I like making a player and watching them and myself develop over the in game seasons.  Boy oh boy to my surprise, after being an idiot and not bothering to read all the reviews which mention it, this game has changed.Right off the bat: not a fan in the slightest of the 'news' video that loads on your landing screen which seems to be a poor cross between advertising and social media integration.  Okay whatever, I can live with that, maybe I can get a patch somewhere to disable it.  I went to start a career and I'm treated to...an unskippable video from amazing director Spike Lee, clearly reading from cue cards, about how the career mode is so much better now and the story is gonna be so great man I just know it!No thanks.  Not why I like your game.  I clocked eight minutes 'played' after the 50gb install and was totally turned off on the experience.  Went straight away to ask for a refund.If you are here because you like 2K's career mode, look elsewhere.  I'll just go back to playing 14 which is fine enough for me and maybe with the next release they won't ♥♥♥♥ up a good thing and I could be persuaded to buy a new version.

content:
Posted: September 4, 2016
												Ugh.  Where do I begin with this game?  Mycareer mode is completely broken in this game.  First, you have to put up with sitting through some idiotic Spike Lee video (which cannot be skipped) before finally you get to play.  In a high school game.  High school.  After a few of those, and then a few college games, and so many tedious videos that will have you jamming the skip button as hard as you can, you get to the NBA draft.  Congratulations, after a few hours of mind-numbingly dull videos, now you get to spend 20-30 minutes sitting through the NBA draft.  Can you skip it and just find out who drafted you?  Nope.  You are forced to sit through the whole thing.  Thank you, Spike Lee.  Go back to making movies.  At least some of those are good.  Did you guys see Inside Man?  That is probably my favorite Spike Lee movie.  Denzel and Clive Owen are great.Anyway, after all that excruciating draft, you are finally in the NBA.  Good luck getting through even one entire game without it crashing on you and making you start over.  I think I tried about eight times without success before I finally gave up.  And the gameplay?  The actual basketball part was fine, but even after turning off every option about replays and all that garbage, it was still infuriating.  Whenever someone shot a free throw, I had to press a button or else watch the shooter high five or fist bump the entire team for 10 seconds.  Did he then shoot?  No.  At this point I had to wait another 10 seconds for the referee to pass the ball to the guy at the free throw line unless I pressed the button again.  Did he then shoot?  No.  At that point, he would go through another 10 seconds of some stupid pre-free throw routine before finally shooting the ball, unless I pressed the button again.  Seriously?  I have to skip three different cutscenes every time someone shoots a free throw?  Ugh.  And do not get me started on timeouts.  One team calls a timeout.  Cool, that is fine.  Just let me press a button to skip ahead to gameplay.  I am pressing the buttton, so why are you doing nothing?  I am still pressing the button.  I am still pressing the button.  Now I getting very angry and still pressing the button.  After about 15 seconds (every single time there is a timeout), I can finally skip ahead.  Please, please, please, just let me PLAY THE ♥♥♥♥ING GAME!2K, you used to make fun games, but this is probably the worst sports game of yours I have ever played.  I hope 2K17 is better, but based on this game I am not buying 2K17 unless I can get it for $5 or less.

number of helpful: 6 of 13 people (46%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 25, 2015
												Being a regular customer for NBA 2K games since it first came on PC with 2K9, I didn't really expect much from this game - I came in thinking that this was pretty much 2K15 but with the current roster. While that is true for the most part, there have been more improvements than I expected, particularly with the gameplay itself.Smoother animations, better dunk animations, better rebounding, and a better-than-expected MyCareer mode are some of the things I definitely like so far.However, it does not have the best optimisation for PC - while mine runs just fine (i5-6600K, R9 390, 8gb RAM, 1440p) but a lot of people are having trouble with framerate drops and poor performance overall. The controls have been changed yet again, which would take some getting used to (though it does feel better than with 2K15).Overall, I am quite satisfied with this iteration of the series, but it's definitely not for everyone. There's still a lot more to improve in this game, but with yearly releases, I can't really complain too much.

content:
Posted: September 29, 2015
												This review is based solely on the fact that I mostly play these games for dynasty/GM mode. My carareer is basically the same as last year but they magaged to make it more trash by adding in Spike Lee. Seriously, the story touches on subjects and situations that has no business in a game like this. We just want to enjoy the game of basketball, not open up a debate about various social issues. just for clarity, im black and im very familar with his work. And 90% of it is stereotypical trash, why 2K thought it was a good idea to bring him on is beyond me. so basically, my career is a wash. O, and hackers....everywhere.well, enough of thatThe game really shines on the court.  Passing, post play, screens all butter smooth. The AI reacts "intelligently" to what you are doing on the court and your line up. If you got lebron or curry dropping 30 in the third they do alot more than just double team them when they touch the ball. Theyll, play screens differently, deny the ball, force you to take long 2's. Its really actually pretty good. A clear improvement in graphics and animations as well. And the soundtrack is back to form as well.That being said, literally everything else either didnt change or got worse.  Ill have to recomend becasue steam lacks a damn middle ground. TL:DRMy career: Spike Lee/10 hes an idiotOnline:       Hackers/10 (and lag)My GM:       7/10 not much changed, wasnt expecting it to.gameplay:    9/10 best in seriesAudio:           New Buggatti/10 would engrage people in my apartment again.overall: 6/10  if you just want to play some good offline basketball look no further. If you want anything else....lol dont buy it.

content:
Posted: September 26, 2015
												2K16 is a huge improvement to 2K15. With that said, a lot of negative reviews here are from the fps/stutter issues and terrible keyboard support. On default video settings, I also experienced fps drops and stutters during gameplay with a 980 and i7 4790k. However, after switching from Fullscreen mode to Windowed Fullscreen in the video options, all my fps and stutter issues were gone. I'd suggest a lot of people to try that if they are having problems and avoid using a keyboard for now. As far as crashes go, I haven't experienced any at all.Pros:-Improved MyCareer-Improved MyGM and MyLeague-Improved gameplay over 2K15-Incredible depth in MyLeague-Animations are way better-Defense is actually challenging and rewarding-Very smooth gameplay after stutters were fixedCons:-Bug with Fullscreen mode plagued with fps and stutter issues-Bad keyboard supportI'd highly recommend this if you are a fan of 2K15, as 2K16 is a massive improvement over it.

Posted: February 25
												They call this a basketball game?.It's more like The Basketball Diaries only instead of a crime drama it is the Spike Lee version of rising from the ghetto.I know I am not so good with sports game although I have played enough to know when things are out of balance.I have tried a few times to play this game on default settings and everytime it ends the same way.I miss 3 open lay ups in a row while the A.I. just seems to sink most everything it throws up.They also seem to be telepathic and they know where I will throw the ball and steal it quiet often.The worse part is the controls and passing is still an issue till this day.Though really those are just the minor issues.The bigger issues is the terrible A.I. that is your teamates it's more akin to playing with zombies then an actual team.The defense is terrible why bother keeping your man in check when the A.I will just let there man own them.In the end I do not mind losing but I still expect to lose a fair game not one where the A.I. I am playing makes almost every shot while my A.I. looks like Elmer Fudd trying to catch Bugs Bunny.The game does run great on my system which is just an Intel 6400, RX 470 and 16gigs of ram.So i give them that much for making the game work really well.I still do not see how this sells so much each year when it gets worse and worse.I got this in a bundle and I still regret it.I would rather play R.B.I. Baseball at least they try and be a baseball game.This game has mutli personaility disorder.Is it a basetkaball game or a Visual Novel about someone who wants to be in the NBA.ProsA actual baseketball game on the PCGood performanceYou can play as your favorite teamIt was in a bundle.Be A Player ModeConsIt was in a bundle and now I know why.Actuall basketball game that fails at being a basketball game.Poor A.I.Lame story by Spike Lee who is a washed up director who ruined the best part of this game.He also seems to think everyone wants to be a black player from a rough neighborhood.I have this say pass on this and well this is also why I have not bought NBA 2K since.This is what happens when your the only studio in town doing a sports game.It turns into Madden it get's worse every year and stall's with inovation.Why bother with any of that if people keep buying the same tired old game.I guess I do not blame them for not really trying when they have no reason to do so.

content:
Posted: November 9, 2015
												Pros:- nice to look at, nice to listen to- nice to play like a simulation- nice to laugh with (or at) Shaq and Kenny- nice to play with your friends (most of the time)Cons:- absolutely terrible Spike Lee story for MyCareer mode (completely linear with no choices at all, and terribly written "drama")- MyCareer starts at 2016-2017 - good luck with retiring of your favourite old guys- some lagging (he he) issues with online play, although it is improved over 2k15- no protection from people who cheat online - you have to beat guys who are quicker, stronger, taller, more precise than you will ever be just using your gaming skills- virtual currency isn't balanced well enough - some things are too easy to acquire, some are too hard, and some things just shouldn't be available to purchase with real money - this is an issue that's only going to be worse as years go by- a bug here and there, like sudden silence from the commentators' booth (for some gamers it's game-breaking, for me not so much) or unskippable cut-scenes mid-game. However, we've already had two patches and it seems that this year the developers are actually caring a bit more!Overall:- if you're a basketball fan(atic) and an avid gamer, then you already have this game- if you're looking at a high price and wondering if it's worth it, the answer is yes - just look for a discount somewhere and you will find it- if you want to know why there are more cons than pros up top, read on - this game is really good, but has a few annoying things that really shouldn't have been like thisThanks, Spike Lee. You've managed to write the story for MyCareer mode that wouldn't get a 3 on IMDb if it was a movie. What did I expect? A branching and immersive story. What did I get? My career starts in 2016/2017. No relation to real world anymore. Trades going on. MVPs happen. And I missed all of that.As you could have guessed, this is the game mode I play most. When this awful part of the game ends (the story), the game really becomes something much better. Many improvements have been made. Many opportunities have been missed, too, but you can't expect every single item on your wishlist to come true.The game is really challenging (on Hall of Fame level) and sometimes brutally unforgiving (your teammates just can't sink a shot or defend anyone sometimes, even if you're on fire on both ends of the floor), but I would say that it is a feature, not a bug.Online experience has been somewhat improved regarding MyPark from the last iteration, and I haven't really played much of other game modes.

content:
Posted: September 27, 2015
												I think this is the only NBA 2k that is actually superior in nearly every way than its predecessors.  It's more fluid, it has better graphics, it has more customization, it has more everything.  Some new features are executed very well and really add something new to the game.  It feels like a better game from day 1.  I've been interested enough to play 17 hours in 3 days, and more importantly, I've had new things to do in 17 hours.  All the negative reviews are filled with people with more hours than me, like, come on.But... the negative reviews are pretty justifiable.  2k has somehow forgotten the preorder bonuses and have done nothing about the hackers.  Every myPark game you go to, you will find a hacker.  Hacks include:-99 overall hack-Park cards hack-Badges hack-Skin hack-Bodymod hackAnd it also doesn't help that the PC version is terribly optimised and the myCareer seems like some half♥♥♥♥♥♥♥third party movie.  There is absolutely no freedom of choice in the myCareer.  It's completely possible they'll add a patch upgrading the story, fixing the optomisation, but at this stage of the game, don't get your hopes up.  I'm not really playing myCareer right now because they will presumably wipe your progress.Yes, you should buy this game if you're an avid basketball fan.  Even if this game sucked, I'd still buy it.  And dont think live 16 is that much better than 2k16.  So yeah, but it I guess.

content:
Posted: November 4, 2015
												This will be the last NBA game from 2k for me for a while. Though the gameplay is fun most of the time, the has bugs and glitches which carry on from year to year.Savefiles can get corrupted and become unloadable. Which means your spent VC are lost! This can happen to MyCareer and to MyGM (ever bought the team for 50k VC and some seasons later you can't load the save anymore? Very nice...)The game is balanced too much around the VC and onlinegameplay. Because of issues with MyPark during the last years, where 7 footers could hit 3s and run as quick as small point guard, they changed the skill system (again! and again for the worse). No my center is lame as a duck and can never be as quick as f.e. Dwight Howard. And you can't be the new Nowitzki or Jordan because the harsh way your skills are bound to your height is ridicoulus. I don't like the upgrading of skills in fixed categories either. Want to raise your midrange game? Well, then you have to raise 3s, fts as well. The old system, where you could just raise the one skill you wanted is gone since last year.Ingame the AI is often stuck and players will just hold on to the ball and do nothing until the shotclock is down to 2, then they will shoot a contested fadeaway 3...The new MyCareer story is a nice idea but failed hard. The story is outright racist, because there is just one family option. Want to be a white guy, or asian, or indian? Well, see how your twin and the whole family are afroamericans. They could have easily changed the story to say you have been adopted as a child and it would be fine! Then the story is always the same, just the teams you play for change. In your rookie season, you can play only 8 games and have absolutely no clue what's going on in the nba because you can't see any rankings, stats, etc. Becoming ROY is almost impossible, because you won't be getting the minutes you need and the other rookies are starters and play very good. Even with 15ppg 10rpg  and 2bpg I wasn't ROY, because i only played 20min/pg.You can't use custom rosters on MyCareer too btw, so no editing the playes too their real values. You won't earn any VC during highschool or college and will start as a 55 overall in the nba, even if you manage to get picked top ten or even #1. Well, 2k wants you to buy VC ;-)Then your second season, after free agency(!) you can earn 17million $ a year and still come off the bench. That you go to free agency after season 1 is total ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t and breaks the nba rules. You are no second rounder, come on 2k!Buy this only for 10€ or under in a sale.

content:
Posted: June 15, 2016
Product received for free
												Absolutely sick to my stomache i Gods promise to you all i've never been this worked up or upset about a game in my life. I just to get off my PC take a shower and a Xanax because it literally made me that livid. (True Story).I bought this game last night, i know that it's been released for awhile now but after 2k15 i swore to never buy another 2k game. I collapsed, i missed the greatness of my favorite sport Basketball. Within 5 minutes i felt like a kid again booting the NBA screen up all ready to play and deliver. As soon as i logged on i kid you not, literally within 5 minutes i realized i '♥♥♥♥ed' up. I went right away to my favorite mode as a long time 2k veteran. MyPlayer, yes hands down my cup of tea i love the fact you can almost virtually become an Allstar in 2k and it all feel so real. It didn't take very long for me to figure out it was exactly the same reason i gave my 2k15 disc to my dog as a chew toy (didnt end well) anyways.So this year brings a lot of exciting things, multiple game modes, character creation has never been better.The graphics are great allways delivers on that, aswell as animations and overall flow of the game. So minor glitches but nothing serious that effects the way you feel when your on the court. For the most part you have control. They honestly did a great job with the mechanics this year. Howerver for the myplayer they failed, and they failed hard. First and formost the name situation has been my biggest pet peve. You are named 'Frquency Vibrations' like seriously what the bloody hell is that? I mean its a joke and there is no way around it because its in ever cut scene, anoucement you name it its Freq, all day everday. But i said i can move passed this no big deal. So the main point of creating a my player is to be an allstar right? Well if you want that in 2k16 you can kiss your dreams goodbye unless you literally wanna dish up about 200 USD. Thats right 60 for the game, and about 120 - 180+ USD. just to have an allstar stat sheet. Well ofcourse thats if you want to pay right? Well some of us don't have the money to pay 200 USD to ball with all the other 99 Overall exploiters or rich kids so we earn it on our own. I calculated and did the math. It would take About 100 Hours just to reach and 88 Overall status. Who in they're right mind has the time and dedication for that. Thats just 88, and from there on it gets more expensive, and more VC so its honestly can range to about 300 to 400 hours to be a 99. Like many im sure i have to work, pay bills, dedicate time with my fiance live a life. Another sad factor is you can find ways around it like purposly fouling out of the game to get VC in about 2- 3 min but still its such a minimal amount that it would also take hundreds of hours, while defearing the whole purpose of the game, not plauing that is. What makes me so upset is how company's have turned so greedy. its not about the fanbase anymore its strictly 100% revenue.  You cannot purchase a damn thing without this Virtual Curency. Tattoos, clothes, shoes, accesories, editing you court so it can look cool all requires VC. And let me tell you its all very expensive so be prepared to grind harder on this then you would a 99 on runescape.I didn't have much time to write this review i am going to work, so its definitely going to have typos and errors and thats my bad i hope you all can get the point. Also something i forgot to mention the game is empty at this point, you will not find matches and if you do the are lagged out behyond belief and the patches ruined the main mechanics. They only version i would reccomend is the offline version only. But be prepared to have no customization and become a freq.\I will never purchase another 2k game again aslong as they have Virtual Currency, its like buying a game to just put the disc in, and then paying outrageous amounts of money just to even enjoy.Worst game experience of my life, i feel scammed, ripped off, and betrayed. Rant over. Save yourself 200 dollars and buy something worth it.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 30, 2015
Perspective: I'm a fan of the NBA 2K series for some time now, I have played every single game since 2K11 extensively and I have played NBA 2K16 for close to 150 hours at the time of this review.Short and sweet:NBA 2K16 is the best sports simulation game I have played to date. Unlike franchises like FIFA and Pro Evolution Soccer, 2K constantly reinvents it's game on a yearly basis rather than release the same product just with updated rosters every year.This year's title is a big step forward from the last one and it manages to do a lot of things right, particularly now after a few patches.If you're a basketball fan or even if you're just looking for a fun sports game to play casually, I would fully recommend you pick up this game even at full price.Long and nitpicky:The game's launch was not without it's issues, from gameplay tweaks that were made through patches and performance issues on PC... It was not a complete disaster but far from a perfect launch, from the inability for keyboard users to edit keybinds to graphic settings rendering the game unplayable it took some doing to get a great experience out of it at launch. As of the time of this review, most of these issues have been addressed though a little history never hurts anyone looking to make an informed purchase.Positives:The game boasts fairly good visuals and don't even get me started on the gameplay... It is by far the best basketball simulation game I have ever played, actually make that the best sports simulation game!Relatively low requirements on the hardware front make it accessible to a wide range of consumers which is always good though I'd recommend at least meeting the recommended requirements for a complete visual experience.For comparison's sake, I run the game on a GTX 970 (non-OC) and an i5 4690k (OC to 4,2 Ghz) with every possible filter injected (8x Supersample + 8x MFAA + FXAA) via Nvidia control panel and it runs silky smooth at 60 FPS at a 1080p resolution without GPU usage ever going above around 80% so we're dealing with a decent port here.When it comes to gameplay, most of the cheese tactics from previous years have been nullified in this year's game. Want to drive baseline and get a bucket everytime? Better boot up 2K15 then because it's not happening in 2K16.Excellent AI defense makes it a challenge to score every trip down the floor, mindless attempts to get to the basket will most likely result in blocked shots than in points, attempting to thread the needle through defenders will probably end up in a turnover... These are but a few examples of how AI has been improved this year.Most game modes are back and better than before, such as myGM and myTEAM. Up-to-date rosters, new and better animations and all other goodies that one might expect are also a part of the package.Negatives:The myCAREER mode was highly hyped as a Spike Lee directed story and I'm afraid it was arguably this game's greatest letdown. You follow your player's career since high school, into college and eventually into the NBA although in some key points along the ride you're faced with decisions which are presented to you but you really have no deciding power over what happens next. You're only able to play 8 games during your rookie year in the league (9 if your team makes the playoffs) the rest will be automatically simulated. This game mode opens up once you reach your sophomore year in the league however and from there the experience is excellent.The typical flavor of the month builds for myPLAYERs still exist after every patch, if you're looking to play myPARK or other online modes extensively this information might be of value to you.Also there are some latency issues for non-NA players, I personally can't make a jumper online because of this.myTEAM mode gets content updates regularly, but not regularly enough and most of the content it gets is irrelevant. This mode along with myPARK are the modes I'd classify as the 2 main attractions of the game when it comes to online play so I definitely see this as a negative. Most new packs contain only 1 or 2 relevant new cards and the rest will literally never see the light of day and have no use aside from contributing towards collection rewards.Summing up:NBA 2K16 is a solid 9/10 if I was asked to resort to that rating system.It's not a perfect game, but the issues it has have not dragged down the experience for me. The revamped gameplay and gorgeous visuals keep me coming back for more.The game is well worth it's full price and a complete must-have for any basketball simulation fan.

content:
Posted: September 25, 2015
												The graphics are definitely an upgrade from 2k15. From shooting to general movement, the game feels really smooth. I haven't experienced any crashes yet. I am running this on 1440p with a GTX 980.    My only quirk is that MyCareer has a little too much story. I like that fact that I can play in high school and all of that, but sometimes the cut scenes are way too long and not engaging at all. It all goes away after the first season though,, but then it feels completely empty because there are rarely anymore cut scenes.Also MyPark is basically dead during the day, but is packed during the night time. I do see a lot of the same people around so I hope the online community stays alive, but I wouldn't be surprised if everyone stops playing. I would say that the console ports have a bigger and wider community. I would blame it on the PC optimization of this game.Great game overall. Judging by the other reviews I wouldn't get this game unless you have a decent graphics card. If you can run this game you will have a lot of fun.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 8, 2016
												NBA 2K16 is a very under-appreciated game, although it is not one of the best games of the 2K series, it is still a very fun and innovative game. First, the My Player game mode, I understand it is not as fun as it was on 2K15, but it is as in-depth and realistic as ever before. Sure, the cut-scenes are a bit over the top and sure some of the cutscenes last a fairly long time, but on the whole, I still really enjoyed the story and the gamemode. My Park is a very simple and easy way to play against people online, and is very relevant if you just want to play a short game without having to take it seriously. On the whole a very fun gamemode but maybe lacking some excitement.Yes, maybe the ratings are a bit unjust this year. I agree that the cover stars (Steph Curry, Anthony Davis and James Harden) are maybe a bit overrated compared to how they play in real life. I am a big fan of Curry and the Warriors, but I think some of his passing stats, running and defending stats are maybe a bit too high and should be lowered a bit, but not too drastically. Although Davis has had his troubles with injuries as of late, I still feel he is a couple overalls too high and I feel an 88-89 rating would have suited him better. Finally, with James Harden I think he is a very talented guard, but his defendsive rating is way too generous to him. Harden is quite a poor defender and the way he has defended this season, I am sure you guys will agree with me here.People that give this game a negative review obviously haven't looked at the EA Sports NBA Live series. 2K16 is undoubtebly the much better game and is alot more fun. For people that complain a lot about this game, I recommend they play a game of NBA Live and see if they still complain about 2k16...

content:
Posted: May 31, 2016
												If you're looking for an NBA game, you don't really have a choice.2K kind of exploits that through microtransactions, but it's not near as bad as most games. Sales for VC come up often and are usually pretty decent discounts (ex: 75% $10 amount). MyCareer sucks. You have hardly any control over your player. The High School and College games are very fun and atmospheric, but they're super short. If you're a white person like me, you get stuck into a black family and can't do anything about it. I wouldn't have an issue with it except for the fact that you have a TWIN SISTER that is also black. The main issue for me outside of the terrible story that you have no influence over is the fact that you can only play EIGHT games your rookie season! And even worse? YOU GO INTO FREE AGENCY AFTER THAT YEAR! I was #1 overall draft pick and I go into FA after the year?Overall the game is pretty good for gameplay. Jump shooters from midrange are the best, as layups and 3s have a pretty low chance of going in unless the player has high ratings.MyGM has a nice feature to relocate a team anywhere and completely rebrand it. I chose the Clippers and relocated them to Kansas City after a few years, overall it was a nice experience.As for online-- I don't play sports games online as they ruin the game for me, but I've heard it's full of cheaters on PC and you'd be better off getting it on a console if you're going to play online.

content:
Posted: December 28, 2015
												Here is my thoughts on the game as of two main gamemodes as in the MyGM gamemode and the MyCareer GamemodeMyGM:I felt like the MyGM mode was fairly good and very refreshing for a gamemode that has been the same and kind of needed a new thing added to it. The team relocation is a great addition, but is very hard to do and you need to play for a long time to get enough salary to even have the oppurtunity to do the relocation. So if you have the time to do 4-5 seasons and be able to complete the goals then you will be fine. But if you only do anything below the 4-5 seasons then the MyGM mode is mainly the same with only a new layout and 3-team trades to go along with it.MyCareer:They add highschool, college, and you get a story through the first year in the NBA. What could go wrong? That you play 15 games, 3 being 3 minute quarters, and then watch a movie for the rest of the time having no control when if it is really your life and options then you should be able to choose like you could in NBA 2K15. But this is really sad to see because they advertise it as a game where you can choose your story and life.......in reality you can't. NBA 2K15 - 7/10Get it on sale, not for full price.

content:
Posted: September 27, 2015
												NBA2k16 has been poorly ported to the PC. It suffers frequent crashes, unacceptably long loading times, and in general the story doesn't add anything to the game. I was a fan of NBA2k15 and NBA2k13 but with 10 hours on the clock I'm already ready to stop playing NBA2k16. I feel that the gameplay is a solid improvement over NBA2k15 but it's held back by everything not related to actually playing basketball. I like the fact 2k was willing to try something new in my career but the implementation leaves me feeling like I'm playing some arcade game. Finally, this game is once again attempting to sell you a virtual currency as a method of making yet more money. On a game that can cost as much as $80 it's unacceptable.Final note on the virtual currency - It's possible to use Cheat Engine to increase how much virtual currency you have. Do not spend money on the microtransactions just hack in 100k virtual currency through a cheat table. Just search for "cheat engine table nba2k16" on your favorite search engine.
