content:
Posted: October 12, 2015
												I decided to review this game due to the many negative reviews it has gotten on Steam. I have played 2K14, 2K15 and now 2K16 and this game seems to be the one that has got me hooked the most. I feel like the career/story is a bit silly, it might just be me but I don't care about the personal life of my character, all I want to do is shoot some hoops. I havent experienced any crashes but I have seen a few glitches in-game but they don't disrupt the game for me and they will hopefully be patched in the near future. I feel the pre-game and post-game show/breakdown isn't detailed enough and the cut scenes where it shows the city where you are about to play are really low resolution for some reason. I would recommend this game but be aware that some people do experience crashes.

content:
Posted: September 26, 2015
												I have mixed feelings about this game. MyCareer, at least the story portion of it is awesome at first. You go from high school, to college to the NBA, after that it's one giant cluster of a mess of a story. I didn't really like it one bit. You get two choices in the story 1) What high school you're attending and 2) What college you're committing to. It was difficult to get immersed into a story that I didn't particularly care about and the story wasn't engaging at all, there is no input, no matter how poorly you play your rookie season, the story arc is exactly the same. Spike Lee? Please stay away from video games, your story telling is sub par.Other than that, the game itself is really good. The controls feel different and I think it's a good thing. The mechanics feel better and you can see the work they put in on the animations in the game. I like how deep the customization is on relocation from the arena, to uniforms, to logos..ect, it's all on point.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 27, 2015
												Best NBA 2K game so far, concerning gameplay and visuals. It's more or less the same game as the before years, without some of the kinks and with a couple additional features. It's really, really, really fun! I mostly played MyPlayer (the career mode) with two positions (PG and C) and this year it's better than ever, because the AI actually tries to set up plays and moves around the whole shotclock, whereas before they just stood around when the play fell apart. I didn't like the newest, most hyped, addition to the game which was Spike Lee's Story Mode in MyPlayer. Yeah it's fun to play in high school and college but it just sucks that you only play about 10 games your rookie year and the rest is simulated. Part of the fun for me was trying to win ROY award and play in All Star Games while my stats aren't that good. Another weird thing is (and I skiped most of the story) that you're released at the end of your first year, and sign a 10 million dollar contract in your 2nd year in the league, with pretty much any team you like. Long story short: Buy it, you won't be disappointed (even in MyPlayer once you finish the Spike Lee storyline)

content:
Posted: October 1, 2015
												Okay, I will start with the fact that this game is way better than last years game. After playing 30+ hours now and in my third season of mycareer and I can now write an honest review. All the things people keep complaining about are miniscule.  Having a black family in MyCareer is really not that big of a deal. Yes you are a white guy (if thats what you pick) but really it dosent matter. After a couple hours you through with the rookie year of 8 games and all the cut scenes. The only downside is you cant win rookie of the year. Then after the last cut scene goes its normal AND MUCH MORE IMPROVED mycareer. The off  days managment is exactly what mycareer needed. You can pick all sorts of activities and they all have a risk-reward system. All in All I think this year was a vast improvement and I believe people on here just like to complain. Teh preorder VC came as soon as the game came out, along with all the preorder stuff. The difficulty is much higher this year not in that the AI cheats but actually plays basketball the right way and you cant just cheese (run around the defender until you get open) the defender and win. You actually have to play basketball and move the ball around even on lower difficulties. I believe this year was much better and please do not look to the negative reviews as most of them were people complaining that they didnt get thier preorder VC because they didnt read that they dont get it until the actual release of the game.

content:
Posted: September 26, 2015
												Running it with an fx-8350 and an R9 380 at max settings, haven't had any frame rate drops at all, the audio has moments during games where it seems like it's been put through a bitcrusher, but it usually doesn't last for more than a second or two so it's not a big negative.Pros:Gameplay is extremely fluid, no more running past clunky defenders, earn your baskets.When you score, you actually feel good about yourself.Post play has been improved greatly, animations are smoother and believable.Animations in general have been greatly improved.As someone who generally dislikes most of the musical tracks in the NBA games, I don't find myself wanting to mute it anytime the music starts playing, so I guess that's a plus.The be a coach mode or whatever has also received an overhaul and is very deep in terms of choices and gameplay.Stadiums look really really niceThe rim moves when you dunk... Sometimes.Your MYPlayer actually looks like he could be based off of a real person and not some ♥♥♥♥ed up generic clone.Cons:The story in MYCareer mode is VERY CHEESY, not enough for me to dislike the game, but enough to be mentioned as a con.Though animations have been improved, there are a couple contact-shot animations near the basket that could use some work.Haven't received my bonus VC yet for the pre-order, I heard that I'll be able to get it when the game officially releases on the 29th. How come the console peasants get their Bonus now??? Yes, I'm salty.OVERALL- The game has improved substantially over the last few years, both in terms of animations and graphical detail. I'll give it a 9/10 and definitely would reccomend it to those of you who haven't yet pulled the trigger on it.

content:
Posted: November 5, 2016
												There's a lot of negative reviews on this game, and frankly, I don't understand why. Most of the hours I've put into this game came from MyCareer. And I have to say it is fun and challenging to play and to manager your life. You have to decide whether you'll spend your free day practising, hanging out with your teammates or doing commercials. The 1st season is the "Spike Lee" season, and I'll agree that the story is scripted, and you really don't have many choices to take. But the story itself is great.I would definitely recommend getting this game on a discount, it's just so fun and good

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 26, 2015
												Running it with an fx-8350 and an R9 380 at max settings, haven't had any frame rate drops at all, the audio has moments during games where it seems like it's been put through a bitcrusher, but it usually doesn't last for more than a second or two so it's not a big negative.Pros:Gameplay is extremely fluid, no more running past clunky defenders, earn your baskets.When you score, you actually feel good about yourself.Post play has been improved greatly, animations are smoother and believable.Animations in general have been greatly improved.As someone who generally dislikes most of the musical tracks in the NBA games, I don't find myself wanting to mute it anytime the music starts playing, so I guess that's a plus.The be a coach mode or whatever has also received an overhaul and is very deep in terms of choices and gameplay.Stadiums look really really niceThe rim moves when you dunk... Sometimes.Your MYPlayer actually looks like he could be based off of a real person and not some ♥♥♥♥ed up generic clone.Cons:The story in MYCareer mode is VERY CHEESY, not enough for me to dislike the game, but enough to be mentioned as a con.Though animations have been improved, there are a couple contact-shot animations near the basket that could use some work.Haven't received my bonus VC yet for the pre-order, I heard that I'll be able to get it when the game officially releases on the 29th. How come the console peasants get their Bonus now??? Yes, I'm salty.OVERALL- The game has improved substantially over the last few years, both in terms of animations and graphical detail. I'll give it a 9/10 and definitely would reccomend it to those of you who haven't yet pulled the trigger on it.

content:
Posted: December 28, 2015
												Here is my thoughts on the game as of two main gamemodes as in the MyGM gamemode and the MyCareer GamemodeMyGM:I felt like the MyGM mode was fairly good and very refreshing for a gamemode that has been the same and kind of needed a new thing added to it. The team relocation is a great addition, but is very hard to do and you need to play for a long time to get enough salary to even have the oppurtunity to do the relocation. So if you have the time to do 4-5 seasons and be able to complete the goals then you will be fine. But if you only do anything below the 4-5 seasons then the MyGM mode is mainly the same with only a new layout and 3-team trades to go along with it.MyCareer:They add highschool, college, and you get a story through the first year in the NBA. What could go wrong? That you play 15 games, 3 being 3 minute quarters, and then watch a movie for the rest of the time having no control when if it is really your life and options then you should be able to choose like you could in NBA 2K15. But this is really sad to see because they advertise it as a game where you can choose your story and life.......in reality you can't. NBA 2K15 - 7/10Get it on sale, not for full price.

content:
Posted: September 27, 2015
												NBA2k16 has been poorly ported to the PC. It suffers frequent crashes, unacceptably long loading times, and in general the story doesn't add anything to the game. I was a fan of NBA2k15 and NBA2k13 but with 10 hours on the clock I'm already ready to stop playing NBA2k16. I feel that the gameplay is a solid improvement over NBA2k15 but it's held back by everything not related to actually playing basketball. I like the fact 2k was willing to try something new in my career but the implementation leaves me feeling like I'm playing some arcade game. Finally, this game is once again attempting to sell you a virtual currency as a method of making yet more money. On a game that can cost as much as $80 it's unacceptable.Final note on the virtual currency - It's possible to use Cheat Engine to increase how much virtual currency you have. Do not spend money on the microtransactions just hack in 100k virtual currency through a cheat table. Just search for "cheat engine table nba2k16" on your favorite search engine.

Posted: October 12, 2015
												I decided to review this game due to the many negative reviews it has gotten on Steam. I have played 2K14, 2K15 and now 2K16 and this game seems to be the one that has got me hooked the most. I feel like the career/story is a bit silly, it might just be me but I don't care about the personal life of my character, all I want to do is shoot some hoops. I havent experienced any crashes but I have seen a few glitches in-game but they don't disrupt the game for me and they will hopefully be patched in the near future. I feel the pre-game and post-game show/breakdown isn't detailed enough and the cut scenes where it shows the city where you are about to play are really low resolution for some reason. I would recommend this game but be aware that some people do experience crashes.

content:
Posted: September 26, 2015
												I have mixed feelings about this game. MyCareer, at least the story portion of it is awesome at first. You go from high school, to college to the NBA, after that it's one giant cluster of a mess of a story. I didn't really like it one bit. You get two choices in the story 1) What high school you're attending and 2) What college you're committing to. It was difficult to get immersed into a story that I didn't particularly care about and the story wasn't engaging at all, there is no input, no matter how poorly you play your rookie season, the story arc is exactly the same. Spike Lee? Please stay away from video games, your story telling is sub par.Other than that, the game itself is really good. The controls feel different and I think it's a good thing. The mechanics feel better and you can see the work they put in on the animations in the game. I like how deep the customization is on relocation from the arena, to uniforms, to logos..ect, it's all on point.

content:
Posted: September 26, 2015
												***PARTIAL FIX FOR STUTTER/LAG***By using RTSS and MSI Afterburner to cap my frame rate at 60, then displaying the game in full screen windowed mode, the stuttering and lag has been massively reduced. Once the updated drivers and game patch come out, this will be 100% perfect. I have really enjoyed the game itself so far. My Career is a little heavy on the cutscenes but the difficulty once you're in the NBA has certainly been ramped up and it feels a lot more challenging on the higher difficulties now.

content:
Posted: September 27, 2015
												Although far from being perfect, 2k16 is the best basketball sim out right now. It improved a lot gamplay-wise, but took a step back in production quality. Upated Nvidia drivers and future patches will def be needed. As of right now, it's a: 7/10+ Defense actually matters now. It's very difficult to 1v5 anymore. A lot of people will complain about this, but once you learn how to call plays and use picks, it's not bad.+ Improved passing mechanics+ More things to do in MyCareer. Also I actually liked the story that Spike did during the rookie year. It's a lot different from last year, and if it's not your thing, it's easy to skip.+ Better rating system imo+ More historic teams+ Much better music than last year- Can't change PC controls- High school/college gameplay in MyCareer is very shallow and doesn't give you any VC- Crashes. The game crashes much more often, and it's very frustrating.- Buggy. There are times during the game when it just 'hangs up' during the cutscenes, and i'm stuck looking at some guy for like 20s before anything happens. The announcers randomly stop talking at times too. - Performance. I actually haven't noticed that big of a performance difference btwn 2k15 and 16, but a lot of other ppl apparently have. Just wait for updated video drivers guys!- Hackers online already

												I was hesitant about buying this game due to the commentator bug, so I took a risk and bought it and I'm pleased to say the commentator bug has been addressed. content:
Posted: October 1, 2015
												Okay, I will start with the fact that this game is way better than last years game. After playing 30+ hours now and in my third season of mycareer and I can now write an honest review. All the things people keep complaining about are miniscule.  Having a black family in MyCareer is really not that big of a deal. Yes you are a white guy (if thats what you pick) but really it dosent matter. After a couple hours you through with the rookie year of 8 games and all the cut scenes. The only downside is you cant win rookie of the year. Then after the last cut scene goes its normal AND MUCH MORE IMPROVED mycareer. The off  days managment is exactly what mycareer needed. You can pick all sorts of activities and they all have a risk-reward system. All in All I think this year was a vast improvement and I believe people on here just like to complain. Teh preorder VC came as soon as the game came out, along with all the preorder stuff. The difficulty is much higher this year not in that the AI cheats but actually plays basketball the right way and you cant just cheese (run around the defender until you get open) the defender and win. You actually have to play basketball and move the ball around even on lower difficulties. I believe this year was much better and please do not look to the negative reviews as most of them were people complaining that they didnt get thier preorder VC because they didnt read that they dont get it until the actual release of the game.

content:
Posted: November 8, 2015
												I am going to say that 2K16 has the best presentation in terms of crowds, pre-game show, post-game show, and other stuff. The graphics look great too, but graphics are not everything. And this game is very unstable, network-wise as the game forces you to play online if you want to see actual and meaningful progress for your MyCareer (it started last year; you can play offline with limited experience; BS). Anyway, server always crashes, and for one week, there would be atleast 2 me or my friend cannot connect through the network. This is disappointing as they release a huge patch which definitely improved the performance, but did not even fix some of the major problems like the commentator dropping out if you're playing with 6+ minute per quarter. Cannot play an online game with friend without us getting kicked off with no apparent reason, and many more.If you will ever fix this game; please, fix it now or before the year ends. Another thing is the MyCareer, I hate the first part of it. The story is unwanted, though I had wanted to start from HS to College and eventually to NBA, but you don't have to put some drama crap within it. You emphasize this game as my choice, but on the first part of the game mode, there is no choice whatsoever. Good thing I got passed it and finally enjoying a better MyCareer experience.Don't buy it full price. Buy it when it's 33% or 50% off atleast.EDIT AS OF 11/21/2015:Yes, I will finally recommend this game to you guys. They finally fixed almost everything, finally, and finally. Though if you're not a hardcore fan, just wait for atleasst 33% off since the game may be really fun, but if you're looking for a total innovation, you won't really find it here, and MyCareer this year has been the cheesiest one so far (just the first year). If you can get this cheap, much better, if no, I must say it's now a decent game to play.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 25, 2015
												I love sports games and had been looking forward to playing the Spike Lee story of "Frequency Vibrations" for some time although basketball isn't my sport (September is normally saved for Fifa or Madden).Initially I didn't recommend the game with early pre-release issues with lengthy loading times (which appear to be a part of the game) and frequent crashes which really hurt the immersion into the journey of Freq (these seem to have settled a bit).As someone who purchased the game solely for the MyCareer mode I have now given it enough of a go after 11 hours to say the basketball is fantastic, the graphics amazing, soundtrack awesome and as such I can live with the terminally slow loading times (as slow as Ed Cowan was as Australian opener a few years back).Playing a couple of high school and college games was pretty neat and I liked how the story mode through the first season kept player progression under control so Freq wasn't Rookie of the Year or an immediate All Star.Having been drafted at #13 by the Suns, my Albert "Freq" Timmerman enjoyed free agency negotiations and is now fighting to get his minutes up at the Bucks (getting 21 mpg at present and climbing along with his stats).While I'll enjoy working on Freq, I will have to check out some other game modes now too :)

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: October 7, 2015
												NBA 2K16 boasts the most impressive feature set of any sports game I've ever played. I normally despise basketball, but this game has started my transformation back into a fan.+One you're through the Spike Lee part of MyCareer, the mode is fantastic and holds a lot of depth.+MyLeague is a customizer's dream! You can move any team, re-brand them, control every team, or just let the CPU run a league in the background.+MyGM is the ultimate manager game inside a full sim basketball game. Building relationships a lot of fun. Al Horford has massive paranoia that I'm going to trade him. It's like I'm telling my girlfriend I'm totally not cheating on her every 5 minutes.+Best looking sports game out there.+Best presentation of any sports game out there.-There are some technical issues, like commentary cutting out, graphical glitches, and some of the online modes aren't fully up to par, but for a single player like me, these are small issues that will hopefully be fixed.-Spike Lee's story is underwhelming.

content:
Posted: October 23, 2015
												Overall this is a thumbs up, the gameplay is fun, but honestly it's not a big upgrade over last year. The MyCarrer mode has an embarassingly lame over the top story attached in which you don't get to make any decesions until after the actual story is over. For example why is all this drama going on and yet no one will even acknowledge I'm clearly not the son of this black family and that isn't my sister. They just pretend like in the movie The Jerk that I'm their black son... but my alabaster skin and thin stringy red hair is a dead giveaway that I'm not - just let me tell this leech that is messing up my career to hit the bricks and let me hire a private investiagtor to find out what happened to my real parents. Ugh. Also while all the cut scenes say I'm going top overall I end up being drafted 21st and it's never acknowledged. I know NBA salaries and a 21st pick isn't having everything this dude is having. Also why am I a free agent after my first year? They don't really explain that either. Anywho once you get past that terrible over the top Spike Lee borefest the gameplay is pretty good, it seems a bit tigther than last year. On my fairly top of the line gaming rig the game plays perfect at 3440x1440, I do recall last year that early versions of the game had performance dips, this seems more polished. However once you get past those minor changes I don't see much that is new.For me this is worth it as I played some of the free weekends on the NBA 2K15 deals they do on Steam but bought it on the XB1. I wanted it on my PC so I could stream to my Shield handheld and it doesn't disappoint (at least when on the same local wifi). If you have last years version on the PC to me it would be hard to recommend at the full price, but there are minor improvements all around and you do get that new story in MC, plus updated/new multiplayer stuff even though I never use it. If you're a couple of years behind then certainly buy this, the new engine that introduced last year on the PC is a huge step up graphically and play wise.

content:
Posted: September 25, 2015
												I love sports games and had been looking forward to playing the Spike Lee story of "Frequency Vibrations" for some time although basketball isn't my sport (September is normally saved for Fifa or Madden).Initially I didn't recommend the game with early pre-release issues with lengthy loading times (which appear to be a part of the game) and frequent crashes which really hurt the immersion into the journey of Freq (these seem to have settled a bit).As someone who purchased the game solely for the MyCareer mode I have now given it enough of a go after 11 hours to say the basketball is fantastic, the graphics amazing, soundtrack awesome and as such I can live with the terminally slow loading times (as slow as Ed Cowan was as Australian opener a few years back).Playing a couple of high school and college games was pretty neat and I liked how the story mode through the first season kept player progression under control so Freq wasn't Rookie of the Year or an immediate All Star.Having been drafted at #13 by the Suns, my Albert "Freq" Timmerman enjoyed free agency negotiations and is now fighting to get his minutes up at the Bucks (getting 21 mpg at present and climbing along with his stats).While I'll enjoy working on Freq, I will have to check out some other game modes now too :)

content:
Posted: February 12, 2016
												Yes, MyCareer story can be cheesy and dramatic, but it is only there for the first season, and you only have to play 8 NBA games. After that, you CAN change your nickname (contrary to what others have said), and the MyCareer mode becomes much better. Do yourself a favor and just push through the story to get to the real MyCareer mode. I haven't player 2k15 so I don't know how similar it is, but compared to 2k13/14, I prefer both MyGM and MyCareer in 2k16. The way endorsements and contacts work, with off-day decisions, works really well. The contract negotiations and player/staff morale work really well as well. The actual basketball gameplay is better in this game because it focuses on teamwork, and you can't just keep soloing as Durant or Steph or whoever your team's star is (at least on the higher difficulties). Overall, I think the story and bugs are what annoyed people about this game. I have not experienced any performance issues on my MSI laptop (960M NVIDIA card), but I'd do research on whether your computer will have problems with this game before purchasing. Finally, yes people hardly play online anymore, so if that is what you are buying this game for, you are probably better off getting it for consoles (due to larger sports playerbase) or just waiting until 2k17. I would still never recommend buying yearly sports games at full price, only because there will always be a better one next year, but since this keeps going on sale so often, grab it if it is < $30, with MJ Edition only if you want the head start for your MyPlayer.Edit: Forgot to mention, but 2KTV is awesome. The interviews are great, and the interactive polls and voting for best player dunks etc are fun and give VCs.Edit 2: As I played it again I realized that the presentation is something worth mentioning. While it makes the games take longer, I love watching the Inside the NBA crew (minus Chuck) for pregame and postgame. The halftime team meetings are cool as well. All of these are skippable though, for those who want to just play the game.PS: 2K Sports, PLEASE make a game out of that epic opening cutscene, I'm sure everyone would love it!

content:
Posted: May 25, 2016
												So after more than 172 hours into this game, and undoubtedly more to come, I think I can give a good Review on this game. I play on Superstar difficulty. You should bear that in mind when I review gameplay mechanics. GRAHICS: 8/10 It's more centered towards consoles, of course. It's still good. My mom once passed me playing & asked "Are you watching March of Madness?" Should give you an idea.GAMEPLAY: 9/10 The most important part of a basketball game is, of course, the basketball. & no one should be disappointed in this aspect. Even though this game is obviously more geared towards console users, the game is still miles better than previous titles in punishing the user for not having basketball simple IQ. You're going to hear a lot of people say that 2k15 was better. & I'll be honest it's easier to beast mode on Hall of Fame. But that's simply because you can cheese too much. Why I rate This game so high is because of its attempt to limit cheesing from previous titles & keep/improve upon the incorperation of real basketball concepts.Shot Selection Importants:  Early after the games release you had players like Steph Curry missing 3 pointers taken early in transition, & unexplicably you still have players now with high 3 point accuracy missing open shots sometimes. The updates have fixed this a little, but I like where their heads where at. Because even though we have amazing 3 point shooters in the league, being a championship team is not about taking good shots, but passing up good shots for great ones. & more importantly the rhythm you're in when you take your shot is hugely important. The game will punish you if you aren't smart with the ball. Knowing when a player is on a hot night & when he's cold is hugely important. & It mostly depends on his physical state & morale. If your player in MyCarrer has been on the practice court after back to back games & tomorrow he's got another match you can bet he's going to be tired as balls & miss a lot of his easy shots. If you're unfamiliar with 2k they still do a great job of programming the AI to play like the real team would. You can bet that the Clippers are going to punish you with a ally-oop if you leave a lane open. Golden State will punish you from 3 if you're not physical on Defense.Speaking of Defense this is where I have to commend this game. In 2k15 the defense was too easy to press the boost trigger & run around defenders. You could just cut & boost around the Defense going to the hole way to easily. In this title you have to EARN ALL YOUR POINTS. You have to know how to break ancles, having the wallet to increase your stats aren't enough. You actually have to know how to play the game of basketball. When to create isolation shots for you & your teamates, how to do that on and off the ball, etc. This game has vastly improved the Defense. They won't let you get past them by just hitting the boost button.MYCAREER 7/10: Let's address what's on everyones mind: Spike Lee Joint. Now I'm going to say it up front. This title has made me make a new rule about anything I play. "If at any point the story brings you to tears, you cannot rate it below 7/10. No matter how many hours the story is." I don't want to spoil anything folks, but there's a reason this game has the Story Rich tag. Spike Lee once again releases a controversal story which, in my opinion, tries to show you the life of what it's ACTUALLY like for most NBA players. It's not all shoe deals & fame but you still have a past. You still have friends from your past. The most important element of NBA life I think this story potrays is you will have friends & family leach off of your & it's how you respond to your situation that determines your success in the NBA. The positives of this story far outweigh the negatives, in my opinion. Then again I care more about basketball than the story.Now we stll have to talk about the negatives. Your family is inevitably black. No matter how you swing it. This normally wouldn't be a problem for someone if you aren't racist, cause adoption, but the story makes reference about your sister being a biological twin. So it kind of ruins the immersion if your character isn't black. Which is why I think this title is different because it's not supposed to be you, but Freq. Why people are mad at this is because in times past you were able to be yourself & there would be relatively no story but you would sign shoe deals & be a megastar. I've tried to find a million different ways to say this but this game doesn't necessarily want your face on the story, but instead Freq's. It's the difference between role-playing a defined character or a silent protagonist in my opinion. A preference thing. But you can't doubt that the story is immersive once you get over yourself. I'd personally like to see more of this from 2k but extend towards other ethnic groups. Maybe even do a 2k story about the difficulties the first woman player might face in the NBA.MYTEAM ?/10: Please refer to another review for this. It's not my cup of tea cause I'm not into that fantasy♥♥♥♥♥♥but from everything I've heard & all the gameplay I've seen on youtube it looks... Nice? One thing I'll say is that you can get beat out by people with deep pockets if you don't know the game of basketball, as is the same with all of your online expliots.MYCOURT 3/10: Do not get me started. It's dead. Liek, so ded. Granted I've played a few matches but nothing like on console. Mostly the 1v1v1 player match & 4-5 3 on 3 matches. You have to get with a friend & do some magic voodo♥♥♥♥♥♥in order to find a server with people on it. If you're buying this game to put in a ton of online hours don't. Just don't, not on PC. I personally don't think 2k is going to be a company that gears its products to PC users. Online aspects are total crap.PRO-AM 2/10: Take my review with a grain of salk cause I have NEVER BEEN ABLE TO ENTER A MATCH. Never. I'm certain that like 10-15 of my hours can be attributed to waiting in an online lobby of some kind. I'm going to warn you with bold letters so you can't blame this review. IF YOU'RE GOING TO BUY THIS GAME FOR ONLINE STUFF YOU MUST HAVE FRIENDS. Like, as many as possible. Don't rely on people you meet in game either. You might get a few sessions in if you're lucky but you need RL friends with Steam & you need to go on Reddit to find people to play with. I tried for a little but it was just too tedious for me. MyGM 8/10: I think they nailed this, not much else to be said really. If you enjoy management of a basketball team & building a team based on your preferences with real basketball concepts this is your mode. Combine that with the improved gameplay from the last game & this is a great mode. You can choose to buy out the team you're managing, which is nice. You can of course manage prices of your seats, merchandice, & concession stands. You can relocate your team. Options are almost endless. My personal fav is having different personalities for your different Team owners. They've all got their own way of running a franchise whether it be focused more on winning at all costs, or making sure the team is in the black every fiscal year. & your owners vary in their patience & involvment in your decisions. Player minutes on the court, price of stuff, focusing on Draft picks or aquiring talent in the off-season, sometimes they'll defer to your judgement, & sometimes they won't take no for an answer & that all depends on how long of a lesh they give you. TLDR: You have to know your♥♥♥♥♥♥if you're going to play this years 2k cause less cheesing. MyCarrer is different from past titles, but a great story. Online sux balls, but were already in playoffs so that shouldn't really matter. MyGM is as stable & reliable as shes ever been. Not much has changed & what has changed is for the better IMO. If you're a basketball pureist who is okay with next gen console graphics this is for you.

Posted: September 25, 2015
												Here's the truth. Game is either terrible or great depending on what MODE you like. Though let's be fair, this PC version has a lot of issues right now regardless. Firstly, have fun Nvidia users. Chances are, you'll have to fiddle around with the settings to get this to work. Maximum performance is a hint. Then there's the sound issue, which seems to revolve around selecting 440 htz in studio. And that somehow improves your graphics....how they correlate I'll never understand. Also, people want keyboard support and such. ANYWAYS, onto the elephant in the room...My CareerThey lied to us. Promised an experience like never before. Talked about choices. Yadda yadda. 7hrs in, only choices I've made are on highschool and college teams. But I sure did get to learn about the Phoenix Sun's owner's childhood, and his friend Isadore lolOH an my agent's lemonade stand. ughreally? Not to mention, game is racisit as all get out. First, black family in the projects. Second, can't be white or asian or latino. Nope -- I mean, you CAN be, but you're not really. Just an Uh Oh Oreo. Because yeah, your family is black. Twin sister lol. Mom talks about birthing you. And you can be a white guy, blonde hair, blue eyes hahaThe italian guy says capeesh every 5 seconds. The white owner is from the burbs, and is a rich golf club type. 2K, I wouldn't be surprised if someone sues you for this career mode. It is AWFUL. Like playing Mass Effect 2 without dialogue choices. Like watching a bad Spike Lee documentary....oh waitRest of the game modes are fine. I like the changes to defense and passing. Oh an the changes to MyGM an such. But yeah, MyCareer - if you want this game for that alone, you'll be disappointed. ...sigh, rather have had M Night Shamalan or whatever directed it. Least I could have laughed at it. EDIT: After you get through the 'movie' portion of MyCareer, the regular one we all know shows up with some nice additions. Just, have to suffer through all that BS first lol

content:
Posted: September 25, 2015
												Lovely game, feels a little unoptimized for modern machines - I've been running Mad Max at ultra high resolutions, but this game is giving my video card much more of a workout.Still. Very recognizably a Spike Lee production, MyPlayer is actually engaging this year. New pass controls are pretty slick, and the soundtrack is - as always - on point.If you like the 2K games, buy it. If you think you might like a basketball game, it's a great way to find out. If you want a single-player Basketball sojourn from Harlem to the NBA, with RPG advancement mechanics, thoughtful, nuanced acting, and a lot of people yelling, as curated by Spike Lee, there really aren't any other options.I for one, didn't know I wanted this until I got it.

content:
Posted: September 25, 2015
												First of all I'm using a 7 years old computer with a very few little tweaks and played 6 hours straight after I got it and not one crash or lag. I do experience a framerate drop when timeout animation takes place so that's not even game breaking since its well time out.  Crowd's sound also gets messed up once in a while but that's not gameplay related again.  It really make me wonder why gamers with 5x better computer than me cant even play the game because of crashes and low framerate. Anyway this is my first basketball game since dreamcast days and I have been patiently waiting for the right version/year of 2k bball to buy and after a few research here and there, finally decided to pick up nba2k16.  My first impression is I'm really enjoying it. My high school championship in MyCareer went to triple overtime, pretty intense!  I'm still trying to get used to the controls but so far so good. Do I recommend this game? I think I will recommend this game at least the non-online aspect of it since I havent tried and probably take me a while to play online so I can't help you there. Other than that I think it's a solid basketball game and I will edit this review for more in-depth review as I play more. My player got drafted 20th overall by the Raptors, not sure if its scripted but I'm excited to keep progressing till I get my first all star and then playoffs and maybe my first ring.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 25, 2015
												First of all I'm using a 7 years old computer with a very few little tweaks and played 6 hours straight after I got it and not one crash or lag. I do experience a framerate drop when timeout animation takes place so that's not even game breaking since its well time out.  Crowd's sound also gets messed up once in a while but that's not gameplay related again.  It really make me wonder why gamers with 5x better computer than me cant even play the game because of crashes and low framerate. Anyway this is my first basketball game since dreamcast days and I have been patiently waiting for the right version/year of 2k bball to buy and after a few research here and there, finally decided to pick up nba2k16.  My first impression is I'm really enjoying it. My high school championship in MyCareer went to triple overtime, pretty intense!  I'm still trying to get used to the controls but so far so good. Do I recommend this game? I think I will recommend this game at least the non-online aspect of it since I havent tried and probably take me a while to play online so I can't help you there. Other than that I think it's a solid basketball game and I will edit this review for more in-depth review as I play more. My player got drafted 20th overall by the Raptors, not sure if its scripted but I'm excited to keep progressing till I get my first all star and then playoffs and maybe my first ring.

content:
Posted: October 5, 2015
												Coming into this game I was so hyped to play it, but man I did not expect 2K to drop the ball this year like they did.. where do I even start with this game so many negatives! The pc optimization is pure trash I'm shocked it even got released the game is almost un-playable I had the graphics settings dropped and entirely removed the crowd just to get to 25 FPS! 2K are you even serious NO CROWD AND STILL LAG SPIKES LIKE CRAZY?  The story line in the 'My Career' mode is sub-par at best and doesn't in any way feel connected to the gameplay. It's more or less a dramatic soap opera revolving around the family of an NBA star with hit or miss (mostly miss) writting and honestly unless you're gonna make an black kid from harlem for your created player you might as well skip all the cut scenes and get straight to the 2nd season.That being said I give them respect for trying something new and giving my man Spike Lee a shot at creating something, I can understand how they could've just given us the same old same old and we would've been fine with it but sometimes you swing for the fences and end up getting struck out.3/10 for the PC-port it's only barley playable and even it get's patched my whole love for this series just died with my experince so far. 2K just took my money and told me I was getting the same if not better game then on PS4/XBOX ONEAVOID THIS PC PORT DON'T SUPPORT DEVELOPERS WHO DON'T SUPPORT THEIR GAMES!

content:
Posted: November 2, 2015
												FINALLY, DID 2k GIVE PC PLAYERS THE ATTENTION THEY HAVE BEEN CRAVING about?!!! For the sake of this review I will be classifying it into two categories. -First is the offline experience, which was pretty good, but honestly what wasSpike Lee thinking about while designing this crap?!!  he impressively managed to ruin a game mode known for it's mind-blowing storyline. Nevertheless, it was a pretty good experience (From features perspective). 2- Gameplay: 2k NBA franchise still manages to give remarkable new player animations as well as the overall atmosphere from high intensity matches down to the vivacious crowd!!!!!  I can guess your having an urge to buy this game, but Please just wait for the second part. ONLINE GAMEPLAY 1-  I was shocked by not only laggy servers, but also the tremendous amount of cheaters in my park! 2- The online matchmaking system is simply atrocious, it's just plain simple you can't find a damn game!!!!  In conclusion, NBA 2k16 is a beautiful game which is must buy for enthusiastic NBA fans, only if you are ready to compromise the online modes and stick with the well designed career mode.

content:
Posted: February 16, 2016
												I recently purchased this game migrating over from 2k15. I have to say it wasn't worth the time or investment. I enjoy that it's current with what's going on in the NBA and providing roster updates. But, that's all you're paying for like any other sports franchise game. I haven't seen any significant changes besides crowd noise, a new commentator, and game lighting. I really enjoyed 2k15 and thought this game would be a game changer. No one on Steam plays online so good luck trying to use some of the game modes to face off against other people. I was very disappointed at that point. I recommend saving your money and waiting until next year's release.

content:
Posted: February 18, 2016
												Servers are trash; its a rare occasion where you can find someone to play against in myTeam, and in those rare occasions, you cant even play a single online game without lag. 2K thinks PC community is a joke by consistently proving that they do not care about players on the PC platform. For a game with the price tag of $60 you are better off buying a real basketball and playing in real life; at least you know that won't lag. Single player has improved from last year with the "off day" feature but even that isn't enough to compensate for the lack of respect towards the multiplayer aspect of this game. Overall 2/10 only buy if you want to play by yourself and experience the "acclaimed" Spike Lee "Livin' da Dream" which a 10 year old could've written better.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 30, 2016
												First of all I'd like to point out that my dad never stops playing this game (He's put around 100 hours into it) even though he can barely navigate the menu just because he hasn't played an NBA game in years so he's able to overlook the flaws. I've put significant hours into each even year game in the franchise starting with 2k10 and have more experience with these games to compare to. This is a very, very dissapointing game if you play it at any level more than a very basic level. Entrance into any game mode other than simply playing a pickup game will leave you with an incredibly disappointing experience. Some major issues I have:1. MyPlayer mode is a joke and not nearly as fun to play this year as previous years. I always love playing MyPlayer but this year I put barely an hour into it it's just not fun. If you want a fun MyPlayer experience I personally enjoyed 2k14's version.2. Every game strives to keep the difficulty at a level where you feel challenged while minimizing the sense that the game is bulls--tting you. This game does a TERRIBLE job of this. All-star and whatever difficulty is above that (the 3rd and 4th difficulties out of 4-5 i cant remember) are the closest to my skill range. That said, when I play either difficulty, I either win by literally 40-50 or I lose by 20, with literally nothing in between. The game appears to dynamically change the difficulty of the game based off of how well you play, but fails miserably in it's task. I've never won a game at one of the harder difficulties if I ever took an early lead. The game amps up the difficulty to the max and you get completely obliterated. At the other end, I seem to win about 90% of games that I fall far behind in as the AI starts just throwing the ball out of bounds each possession until i catch up. The result is a game that always feels like bulls--t and gives you no incentive to actually improve your skill when in fact a better strategy for harder difficulties is to actually play worse.3. I'm usually enticed to play a majority of the modes each game has to offer, with things like MyPark and MyLeague looking like fun modes to play. They weren't. Blacktop eliminated the ability to play with stars (although they may have removed this in earlier years and i didn't notice) and because of the 2-1 scoring format (as opposed to the 3-2 format of regular nba games) players like JJ redick basically guarantee you a win. To make things worse, some stars slipped through the cracks and dominate, like Dennis Rodman.In the end, the game looks pretty and is a fun game to play with your friends when youre bored, but for anyone wanting to enjoy playing the game any deeper, avoid this game like the plague. 4/10

Posted: July 12, 2016
												A father passing by his son's bedroom was astonished to see the bed was nicely made and everything was picked up. Then, he saw an envelope, propped up prominently on the pillow. It was addressed, 'Dad'. With the worst premonition, he opened the envelope and read the letter, with trembling hands.Dear, Dad. It is with great regret and sorrow that I'm writing you. I had to elope with my new girlfriend, because I wanted to avoid a scene with Mum and you.I've been finding real passion with Stacy. She is so nice, but I knew you would not approve of her because of all her piercing's, tattoos, her tight Motorcycle clothes, and because she is so much older than I am.But it's not only the passion, Dad. She's pregnant. Stacy said that we will be very happy. She owns a trailer in the woods, and has a stack of firewood for the whole winter. We share a dream of having many more children.Stacy has opened my eyes to the fact that marijuana doesn't really hurt anyone. We'll be growing it for ourselves and trading it with the other people in the commune for all the cocaine and ecstasy we want.In the meantime, we'll pray that science will find a cure for AIDS so that Stacy can get better. She sure deserves it!Don't worry Dad, I'm 15, and I know how to take care of myself. Someday, I'm sure we'll be back to visit so you can get to know your many grandchildren.Love, your son, Joshua.P.S . Dad, none of the above is true. I'm over at Jason's house. I just wanted to remind you that there are worse things in life than the school report that's on the kitchen table. Call when it is safe for me to come home!

												2k16 needs to fix this game, fast. Everyone I know over at the reddit.com/r/nba2k community agrees with me that the gameplay was made too difficult and that there are so many bugs in this game, this was by far the most sloppy release from 2k. I've been playing NBA2K for years and this feels like the most unrefined version of NBA2K ever, especially on the PC version. Rampant hackers, terrible story mode, gameplay was tweaked to be 'realistic' aka my gold and purple players can't make wide-open shots half the time.. Kevin Durant missing from 17' out on non-user mode is blasphemy.This is extremely dissapointing because NBA2K was originally made to be better than NBA Live, now EA is going to take advantage of NBA2K's miscue because their game had a terrible director (Spike Lee). The entire storeline is forced and feels borderline racist, as NBA2K doesn't seem to realize how diverse their audience is.Go play NBA2K15, 2K games needs to fix this game and improve it. Their ticketing system looks like it's disabled because they're probably getting so many complaints.

content:
Posted: November 2, 2015
												FINALLY, DID 2k GIVE PC PLAYERS THE ATTENTION THEY HAVE BEEN CRAVING about?!!! For the sake of this review I will be classifying it into two categories. -First is the offline experience, which was pretty good, but honestly what wasSpike Lee thinking about while designing this crap?!!  he impressively managed to ruin a game mode known for it's mind-blowing storyline. Nevertheless, it was a pretty good experience (From features perspective). 2- Gameplay: 2k NBA franchise still manages to give remarkable new player animations as well as the overall atmosphere from high intensity matches down to the vivacious crowd!!!!!  I can guess your having an urge to buy this game, but Please just wait for the second part. ONLINE GAMEPLAY 1-  I was shocked by not only laggy servers, but also the tremendous amount of cheaters in my park! 2- The online matchmaking system is simply atrocious, it's just plain simple you can't find a damn game!!!!  In conclusion, NBA 2k16 is a beautiful game which is must buy for enthusiastic NBA fans, only if you are ready to compromise the online modes and stick with the well designed career mode.

content:
Posted: August 30, 2016
												First of all I'd like to point out that my dad never stops playing this game (He's put around 100 hours into it) even though he can barely navigate the menu just because he hasn't played an NBA game in years so he's able to overlook the flaws. I've put significant hours into each even year game in the franchise starting with 2k10 and have more experience with these games to compare to. This is a very, very dissapointing game if you play it at any level more than a very basic level. Entrance into any game mode other than simply playing a pickup game will leave you with an incredibly disappointing experience. Some major issues I have:1. MyPlayer mode is a joke and not nearly as fun to play this year as previous years. I always love playing MyPlayer but this year I put barely an hour into it it's just not fun. If you want a fun MyPlayer experience I personally enjoyed 2k14's version.2. Every game strives to keep the difficulty at a level where you feel challenged while minimizing the sense that the game is bulls--tting you. This game does a TERRIBLE job of this. All-star and whatever difficulty is above that (the 3rd and 4th difficulties out of 4-5 i cant remember) are the closest to my skill range. That said, when I play either difficulty, I either win by literally 40-50 or I lose by 20, with literally nothing in between. The game appears to dynamically change the difficulty of the game based off of how well you play, but fails miserably in it's task. I've never won a game at one of the harder difficulties if I ever took an early lead. The game amps up the difficulty to the max and you get completely obliterated. At the other end, I seem to win about 90% of games that I fall far behind in as the AI starts just throwing the ball out of bounds each possession until i catch up. The result is a game that always feels like bulls--t and gives you no incentive to actually improve your skill when in fact a better strategy for harder difficulties is to actually play worse.3. I'm usually enticed to play a majority of the modes each game has to offer, with things like MyPark and MyLeague looking like fun modes to play. They weren't. Blacktop eliminated the ability to play with stars (although they may have removed this in earlier years and i didn't notice) and because of the 2-1 scoring format (as opposed to the 3-2 format of regular nba games) players like JJ redick basically guarantee you a win. To make things worse, some stars slipped through the cracks and dominate, like Dennis Rodman.In the end, the game looks pretty and is a fun game to play with your friends when youre bored, but for anyone wanting to enjoy playing the game any deeper, avoid this game like the plague. 4/10

It was addressed, 'Dad'. With the worst premonition, he opened the envelope and read the letter, with trembling hands.Dear, Dad. It is with great regret and sorrow that I'm writing you. I had to elope with my new girlfriend, because I wanted to avoid a scene with Mum and you.I've been finding real passion with Stacy. She is so nice, but I knew you would not approve of her because of all her piercing's, tattoos, her tight Motorcycle clothes, and because she is so much older than I am.But it's not only the passion, Dad. She's pregnant. Stacy said that we will be very happy. She owns a trailer in the woods, and has a stack of firewood for the whole winter. We share a dream of having many more children.Stacy has opened my eyes to the fact that marijuana doesn't really hurt anyone. We'll be growing it for ourselves and trading it with the other people in the commune for all the cocaine and ecstasy we want.In the meantime, we'll pray that science will find a cure for AIDS so that Stacy can get better. She sure deserves it!Don't worry Dad, I'm 15, and I know how to take care of myself. Someday, I'm sure we'll be back to visit so you can get to know your many grandchildren.Love, your son, Joshua.P.S . Dad, none of the above is true. I'm over at Jason's house. number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 20, 2016
												Very often after I finish a game (MyCareer), the game crashes. The whole thing just shuts down and I unwillingly return to steam with all of my progress lost. Since this happens a lot, I always wait until the saving animation in the botton right corner is complete. Sometimes this works but it could just be lucky, because other times it doesn't. Despite telling me my progress has been saved, when I enter back in to MyCareer the game restarts at the Pre-game show. There doesn't seem to be any way of stopping this from happening. If 2K could fix this I would be very grateful. On many occasions it's crashed after important games, such as the Playoffs (which is why i'm so annoyed).On a different note, the post-game show is pointless in my opinion and, although it adds realism to the game, it really pisses me off because I can't skip the entire thing. Rather, i have to wait for 5 or 10 seconds at each new part of the show, which wastes loads of time and is very boring. If you could add in a skip button (Start), that would be great.Thanks.Update: In MyCareer yesterday in the first game of the playoffs the game crashed after I won. The same thing happened today. Despite enjoying this game, i do not recommend this game any more.Consider me a lost customer of 2K. From now on, I will download cracked versions of future games as a middle finger to 2K because they don't deserve any more of my money.Up yours.Update #2: I followed steps to fix the problem but it's still happening, even after an official update. Useless, aren't you?

												If you like basketball, this is probably (at least in my opinion) the best there is atm.  The graphics are really good and the gameplay is solid.  My only complaint with this game is the cringy fest that is the MyCareer.  The story is really stupid and I really wish they stuck to how they did it in 2k13 (I think it was 13 where you basically just do interviews at the end of each game and that was basically the story while you go through the season).  There is also one huge complaint and that is the amount of microtransaction incorprated into the game.  While you can earn the coins free, there may be some people that play online who bought tons of the premium currency to max out their charcter without working on him.  Basically, its pay to win if you are playing online. Rating 7/10

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 26, 2016
												Please note in advance that I've spent a lot of time also playing a console version.Do I recommend this game? Sure, with a few asterisks involved.PROS:Great actual basketball play.Variety of offline modes.Runs smooth on my admittedly average computer.CONS: MyCareer. No, not the "racial" issue. The fact that it was sold as YOUR story when it is anything but. It's entirely Spike Lee's story. And honestly, I wouldn't mind that so much if, after, you're asked how YOU would have done things. For example, there's only a handful of colleges recruiting you. As good as you allegedly are, you should have every major basketball school in the nation coming after you. Notably absent (I am a touch biased in this regard) are ACC powerhouses UNC and Duke. What if I want to pull a Steph Curry and go to a relative unknown like Davidson? Nope, you take what you can get. Furthering issues is that your rookie year is shortened to 8 games, most of which are just placeholders for filler intros about playing against LBJ, returning home to Brooklyn, etc. On draft day, unless you've played other modes and/or bought VC, you'll enter the NBA as a whopping 55 overall. That isn't potential legend territory, that's roster filler territory. VC. Expect to grind for it or buy it if you actually want a useful MyCareer player.Remaining issues with the actual basketball play. From time to time, centers who have no real life skills beyond post play will nail wide open jump shots from beyond the 3 point line, while you'll attempt a driving layup against a smaller defender and...miss.

												The algorithm of the game ruined everything. I mean this is a good game in terms of its graphics and realish moves. However, playing the game from difficulty level All-star you always feel that you are battling with the algorithm written under this idea: if the player is in lead over 5 or 6 points, then the teamates become idiots, the opponent, whoever he is, becomes Michael Jordan. I am really♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ as you can tell from my post, by the algorithm since it is so robust and works every time I played. When you can sense that artificial thing, it is not a basketball game, it is just you playing against the programmer who wants to add some sparks into the game and twists your grasp of the game.

content:
Posted: October 9, 2015
												Let me start off by saying that ALOT has changed. My first impressions were decent of this game. MyCareer is my favorite mode, and they managed to make it somewhat dissapointing. How? by pumping up your player to be the next Superstar, but making him worse than a d-league player. It takes some real hard work to earn VC, but the real pain is that they wave a lot of VC points in your face in exchange for money. That's the equivalent of waving a juicy steak in your face, while you are poor as dirt. You can take the steak and eat it on the spot, or work at a dead end job that pays you way less than minimum wage, but you will eventually have enough to buy that steak. Beware! fun to play but also frustrating like opening a jar of golden nuggets. Oh, and also lots of bugs. LOTS OF THEM. Gameplay is weird sometimes, but overall a 8/10.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 17, 2015
												I love this game. Sure there are cheaters that max out players and challenge the integrity of the online portion, but you can't knock the realism of the game. It did have a rocky start, which was frustrating, but not knee jerking enough to ask for a refund (thats crazy that people did that). Mycareer is nice, great storyline for the first season. Contrary to popular belief you can be the #1 pick, and how well you play is taken into account. Love being able to invite friends to play on my custom court. Visuals are extremely well done. Controls are different but I am hoping people read "Revamped Controls", before they purchased. Glad they took away the supersample option in-game; prevents any more folks from destroying their frame rate. Post play is well done, and has a much better feeling of move-counter move. Will be even better once season rosters are finalized.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: October 1, 2015
												NBA 2k16 is not NEARLY as bad as all of these reviews describe. The two biggest issues being brought up are optimization, and Spike Lee’s “MyCareer” mode.  First of all, if your computer meets the system requirements, you can run all gameplay at a very smooth FPS. I have all graphic settings maxed and can run the game perfectly fine. The stuttering and lag being described in the reviews has ONLY occurred for me during the between-gameplay cutscenes, (introductions, timeouts, ect). While actually in game, everything runs better than ever, with smooth animations and high definition characters. The graphics are by far more superior to any previous installment. 2K decided to take a risk and use Spike Lee to write/direct the MyCareer mode. Like any other movie, Lee’s story centers around one character and his family. While you can make your character look any way you want, the story encourages you to be a young black man. If you don’t want to be black, you don’t have to be. It is not racist like some people say… it is just how the story is meant to be. Throughout 2K games, many people have hoped and wished that eventually they would have the choice to play through High School and College games. NBA 2K16 listened to its fans and delivered on this! Now everyone is complaining because it isn’t good enough… I on the other hand found that it complimented the story in a perfect amount of games (4 high school, 4 college). Between each game, the story progresses. The story itself is actually quite engaging! You feel emotion towards the characters IF you take the time to listen and watch the cut scenes. All in all, it is clear after completing the story (which I have) that Lee put in a lot of time and effort.Here is the main point I wanted to make about MyCareer. If you absolutely hate what 2K has done by implementing a more complex story, DO NOT WORRY! After your first season in the NBA (you play 8 games your rookie year), the story aspect ends. At this point, you play just like you would in 2K15. Taking on full seasons, talking to the press, signing endorsements, increasing your stats, ect. All of this, along with even more!  With those two issues being pushed aside, there are many positives in NBA 2K16. The music is the best I have heard yet, finally landing on many good & popular tracks. The customization has drastically improved, and all of the best modes are there. 2K will be releasing bug fixes and updates, so all of these negative reviews will hopefully be changing. As for me, I find it the best installment in the series, and have enjoyed every minute I have played so far.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 29, 2015
												For anyone on the fence about buying this game that enjoyed lasts years, Just buy it. I cant speak to the techinical problems that many others had regarding low frames in the menu and the like but as far as a basketball game this Is ROCK SOLID. The game is balanced extremely well and most of the exploits that you could use against AI have been fixed. I dont deal with people online so I cant speak to that experiance either, I just play offline and a lot of the MyGM and My Career modes. Speaking of my Career people are far to harsh on it. The first season is a write off as far as games/wins mattering and things like that but the story is pretty compelling and I find the acting and converstations far more believeable than anyhting 2K has written in the past. ONCE you get past the first year of your pro career (which consists of 8 games with story elements behind them) the game rolls into the traditional my career formula for the next years which is more or less the same as it was last year with one HUGE improvement. Off days now matter you have limited time  to get your star to being what you'd envisioned as far as endorsements,  skills, fans and everything else. For the first time in a 2k game your Star doenst feel Ignored or like he's on the back burner. what I mean by that is that the ingame personalities Reconize your Greatness, often have pre game converstaions about the crazy string of tripple doubles you've put up or your incredible shooting streak!. thats awesome! I even had one situation where at half time blake griffen was talking about how difficult it was to stop my Athletic gard for legimate reasons, not just generic "well hes really great player so hes difficult" its more taylord to what I do im a driving gaurd that shots a really high percentage from mid range so the converstaion was more about how difficult it is to gaurd me with the mid range shot. that is awesome I really feel like my player is the best player in the league and the league Reconizes it! that is a huge win in my opinion and has made me far more invested in my career.Preformance:for me the game is rock solid. I play it at 1440p and get anywhere from 100-130fps durring gameplay with all settings on High (supersampling on 1).my system is :i7-3770(non K) GTX 980TI game is running off a 500GB Samsung 850 evo SSD.I recomend this game to anyone who really enjoyed last years game. Improved in every aspect for me and my Offline experiace has been awesome.

content:
Posted: October 22, 2015
												Pros:  Customization in MyGM/MYLeague/MyTeam is awesome, you get to create anything your heart desires, Great TV-style presentation (Makes you feel like you are watching NBA on TNT), Game Modes (My personal favorite is My League), Great overall commentary, Graphics look really life-likeCons: Frame-rate stuttering (although on my I3 and Intel HD graphics processor, it is very notiecable because with the high-end games the graphics are not as good), My Career is somewhat of a let-down considering I had high hopes for this mode.Graphics: 9.5 out off 10Audio 9 out of 10Controls 8.5 out of 10Overall Score 7.5 out of 10 (basically I lowered the score because of the my career mode)IMO if you are a NBA fan and you only have a decent PC my advice is to buy this game RIGHT NOW or OTOH if you are a casual gamer or do not have a good PC my advice is to wait for a sale or to get a PS4 or XBOX 1 if you want this game!!!!BTW, this is Becky's son (I'm the one that plays on this account)

content:
Posted: December 5, 2016
												I really really wanted to like this game. I played it a lot. But I seriously can't take the game seriously with how many steals the CPU gets. Literally players and teams setting their season high for steals each game. Even with max Ball Handling (99) you can still get stripped every other drive as a 6ft shooting guard and get 10+ turnovers a game. Literally not even fun when the momentum mechanic forces you the computer team to ALWAYS come back in the 4th quarter with 16-2 runs EVERY time you are up in the game. Posted: June 20, 2016
												To make a long story short, download an emulator and then downlaod any nba live game or♥♥♥♥♥♥ Tecmo super nba basketball and you would have a game that controls better and the A.I. is better.  The NBA2k franchise is complete garbage.  Dribbling is awful, shooter ratings are irrelevant and the game is realistic if you put your pg at center and your center at pg.  Now for the ong review below.  This is verbatim my review of 2k15 and due to thiss eries still being♥♥♥♥♥♥ I will not touch 2k17.Well where to start? Basically this game is the same broken piece of crap that 2k sports has been repackaging since 2012. If you want a realistic or enjoyable basketball experience, go dust off something from the 1990s, this piece of ♥♥♥♥ sure isn't it. If you plan on playing this then be ready to watch players play out of position, clunky passing, in fact it's so bad that unless you select to do button command passing, you will turn the ball voer constantly. Player ratings seem to have little to no regard for performance and hell for that matter whether you're going to win or not has little to do with your "skill" at the game, rather the game's ai will just decide ahead of time whether you can win or not. If the ui decides it wants to win then be prepared for a sudden lapse in all skill in your star players as their ratings now mean ♥♥♥♥. Be prepared to watch your center and pwoer forward stand at the 3 point line, no matter what play you call and also prepare to watch as the ai walks away from a rebound or a defender mid play. In short, 2k sports is an awful company who already ruined their baseball franchise and they are a few years away from hopefully sports gamers waking up and stop paying full price for a new shine of polish on a turd. This game ahs it's fun monents but I can't reccomend this when it is essentially the same complaints since 2012.

content:
Posted: June 29, 2016
												I think that I have played this long enough to review it... Although I have to say that I haven't yet been able to understand well over half of it... With all of its different gsme modes, options, and ways to actually play it.Before this I have never owned a basketball video game before. No... I take that back. I owned Double Dribble for the original Nintendo back in the day. With Double Dribbles very cool and artistc "dunk" animations when going to the hoop and its quick passing and shooting I loved the game! I can remember that if you were to shooth the ball from any of the recognizable "assigned" possitions on the court you were guaranteed to make the basket... Be it a three or a regular inside jumper! It was getting the ball to those "key spots" that was the challenge and if you were good at moving the ball you could be virtually unbeatable!That being said I have only watched my friends play recent basketball videogames. I was never confident in myself to grab the controller and play (probably cause I absolutely $uck at real basketball). With the ability to create your very own team ie: logo, uniform, arena... Me being a graphics designer I went on ahead and bought the game for the sole purpose of uploading my very own custom logos. The actual "game" was just a bonus.I went on ahead and started a career just to see what it was like... Well it's like watching a basketball flick made by Spike Lee. Its exactly what you would expect... Basketball phenom growing up in the ghetto and rising above the horrors and the grim reality of it all! Its nothing special or unexpected... You have heard this story before and many times since. Although the story is ment to be moving it isn't... Not because the characters or plot doesn't matter, but because it's old news. Me being a white guy in an all black family dosen't bother me. It is what it is.  It's the been there done that scenario of the story that comes up short. I know the ending before the first high school game is even played. Its because of this that even playing high school ball, then college just feels like I am going through the motions! I'm like... "Yada, Yada, Yada... Lets get to the pros already! I mean the game is titled NBA2K right! That being said I do not know anything about basketball games to compare this to. It feels good... At least I think it does. I don't have anything else to compare it to except Double Dribble and in doing that Double Dribbles controlls feel more tight and responsive from what I can remember. If I said that passing, dribbling and shooting seem... Loose... Would that make any sense? Defense feels OK I guess. Its what I expected it to be... To confusing fro me to pick up really quick. I am gonna need to practice to be any kind of good, average at best.Its the ability to create your own team that makes me want to diouble click the NBA2K icon on my desktop! The uniform creator is off the hook! With my ability to create custom logos using all of the really expensive artsy, fartsy software that I own, I can craft me some incredibly, insane uniforms! After all... Creating athletic aparrell and uniforms is what I got my graphics design degree for! Im about 2 years I will be graduated with my masters and on my way to ADIDAS to work in the "Uniform Creation and City Culture" department... AND I CAN'T WAIT!!! I'm gonna actually use what I create in this game in my protfollio! Right now I'm working on a team dubbed the 'Louisville Colossus"! The mascot is an Elephant and the logo is SICK!!! What I would love to do is create logos and emblems for you guys... Gamers that don't have the ability to make your own logos! I would do this for free of course because it's what I love to do. It seems that whatever logos I create are uploaded to the the NBA2K website for all to use! What I'm gonna do is go crazy and make a ton of custom logos, grapgics and designs to upload to the site so anyone can benefit of my talent! It is what I bought the game for. I know it sounds weird, but doing this kind of stuff is what I LOVE to do and for me to be able to see my very own creations in a video game is just to good to not pass up! I have been wanting to do this for a very long time! I can remember watching my friends play basketball and football games thinking to myself that I could create WAY BETTER uniforms than the ones I was watching my friends use!Don't use this review to bease your decission on buying this game! PLEASE! Just know that I am gonna be uploading some very cool logos on NBA2K.com and if you wanna custom logo for yourself just friend me and let me know what you want. In the meantime I am gonna be working on some bird logos, wolf logos, elephant logos, letters, insects (bees, wasps, yellow jackets and so on), and other animal logos! All images will be under my Steam alias: The White Knight!Thank ou and I hope I make some logos that you and your friends will be able to use for creating your dream team!

content:
Posted: July 28, 2016
												The story of the great director known as "Spike Lee" began all the way back in 1818. Following the wake of the great Finnish depression, his father Petri Vehvilläinen II was unable to find a stable job - this led to a poor home. Spike's mother Mumin Vehvilläinen was consistently beaten by her husband, and constantly longed for a better life - away from Finland. She dreamed of one day becoming an actor in the United States. Once, when Spike was only 11 years old, Petri came home particularly drunk and violent. After discovering that his wife had been unable to produce a dinner which was up to his standards, Petri began aggressively beating her. Barely managing to escape with Spike, she left off for America.Initially, she found a job as a carpenter in downtown New York, but never gave up on her dream of becoming an actor. After meeting a wealthy individual by the name of Nicholas Cage, whom she became enamored by, she was given the opportunity to see her dreams come true. They lived the rest of their lives in Hollywood. Seeing this inspirational story led Spike Lee to become the greatest and most distinguished director of our time. His magnum opus, NBA 2k16, has been universally and critically acclaimed. His future repertoire includes such stunning pieces as NBA 2k17 and even NBA 2k18. In conclusion Spike Lee ♥♥♥♥ed this♥♥♥♥♥♥up, he stuck this whole franchise up his♥♥♥♥♥and when he pulled it out it was already covered in sticky♥♥♥♥♥♥ Please do not make a return in 2k17. Graphics 9/110Sound 10/10Gameplay 9/10Spike Lee 2/10

content:
Posted: August 5, 2016
												NBA 2K16 doesn't really need a review. It's the standard in NBA games, and pretty much has been since its first inception since the original NBA 2K.Once again, 2K emphasizes the career mode that puts you, a created rookie player, on a journey to become an NBA superstar. It's a fine mode, but the real reason anyone will get this game is to play simulated NBA matches. The game has a lot of nice touches that makes the game experience immersive. Sponsors, cheerleaders, and decent commentary and improved visuals makes this entry a little better than last years, and really that is all we as NBA game players expect from a title like this every year. The short version of an already short review would be: If you like to play proper Basketball in videogame form, this is the game for you.8/10 "Good"

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 21, 2016
												It is with a sad heart that i write this review. I never thought that i would be giving a NBA 2K game a bad rating. They had a winning formula that was used year after year, and continued to be enjoyable year after year. This year, things went bad, and it wasn't just one small issue but a multitude of problems plaguing this game. As a basketball game, the game works, but controls feel more unstable than previous iterations, defense is a nightmare, shooting feels like a game of chance. MyPlayer had a brilliant addition in the spike lee storyline in adding high school and college games, but cutting the rookie season down to 8 games made it dreadful. Worse than that, as of the current patch, the game crashes more often than Helen Keller would if you had put her behind the wheel of a car, thus erasing the previous game that you had played. 2K has avoided replying to this major issue that has plagued this game for the last month. I can only assume this is a business strategy to get people to move over to consoles and to buy NBA 2k17. TL;DR 2K broke an already ♥♥♥♥♥♥ game and refuses to fix it.
