content:
Posted: October 12, 2015
												NBA 2K16 by far has the best gameplay of any basketball game to date.There are so many game modes that'll get you engaged to this game such as MyPark, MyCareer, My League, My Team, MyGM, Online Leagues, etc.The gameplay has been improved compared to last year.It has the best AI (Artificial Intelligence) of any basketball game.Many people complain about Spike Lee's "Livin Da Dream" on My Career.but here's my thoughts on it...To be honest, I find "Livin Da Dream" to be ok if and only if you view it as a standalone movie.It's ok if you're just viewing it as the life of Frequency Vibrations.But the bad part about it is that you have no choice but to step into the shoes of Frequency Vibrations. Whoever player you create becomes Frequency Vibrations. It just didn't feel like the player I wanted to be. I mean I don't decide on stuff like he do. It just didn't feel like me.Maybe the advertising of "Be The Story" mislead some people on My Career.Maybe they should've advertised it as "Be The Story of Freq" or "Step into the shoes of Freq..." or something like that so that fans of My Career should not have been mislead to thinking of actually being the story or having to choose what story your player will have on the journey to the NBA. Instead, they gave us a fixed background story of your journey to the NBA.But Overall, MyCareer along with the whole game of NBA 2K16 is pretty good.This is a must buy for all of the basketball lovers who plays Bball on consoles, PC and stuff.

content:
Posted: November 19, 2015
												If you're a true fan of the series then you will have fun with this no doubt.  PROS:+ The gameplay is much more improved then previous titles and plays remarkably smooth.  + Player customization has improved slightly with the addition of more hairstyles and a better tattoo system.(Light skin players still look like cavemen)+ Graphics are on point as always, 2K does not disappoint in this aspect.(With the addition of SweetFX it can enhance your experience)+ Modes like MyGM and MyLeauge have been improved.  The off-season is one of my favorite parts.  Also you can relocate as many teams as you want in MyLeauge.  Since there are no college mods yet I decided to base each team off NCAA teams to add my own twist.  + Roster customization.+ Uniform and court customization is a plus.+ Soundtrack is good, not the best, but good compared to previous titles. + Runs smooth at a steady 60FPS on all high settings with the addition of SweetFX. (Tested on an i5 4690k, R9 280)CONS:- Little care to the PC online community from the devs. - Lots of cheaters, horrible matchmaking, and MyPARK is still a joke.  You can't even communicate with other players, there is no mic support online...what the ♥♥♥♥ 2K?  - MyCareer... I was so hyped for this mode but Spike Lee's involvement puts so many limitations on what the MyCareer should of really been, at least for your high scool, college, and rookie season... It was rushed and felt like I had no control over my player's decisions other then selecting which college I wanted to play for.  Anyways after your rookie season is over the actual mode is unlocked and just like the previous year it's the same with some slightly new additions.  This mode honestly gets boring after a while, 2K does very little in terms of detail and doing something during your off-season.

content:
Posted: October 5, 2015
												FINALLY WHAT 2K15 SHOULD HAVE LOOKED LIKE!Although that VC problem& many others they had on start - it's a way better game than 2K15. I guess 2K needed some competition from NBALIVE16 to wake up!The game is more realistic, the animations are smoother. Even cheaters with 99 will have hard time against you(And lose most of the time). New stuff like connections & practice days(Endorsement included). Of course a little bit lame story by Spike Lee(But it's okay). Good thing you can earn badges from Practice days if you earn GOLD on drills.Connections give you tons of stuff(but you'll have to choose on your free day - either this or practice or endorsements).You start with 55 rating, 1 of 3 highschools. After 3 games there you'll choose your college(9 will interest in you eventually out of 20) and play 4 games. Too bad you cannot skip the draft part. You'll play 8 games in your first NBA season with Spike Lee movie cuts.Those who cry about 55 rating start should not play - mostly noobs - IT IS THE BEST THING EVER. IT IS NOT PAY TO WIN. You'll have to earn it. You can actually earn pretty quickly VC from MC and also 2K APP.New interactive TV from 2K16. You are participating and answering questions while watching episodes!!!The Proam system a bit suck, but few fixes and it should run properly(NO MORE REC). Making your own team for playing in sort of your own court is a great thing.YOU ALSO GOT YOUR OWN COURT. You can practice, can invite friends and play(ALSO EARN VC on 1v1,2v2 and so on). You can also teleport them from your own court with you to Proam or Park.The Ante-UP this season is GREAT. YOU GOT JACKPOT YOU CAN WIN OVER 100K!!!Of course there are few glitches now & then - but overall it's GREAT.

content:
Posted: June 8, 2016
 É questão de ponto de vista É inegável que todo o marketing do jogo foi voltado para o Livin da' Dream a.k.a Vivendo o Sonho de ser um jogador profissional de basquete na maior liga do mundo e é ai que começou o erro da publisher. Livin da' Dream a.k.a MyCarrer não é tão mais MyCarrer assim, por isso a questão da casualidade é fundamental para entender o ponto de vista abaixo explicado: Enquanto a maioria dos jogadores busca no Minha Carreira, obviamente, desenvolver seu jogador do status mais baixo possivel até o momento em que se torna uma lenda, Livin da' Dream "quebra" esse contexto, apesar de te iniciar do High School, no final das contas nada importa jogar bem sua temporada de HS ou de College, ser campeão, pontuar, ter boas notas... você irá para a NBA de forma até chata, você terá o mesmo agente das estrelas ainda na faculdade, quando menos esperar terá uma namorada e seu próprio tenis, prestigio e fama. Tudo isso sem ter que fazer absolutamente nada.Mas ué? Onde entra o meu jogador?Para entender de uma vez por todas o que é Livin da' Dream, saiba que não é sua história, é a história de Freq. A questão é que Freq tem o seu rosto, sua altura, peso e tonalidade de pele. Isso torna tudo extremamente fora de contexto dependendo de como você criou seu personagem e toda essa falta de contextualidade torna a história desinteressante para muitas pessoas. Você escolhe apenas a sua faculdade.Pelo lado positivo, Spike Lee mostra muito bem o fator humano por trás da tentativa de se tornar um jogador profissional, os personagens são cativantes e o nível da história no geral é ok, só não leve tão a sério.Os outros modos de jogo são diversificados, além das partidas convencionais existe o MyPark onde se lembra dos tempos de NBA Ballers com o seu Personagem, o MyTeam a.k.a Ultimate Team com submodos muito divertidos, MyLeague, MyGM entre outros. todos cumprem seu papel.A personalização de quadras, logos, uniformes e qualidades gerais que envolvem um time é sensácional, slooooooow clap! O Gráfico, bom, é o jogo mais bonito que eu já vi e ainda tem uma performance invejável, diferente dos anteriores. O Grande problema é a quantidade de microtransações possíveis , é 2K ou EA? Nenhuma passa de itens visuais e cartas do MyTeam entretanto. Trilha Sonora: Another One.Resumindo: Como um jogo de basquete, é sim o melhor já feito, mas talvez não compense se você tem o 2K15, por exemplo, agora, caso você assim como eu esteja vindo do 2K13 ou anteriores, vale a compra sem a menor dúvida!

content:
Posted: June 3, 2016
												First sports game I bought day one since Madden 11 for the 360. Last sports game I buy day one until Madden or some sort of REAL football comes to PC. IDK how many hours I have put into 2k as a game company (not just b-ball) but it's a lot I will spare you the details, sufficed to say I feel they could do better. Step 1. Go to♥♥♥♥♥.com and purchase the game for much cheaper than retial...Step 2. Regret purchase and uninstallStep 3. Write this review detailing the steps I took to get hereSeriously though, the game is fun to an extent. Someone else said after the first myplayer, it's a grind well I say it is ALL A GRIND. The VC is more scarce and harder to get. They added more VC accomplishments but than they don't unlock. My character gets stuck in weird animations all the time. I can't skip cutscenes. IDK how many times I pressed start to skip a scene only to have it accidently take me to the park... The park... Dear God the park So the top guy shown on the loading screen is obviously a cheater. So is the second, thrid and fourth on down the line all 99 across the board. Some ppl are 7 ft tall and have the speed of I.T. (Boston Celtics P.G. now) and the quicks of A.I. mixed with the passing of J-will and Nash combined with the strength of Shaq in H.S. and Ben Wallace in his prime. Put all that mixed with the hops of that one nukka who pulled the 720 dunk on And One back in like '04 and you have a bunch of ultimate players that hardly pass the ball but know how to Kobe it up. You ever see that meme on FB where Kobe is sitting at the table and someone asks him to PASS the salt and he has that perplexed look like "WTF nukka pass?" That's EVERYONE in the park from day one because they are all the greatest players in a TEAM sport. 2v2 is a joke. 3v3 is fun but only until the mascot comes around skateboarding with Allen Iverson next to him. Or the topless CHICK. To be clear, you CANNOT be a Female character in this game UNLESS you cheat. They supposedly fixed the fact that noone could join anyone else's homecourt ever. My court was pretty cool looking. They did add some nice features but again it's a pain. The controls are different this year again... The story is just plain not needed. The always online mycareer is stupid and has been since day one. The reason I play mycareer is to play BY MYSELF in MY CAREER. I don't want it to be online if I did I would play it in online mode. That's why Madden has franchis online and offline OPTIONS. Madden doesn't force me to play my game online if I don't want to. All that to say this: I got banned a while back for apprently exploiting the same thing that A LOT of ppl did and that's fine the servers will be off in a year or so anyways. NBD. My issue is that there was NO WARNING. That's all I will say on that. I do reccomend this game especially right this moment as it's just 20 dollars. I do not recommend this game if you want to play my career, my park, my team or street. I recommend this game as a time killer. When you are waiting for your kids to get home from school, play this. When you got something to do but it's just 40 mins away, play this. JUST SO YOU KNOW: YOU CAN NO LONGER PLAY PART OF A GAME AND THAN SAVE AND EXIT AND COME BACK TO IT IN MYCAREER. Apparently the best way to stop people from exploiting minute bugs like the save and quit VC glitch is to take out one of the best parts of the game. I didn't cover everything because I don't want to bore you.....

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 27, 2015
												Would I recommend NBA 2k16? Absolutely! I'm not sure why so many people are hating on this game. It's the best basketball video game out right now. There's no denying that (I don't say this because I'm a fanboy or anything, it's just a REALLY good game). I haven't played everything yet, but I'll do a full review once the game is properly released. Anyways, here's my thoughts on the game so far.So everyone talking about framerate issues with this game. It seems to vary person to person. I've noticed a couple times where the framerate slowed down, but it wasn't anything game-ruining. Generally it lags when the crowd stands or something, but I find these lagspikes to be somewhat uncommon. However, we must all keep in mind that the game is currently in a pre-release stage. Chances are that  NVIDIA driver will release the day the game is going to fully released, and then all our lag problems will be taken care of (Hopefully). But for now, it's still playable and doesn't ruin the game.There's also a lot of talk about controls. I must say, the keyboard controls are horendous. It's basically impossible to use keyboard controls. A controller is pretty much recquired, which really stinks for those who have to buy one. Although, if you're a gamer, you should have a controller already. But you shouldn't be held responsible for the laziness of the developers. Other than that, everything is good. Smooth gameplay, easy controller use, all that good stuff. Except for passing. They changed how you pass, so it may take a while to get used to it. It's still playable though, and still quite a lot of fun.The graphics are amazing. There's a lot of options for video settings, which can make your game look as close to real life as games will ever get. The animations are spectacular. Everything interacts with eachother, which truly makes the game feel like real life.There are still micro-transactions and DRM, which some gamers absolutely dispise. Although the game is completely playable without a single in game purchase, it's easier to just buy the in game credits. And the DRM is just a one time connection, so it could be worse. Neither of these are major issues. The game is still fully enjoyable.So, that's my review. Analyze however you want, but here's the facts: NBA 2k16 is the best basketball video game in existance at the moment. If you want the best, here it is.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 9, 2015
												There are many improvements  and changes in NBA 2k16 that make this game feel like a different game than NBA 2k15.I started out with NBA 2k15 and straight away I could feel that the game was one of the best sport sims I had ever played. NBA 2k16 pickup where NBA 2k15 left off by tuning the game even more. Setting a screen is no longer just run to spot and press the button. If you are moving and setting a screen you will cause a foul resulting in a turnover. Blocking seems more genuine. I caught my self yelling out NICE!! when the AI denied a dunk. The animations are really awesome.The commentary is another thing that really makes the 2k games so good. They really build up the whole sports feeling and I love it. It's really great.But this release is not without flaws. You all have probably already read about MyCareer mode which isn't the story that everyone expected. I won't go into details but what you should know is that you are not playing YOUR future. You are playing an ongoing MOVIE and you have no impact on the story at all. The Spike Lee "experience" is just that, a movie and probably not what was expected. In that aspect nba 2k15 was light years better because you want options and different outcomes depending on the choices you make and reactions to what's really happening on the floor. Nba 2k16 is not that but it doesn't make this a great game.A second flaw are the bugs. There are just simply too many to be called a full release. Penalty shot, the camera pov starts to shake like there is an earthquake.. I'm guessing this is not intentionally as it's horrible when it happens (which is quite often). Fouls are called by the commentary but no fouls are given in game.  The list can be made long with bugs that will need to be fixed and probably are going to be soo to.The conclusion is that you are not paying for a full game at this stage. You are paying full price for a game in beta stage. There is no way around it. However, the game is really good. You can feel it through the bugs and glitches and once it's been tuned it will be one of the best games out there.  So I'm going to give this game 2 ratings. 6/10 out of the box as it is now. It's beta with too many buggs. 10/10 Once the big fixes have been rolled out, this is superb game. It feels like a new game, you'll have to relearn how to pass, dribble and take shots. The AI are smarter and will punish you for trying to run through traffic or make bad shots. NBA 2k16 is even more realistic than 2k15 and that is why although the game has some serious flaws as of right now, the potential and what it will be is simply too good not to get. But if you really get annoyed with unfinished games you should wait so that it does not ruin your game experience. Me on the other hand. I just couldn't wait and even though the bugs I'll keep playing nba 2k16 even though I'm still having fun with NBA 2k15 as the AI and the game mechanism behind 2k16 are just that much better.

content:
Posted: October 31, 2015
												Really didnt care for the mycareer mode. Story was somewhat interesting but did not provide enough backstory to fully engage me into some of the characters. I felt that in the mycareer, during rookie year, there was not enough time to gather enough skill points to actually make the player decent. Most of the time, your calls for passes are ignored and it is very difficult to score any points whatsoever. Your only chances in getting any VC is getting a good letter grade for the game or giving into the scam that VC is and actually paying money for it. Aside from the sloppy my player, the rest of the game is great. Defense seems more intuitive and offense is a real challenge. Forcing you to make better, smarter plays in order to succeed, which is very fun. Overall, great game that couldve been done so much better in the my player area.

I have it for some years now and it's 100% worth it.. Don't know anything about Spike Lee topic, so will avoid it.. I am not into MyCareer mode, so don't know about that.. Overall the games looks great, I have no lag issues and game is indeed more difficult and realistic, which is only fun! Some new controls for moves, but adjusted quickly! I recommend 100% and I am sure the game is well updated in 1 month or so..

												I was playing online with the multicourt option. In this game mode about 60 people can wander around 10 basketball courts. When you want a pickup game you line up by the side of the court and call next game. You can form a team and that allows actually multiple sets of people to call next game. They have a 4 on 4 court. Nobody plays it. The court takes forever to fill up. I left my avatar waiting at the court and started doing my dishes. Quite a long while later I realized that a group had formed a team in the team section and then another group had lined up on the other 4 spaces leaving me alone. I was first to the court and waited 20 minutes but the other groups walked out on the court and left me not playing. So in conclusion, yet another junky steam title, that I wont be purchasing. 44 gb and it isnt very good.

content:
Posted: May 13, 2016
												So many things was made wrong. I even dont know how to start this review. This all is refered to MyCareer. My player is an outside scorer, PG, 1.71m, has maxed stats and got already all necessary perks.Ok, and now tell me, why the shooting skill depends to a person's hight? Why a person who has 1.74m can not became so good in shooting as a person with 1.71m? I'm 1.87m in RL, made my first player with this hight and noticed then i can not reach a higher skill than 89. WHY? Thats a pure discrimination! AND WHY the game does not tell me that BEFORE I create a char and not even then when I reach the skill limit after weeks of playing?!?Shooting:Shooting in NBA2k16 is completly scripted and depends to the game's mood. Example: The game just started, after fews passes I'm standing free at the 3P-line, get the ball, the shot is A+ and its a miss. WHY? There are 2 option how to throw: player timing or % from the stats. I have player timing selected. Why I miss so often A+ shots? WHY? That isnt funny!!Futhermore a shot has a higher chance of success after a doublemove than without? WHY? In NBA2k13 I had a 80%+ throwing rating- in 2k16 42%. Really?Coach orders/tuts:The coach orders are a joke. Firstly, 70% of all orders aren't shown. Suddenly I get an F because I didnt done what the coach wanted. And thats several times per game! WHY the hell that is not fixed after so long time??Coach orders the second. There isnt completly nowhere an explanation of this orders. There isnt any explanation at all! "Bring the ball into the post and let the big men do their job". Post? Where is the ♥♥♥♥ing "post"!? In Germany "post" means "post office". Shall I screenshot the ball and send you a post card?!? Where is the "low post"? Where is the "zone"? Etc. pp. Not every ♥♥♥♥ing man on this world grows up with basketball. I i.e. grew up with soccer. I dont know the rules of BB, the field positions, the strategys, etc. pp. I just want to play some BB on computer. Where is a ♥♥♥♥ing tutorial which explans me everything I shout know about this game BEFORE I start playing??Cutscenes:There are so many cutscenes you can not cancel immediately. Every timeout I penetrate my controller in the hope the cutscene cancels soon, and have to wait anyway til Gatorade's surreptitious advertising was shown. REALLY? WHY!?Defense-AI:My team has the ball, I'm standing outside in the corner. I decide to run to the other corner. When I start running the oppenent who is guarding me starts running too - at the same time in front of me! I running down, he running down. I running up, he too - without looking back! He behaves like a mirror - like i would steer both. That dont even happens only in such case, it happen always and for ever! WHY?Passing:Def Rebound -> fastbreak. A player of my team is running to the offense, I see a free straight line to him, press the pass button and what happen? Right, he is suddenly turning to the basket, runs behind an opponent and my player passes to the position he got AFTER I pressed the button -> turnover. WTF!? That happens so often. SO OFTEN!! WHY!? And the biggest joke of this game is the other way round happens the same. I running a fastbreak in the direction to the outer line, get a pass and my player... right... runs to the basket out of my control! I can not stop him to do this! REALY? WHY!? I dont want to do a ♥♥♥♥ing dunk! I want to do a 3 point fastbreak! Got it? GOT IT!?This example represents the whole game: you have to have fun in the way of the developers. You even can not do your thing and enjoy the game like you want. You have to play this game like they want you to play, but in addition they dont tell you how. And that means a high frustration. They want you to play in manner of their imagin and there is not a single inch place for you!

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 18, 2016
												I have been playing NBA 2K games since the beginning and this is the worst one I've ever played.  Even setting aside the terrible myCareer Spike Lee disaster, the game just doesn't feel fluid like previous entries.OffenseAll the passing and player movements feel very mechanical and do not seem to map that closely to controller input.  The isometric moves are a joke that can't get you past even the worst defender.  The passing is terrible at targeting the right guy and I got super frustrated at watching my player coming to a dead stop to catch the ball during a fast break.  The pick and roll never works as the players cannot seem to set a pick to save their lives.  The control mapping to call plays was also unnecessarily complex even for quick plays.  Even the shot timing just felt...off.DefenseThe defense in this game is a joke.  Your AI teammates will stand around while the other team moves around them to the basket.  Playing defense myself, the AI will be stopped before making a jaring motion to the side that your player can't apparently handle regardless of your controller input, leading to an easy basket as your teammates wave them on.  In the myCareer mode with player lock, the arrow indicating who to guard cannot seem to decide who you should be guarding and, as a result, your AI teammates will randomly decide that you are responsible for the guy they were moments ago closely guarding.StyleThe layout of the menus in the game made it difficult to navigate and just looked flat.  The diagonal text for everything wasn't as cool as someone thought it would be.  Are we suppose to be playing the game with our head cocked to the left?  Even the 2k13 Jay Z gaudy layout was better.StoryI knew it was going to be bad and it met those expectations.  I like the attempt to innovate but this was a horrible overly scripted mess.  People want to feel like they are in control of a player rising into the NBA.  We do not want to be told some over dramatized story that is way to ridiculus to take seriously.This game felt so horrible that I have to uninstall it and reinstall NBA 2k15 to get the bas taste out of my mouth.  Seriously 2k, stop trying to reinvent the wheel everytime with the gameplay.  Focus on innovating the modes.  The myCareer this year failed but I would have been perfectly fine with it if the gamplay wasn't also this broken.
